loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida F., from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is 72 years old, widowed, and has four grown children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a business that makes and sells snacks and other delicacies such as rice and cheese cakes to the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed such as flour and eggs, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed such as flour and eggs

loans.name: Bikuweraki Women's Group

texts.en: Magumba N. is a 32 year old poultry sales business woman based in Jinja. She also sells eggs and young chicks. She says to start this business, she relied on savings from her food sales enterprise. The food business is still in existence and she says with earnings from it she has been able to increase her profit base. This business has now lasted two years and N. says it has called for a lot of determination and courage. Weekly, N. who is a mother to 4, says this business generates her shillings 100,000. She says with this loan she is going to buy layer chicken and chicken mash.

loans.use: The purchase of layer chicken and chicken mash.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum H. raises many piglets to sell when they are big enough, which is a popular job in the countryside. Sum H. has over three years of experience in raising pigs. Her husband generates an income by selling firewood. Sum H.’s husband uses his motor trailer to pick up firewood to sell in Baray. Now he wants to purchase a new plowing machine. He will be able to use the plowing machine in their farming business and can also use it to transport his items to sell. This is the reason that Sum H. would like to request a loan from Kiva. She is very happy and thanks the lenders who make her loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine.

loans.name: Jesee Muru

texts.en:
Jesse, age 30, has practiced farming in the town of Naivasha for the last two years. He and his wife, Juliana Wambui, have three children.  

This is the first time Jesse has accessed a loan from any microfinance institution. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to help pay school fees for his children. In future, Jesse hopes to become a leading farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa de unos familiares; no cuenta con servicio básicos, la cual se encuentra en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace 3 años José tiene su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual maneja llevando pasajeros a los diferentes caseríos de la zona donde vive, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1300 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento e implementación de su mototaxi que esta presentando algunos desperfectos y necesita tenerla en buen estado para que siga trabajando, ya que es el único medio con el que mantiene su hogar.  José es una
persona que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a podido conseguir que sus negocio crezca y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
José, 47, lives with his wife and child in the home of family members. The home does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of the Olmos district which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. The area's inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. 

José has had his moto-taxi for three years (a type of transportation used for traveling short distances, with a maximum occupancy of three people) which he drives carrying passengers to the various hamlets in the area where he lives. With the income he earns he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family. 

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 1,300 nuevos soles and will be used to provide maintenance and service to his moto-taxi which is showing some signs of age. He needs to have it in good condition in order to continue working, since it is the only means by which he supports his household. José is a person who through much effort and work has been able to make his businesses grow and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to maintain and service his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es: Quelita, de 53 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 63 años y su querido hijo Jason de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Quelita abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Quelita is 53 years old and is a simple, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Cesar, 63, and her beloved son Jason, 14, who she wants to give a better quality of life.  Everyday, very early in the morning, Quelita opens her grocery store to wait on her customers.  She is a very skilled saleswoman because she knows how to treat her customers and always finishes her sales convincing them to buy something more.  Her store is very well stocked since she is always concerned about buying the products that are needed.  The thing she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  She has been running her store for 2 years and thinks that the most difficult part is having to remain in her store all day, not being able leave. In the future, she hopes to expand her store facilities so that she can carry more products.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to save a little everyday to be able to pay off her loan.  In her communal bank she is very responsible and is always aware of the agreements among members.  With the one thousand nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] she will buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz, D. cincuenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. ElL. fabrica ropa D. cama y L. venD. en diferentes lugares, se ha hecho D. mucha clienteL. ya que su producto es D. muy buena calidad posee diferentes diseños y a buen precio; Paz siempre esta adelante D. L. competencia busca siempre lo novedoso y cumplir sus metas, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para sus productos como teL., hilos, agujas, algodón, bolsas D. empaque entre otros. D. esta manera Paz podrá seguir produciendo y no decepcionara a sus clientes, además tiene L. esperanza que con su trabajo podrá llevar seguridad económica al hogar y una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Paz, aged fifty-five, lives with her life partner and children in their own home.  She makes bed linens and sells them in different places.  She has many customers because her products are of good quality, have different designs, and are cheap.  Paz is always ahead of the competition as she seeks to keep things new, and she always meets her goals.  

She is an enterprising woman who is eager to get ahead, which is why she decided to ask for a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow her to purchase materials for her products such as fabric, thread, needles, cotton, bags for packaging and other things.  In this way Paz can continue with her production and not disappoint her customers.  She also hopes that her work may bring economic security to her home and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, cotton.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 38 years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is an electrician. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai has been running her general store since 2006. She sells a small range of goods such as snack foods and confectionery to people in the local community. Mai is requesting a loan to enable her to stock her general store with a wider range of basic goods. She hopes that this will assist her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract new customers.

Mai hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of basic goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es: Cenaida tiene 24 años de edad, separado de su esposo con quien tuvo 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Periavente baja del distrito de Pichari. A ella siempre le ha gustado ser la primera, ya que su éxito esta en las buenas prácticas de manejo agrícola, además toma en cuenta la importancia de la empatía, pues es donde hace sentir su presencia ante sus acopiadores más recurrentes. Es por ello que le resulta gratificante su negocio agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa café, que además de vender a un precio competitivo, tiene mucha demanda obteniendo buenas ganancias. Por lo general trabaja en compañía de su querida madre quien lo apoya siempre, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene que contratar peones para que faciliten el trabajo de extracción de su producto. Normalmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad.Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que puedan limpiar su parcela.
texts.en:
Cenaida is 24 years old and separated from her husband with whom she had two children.  She lives together with her children in her own home which is located in the village of Periavente, in Pichari district.

Cenaida has always enjoyed being first.  Her success lies in the good farm management practices that she employs.  She also bears in mind the importance of empathy and this is where she makes her presence felt amongst the middlemen she deals with most frequently.  This means that she enjoys her farm work, producing and selling coffee.  As well as selling her produce at a competitive price, Cenaida has a lot of demand and this makes her good profits.  In general she works alongside her dear mother who always supports her.  However, during harvest season she has to hire laborers who make her picking easier.  Normally she sells her coffee to middlemen in her community.

This is Cenaida's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to hire laborers to weed her land.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group

texts.en:
So the tale goes that every entrepreneur has their own watershed moment. Fifty-five-year-old Kaloli says his moment was 26 years ago when his current business, clothes sales, in Mityana took root. 
From the threshold, he was hard pressed in the fast-track pace of his enterprise. Nothing, especially from a business point of view, can grow by leaps and bounds unless it’s under the auspices of some pillar of support. Kaloli faced considerable odds in obtaining a firm footing for his business. 
What was of overriding importance, notwithstanding the odds, was the fact that his business had indeed taken root. 
Kaloli explored all avenues to find success. He met with checkered success; it has been a long drawn out road for Kaloli. What has made his business secure is the fact that he has been able to restock his boutique when he runs short of clothes.  On the side, Kaloli also ekes out side income from his farming business. He says his clothes sales enterprise generates him weekly sales revenues totaling Uganda shillings 100,000.
He has banked on invaluable winning calling cards, by being assiduous and determined.  
Kaloli says he intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune , membre d'une famille de 12 personnes.Il n'est pas marié et pratique le métier de carreleur avec lequel il gagne des marchés dans toute sa localité.Il arrive ainsi à entretenir la famille et même à employer des jeunes auxquels il apprend en même temps le métier.Afin de diversifier ses activités et d'augmenter ses revenus, il vient d'ouvrir une boutique pour la vente de téléphones portables et d’accessoires. Il sollicite ainsi un crédit de 50000F pour acheter des accessoires téléphoniques (kits oreillers, pochettes, batteries...).Les bénéfices tirés de son commerce lui permettent de mieux entretenir sa famille .Son ambition est d'acheter un véhicule pour faciliter ses déplacements professionnels.
texts.en: This borrower is a young man, part of a family of 12. He is not married and is a tiler by profession, which allows him access to all the markets in the area. He is thus able to support his family and also employ the younger members, whom he trains. In order to diversify his activities and increase his income, he has recently opened a store to sell mobile phones and accessories. He is thus seeking a loan of 50,000 F to buy phone accessories (headsets, cases, batteries, etc.) The profits from his business allow him to better support his family. His ambition is to buy a vehicle to facilitate his business trips.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories (headsets, cases, batteries, etc.)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from the village Mashavera, East Georgia. She is 63 years old, married and lives with his husband, Anzor. Anna and Anzor are bee-keepers. They have 30 bee-hives with bee-colonies and sell on average 450 liters of Honey per year. They sell it locally, retailers, as well as to the local population. Along with the bee-keeping business, Anna is busy with trade. She has a grocery store in the village, where she sells various grocery products.

Anna has requested a loan to increasing the store's inventory. She will increase the assortment of products in the store. It will increase sales and consequently the profit of the business. Anna plans to use the increased income for further expansion of the bee-keeping business through purchasing of additional bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Katia es socia del banco comunal  Madres coraje, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es transportista (chofer).
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales, en un mercado de la zona. Con este trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos que tiene en la casa y/o en el colegio de sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,100.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de ají dulce, 50 atados de culantro de la región, 2 cientos de caiguas, 2 kilos de ají charapita, 20 atados de vainitas de la región.
Estas son las verduras de estación y tiene que aprovechar en venderlas porque está en su tiempo y puede tener buenas ganancias, su esposo es el que la acompaña en horas de la mañana al mercado con todos sus productos  para poder trabajar.
Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad de poder tener su negocio y sacar el mayor provecho posible, sabiendo invertir adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the 'Madres Coraje' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Katia has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  Her business is selling regional vegetables at a market in her area.  Through this work, she is able to help her husband with some of the expenses that they have at home and / or at their children's school.

Katia will use this new loan for 1,100 soles to buy one sack of 'ají dulce' (sweet peppers), 50 bunches of regional cilantro (coriander), two hundred 'caigua' (stuffing cucumbers), two kilos of charapita peppers and 20 bunches of regional string beans.  These are seasonal vegetables and she must take advantage and sell them because they are in season and she can make good profits.  Her husband accompanies her to the market in the morning with all her produce so that she can work.

Manuela Ramos gave Katia the opportunity to start her business and also to make the most of it, knowing how to invest.

loans.use: to buy 'ají dulce' (sweet pepper) and regional cilantro (coriander)

loans.name: Titomangba (Cite) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TITOMANGBA (CITE) est composé de deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Albertine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Albertine est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Albertine est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Mimoune. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Albertine et son mari répondent ensemble aux besoins de leur famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Albertine mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de sacs de maïs. Albertine s’approvisionne  dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Albertine sollicite ensemble avec Naïmatou le second membre du groupe TITOMANGBA (CITE), un sixième crédit.
texts.en: The Titomangba (Cite) group consists of two people who live in the same district. They are requesting their sixth loan from ALIDé so that they can invest in their businesses and raise their level of activity. Albertine, the group's representative, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher called Mimoune and the couple have 3 dependent children who all go to school. Both parents take care of the family's needs. Albertine has been selling bags of corn for the past 10 years in order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her children, and she gets her supplies from her local market in Benin. She and Naïmatou, her fellow Titomangba (Cite) group member, are making their sixth loan request so that they are able to increase their customer satisfaction levels and raise their business revenues.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn for resale.

loans.name: Elia Aurora

texts.es:
Elia D. 69 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, ya no cuenta con hijos dependientes, su casa cuenta con los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad el comercio, agricultura y ganadería.  

Elia se dedica  a la venta D. verduras en interior del mercado D. la zona donD. vive, con una experiencia D. muchos años, es por eso que es conocida y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas D. sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad D. verduras y realizar algunas mejoras en el interior D. su casa, el aumento D. sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones D. casa.  Elia es una persona que a pesar D. sus años sigue adelante y con muchas ganas D. trabajar para seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Elia, 69, lives with her husband in her own home. She no longer has dependent children. Her house has water and electrical service and is located in the San Pedro D. Lloc district belonging to the department of La Libertad. This area's main economic activities are commerce, and crop and livestock farming.  

Elia devotes herself to selling vegetables insiD. a local market at which she has many years of experience. Thus she is well known and has her own clientele. Her sales have been increasing along with her income to improve her quality of life. 
 
The loan she requested from Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla was for 2,000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of vegetables and make some improvements to the interior of her home. The increase in her sales will allow her to cover her loan and meet her household obligations. Elia is a person who, in spite of her years, continues on with a strong will to work to keep improving in life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of vegetables and make some improvements to the interior of her house.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy  used her first loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale in her grocery business. She was able to sell them and it was very profitable.

This is her second loan and she plans to use the loan amount to boost her business by buying more fruits.

In the future, Lucy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hedalie

texts.en:
Hedalie is married with 3 children. Hedalie is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Hedalie owns and operate a banana and copra production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earn PHP 2,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase pesticides and to pay the costs of banana planting.

Hedalie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Hedalie hopes to expand her production business and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and to pay the cost of banana planting.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old.  He is a businessman and is married to Zipporah, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and wheat flour to add to his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar and wheat flour to add to his shop

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur trades in clothing and household goods from a rented booth in a city market. Artur needs some financial investments in order to expand his business. With the requested loan Artur plans to purchase more goods to sell. Increasing the product variety will allow Artur to improve his business's income. This will help Artur to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a sustainable future for them. Artur lives with his wife and two daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothing and household goods to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used his previous loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy welding rods and metals. With the additional stock of raw materials, he has managed to make more metallic doors and window frames.  This has allowed him to attract more customers. His desire is to expand his business and grow his clientele.

Daniel has requested another loan of 80, 000 Kenya shillings to buy more raw material such as metal.

loans.use: to buy metal.

loans.name: Sergio David

texts.es: El señor Sergio a sus 25 años de edad es un emprendedor que inicia con su propio negocio de venta de gorras a sus amigos del colegio con el fin de poder generar ingresos para ayudarle a su familia. Hace algunos años, su hermano abrió un local y en este el señor Sergio trabaja como vendedor, a la par utiliza un pequeño espacio del local de su hermano para vender sus sombreros (gorras) y generar sus propios ingresos. El señor Sergio desea comprar surtido para su negocio para la temporada de fin de año y así mejorar sus ventas y cumplir con su sueño de ser un gran distribuidor de sombreros en su pueblo.
texts.en:
Sergio is 25 years old and is a an enterprising man who started his own business selling gorras [hats] to his friends from school. He started his business to generate an income to help his family. A few years ago his brother opened a store and that is where Sergio works as a salesman. He uses a small space in his brother's store to sell his hats and to generate his own income.

Sergio decided to purchase supplies for his business for the holiday season so that he can increase his sales and accomplish his dream of being a large distributor of hats in his town.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of gorras [hats].

loans.name: Sam Eng

texts.en:
Sam Eng, 37, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow agricultural crops to generate income to support the family. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Farming is the main source of the family’s economy and that’s why Sam Eng needs more funds to improve her business. 

Sam Eng is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase farming land to grow more agricultural crops to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farming land to grow more agricultural crops

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Higinia quien invito y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundacion. Y de esa forma poder ayudarse por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La sra. Higinia esta separada hace varios años tiene 6 hijo todos mayores de edad. Ella comenta que se dedica a la costura, trabajo gracias al cual ha podido ayudar a su familia y tambien a criar a sus hijos. Ella comenta que le va muy bien, debido a que hace muy buenos trabajos y eso la ayuda a tener mayor clientela.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de elementos de su trabajo (telas, hilos, goma, tijera, acesorio de costura y demás). Tiene como meta comprar dos maquinas de coser y de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos y tambien ayudar a las personas de su barrio dando trabajo.
texts.en:
Higinia started the current group.  She invited and organized her friends to be a part of the Committee for Enterprising Women of the Fundación.  This way they are able to help each other by working together.

Higinia has been separated for several years.  She has six children; all of them are adults.  She says that she is a seamstress.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help her family and raise her children.  She says that it is going very well for her due to the fact that she does very good work.  This helps her to have more customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy work supplies (fabric, needles, glue, scissors, sewing accessories, and other items).  Her goal is to buy two sewing machines.  That way her income would increase, and it would also help other people in the neighborhood by giving them work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, glue, scissors, sewing accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a 42-year-old man with five children, all attending school. Paulo is a rural farmer and rears pigs to earn income to cater to his family's needs. He has mobilized clients from different areas to buy pigs for slaughter. Paulo is grateful that he can access funds to buy more pigs to increase his stock and therefore his sales. He also thanks the Kiva lenders for the good job they are doing. He is hard working. 

He also does coffee trading to supplement his income and was motivated by the profitability of the business. He hopes to use the loan to boost his bar business and also expand it. However, he faces limited capital, which hinders the growth of his business.

He is an honest man and asks lenders to pray for him so that he can pay well and be able to come back for the next loan.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: God's Way School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Henry. He is the Director of God’s Way High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kagoma in Wakiso with 600 students. God’s Way High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

God’s Way High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Henry ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the group secretary Karura Mwangaza Women Group. She is married with three children; she is an active member and the secretary of her church.

Mary grows and sells cabbages, Kales and onions to nearby schools and hotels in Wangige-Kiambu. Apart from that, Mary rears dairy cows and sells milk to a local Dairy cooperative society and hotels.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy Onions and cabbages from other farmers because she has won a tender to supply these items to Kanunga High School.

loans.name: Luisa Mercedes

texts.en:
Luisa is a single mother and grandmother. She looks after her four children, aged 21, 16, and two 15-year-olds, as well as a two-year-old granddaughter. They live in a 2-room home made of tin roof sheets and wood. Just down the street, Luisa is creating a closet-sized clothing store. Shirts and pants hang along the walls outside on display. Inside the shop are used clothing and shoes. She has a small selection at the moment, but with this new loan she will be able to afford more, to meet the needs of the surrounding communities.

Her goal is to use the profits from this loan to create a self-sustainable business. She wants to have enough money to buy medicine for her granddaughter, who has respiratory problems and poor blood circulation.

Luisa's hope is to work her way out of poverty and out of her house - a space equivelant to the size of a minivan for a family of six. This motivation, combined with her business training and reputation within her community, have made her a very good candidate for a loan.

NOTE: Luisa has many friends in the community and is a leader of her solidarity group, called 'La Union'. She represents four other microentrepreneurs, who will each receive an equal $150 share of this $750 loan to invest in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, sandals and apparel for her new shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his charcoal selling business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is married and has three children. Her husband works as a teacher in a small school in the town of Creel, in the state of Chihuahua, which is where they are from. In order to have an extra income that would help them improve the quality of life for their family, Magdalena began selling used clothes 10 years ago. It is the good service that she offers her customers that has allowed her to stay in business for such a long time.

At the moment, Magdalena needs a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy merchandise to increase the variety of products she offers to her clients and thereby increase her income. She promises to return the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part of her business. Decide to help Magdalena, she and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo se desempeña como maestro en una pequeña escuela de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua, de donde son originarios, para obtener un ingreso extra que les ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Magdalena inició con la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años, el buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes le ha permitido estar en el negocio durante tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos Magdalena necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en su negocio, decídete a ayudar a Magdalena, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 37 years old and has an electric goods shop in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan of $1200 to purchase new goods for his shop. He lives with his mother and father. Both of them are not working. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income and enhance his living standard.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en:
Leotele is a 27-year-old mother of one daughter. When she was young, she learned the retail shop business from her parents who also ran a shop. Now, she is trying to build a bigger and better shop for herself by working very hard.

She started off with a $300 USD loan, which was used to stock her shop, which at that point was just laying out products on tables outside. Then, she applied for her second loan of $440 USD, which was used to build a small room to sell her products. This has allowed her to sell more products.

Her business is growing well and she is developing more and more business skills through her hard work and devotion. She hopes to remain with SPBD’s loan program for a long time and plans to receive more loans in the future.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Julia Lilly

texts.es:
Eighteen years ago, Julia decided to start a business in the wholesale market of the city of Managua. She started with a capital of CS$2,000.00, fruit of her savings. Before that, she worked as a maid, but the work was hard and the pay very little. This is why she decided to save and take the risk to start her own business. Thanks to her vision of the future, Julia has been able to succeed. She is the only support of her household which if formed by her and her father.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years, time during which she feels that thanks to this support she has been able to grow, increasing her inventory and obtaining higher profits. Her record has 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

JULIA HACE 18 AÑOS DECIDIÓ PONER SU NEGOCIO EN EL MERCADO MAYOREO DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA. COMENZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$2,000.00 FRUTO DE SUS AHORROS. ANTERIORMENTE ELLA SE DEDICABA A TRABAJAR DE EMPLEADA DOMESTICA, SIN EMBARGO EL TRABAJO ERA MUY FUERTE Y LA PAGA POCA, RAZÓN POR LA CUAL DECIDIÓ AHORRAR Y SE ARRIESGO A PONER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO. GRACIAS A SU VISIÓN DE FUTURO JULIA HA LOGRADO SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SOSTÉN DE SU HOGAR QUE ESTA CONFORMADO POR ELLA Y SU PADRE.

CON CEPRODEL LLEVA DOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO, TIEMPO EN EL QUE ELLA SIENTE QUE GRACIAS A ESTE APOYO HA LOGRADO CRECER, INCREMENTANDO SU INVENTARIO Y OBTENIENDO MAS GANANCIAS. SU RÉCORD ES DE 10 CRÉDITOS

loans.use: Buying merchandise (COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA)

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Mrs. Noemí B. is 32 years old and is married to Mr. Raúl Altamirano, who is 36 years old. They have lived together for 13 years and have a son in school.

When Noemí was very young she traveled with her mother to Argentina to work. While there she met Raúl and they got married and began to work very hard together for many years. The big hope of Noemí at this time was to return to her country and start her own business

Seven years ago Noemí returned to Paraguay. With the money that she and her husband saved they bought a livestock transport truck for her husband and she opened a car wash in the center of the city.

Thanks to the income they have generated from both businesses they were able to buy another truck. Today she is asking for a loan so that they can buy an air compressor for the car wash, now that every day she has more clients at the wash.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Noemí B., tiene 32 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Raúl Altamirano (Argentino) de 36 años de edad, llevan 13 años juntos y tienen un hijo en edad escolar.

Noemí cuando era muy joven viajó con su mamá a la Argentina para trabajar, ahí es donde le conoció a Raúl, se casaron y empezaron a trabajar duro juntos durante varios años. El principal deseo de Noemí, en ese tiempo, era volver a su país y abrir su propio negocio.

Hace 7 años que volvió a Paraguay, y con el dinero que ella y su esposo ahorraron compraron un camión transportador de ganado para que trabaje su marido y ella montó un lavadero de vehículos en el centro de la ciudad.

Gracias a las ganancias que generaron ambos negocios pudieron comprar un camión más. Hoy solicita un préstamo para la compra de un compresor de aire para su lavadero, ya que cada vez tiene mayor cantidad de clientes en su lavadero.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en: Zuhra is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in Dushanbe,Tajikistan, and her trade place is located in the big clothing market "Korvon". She buys her goods from local wholesale market at a cheaper price and earns some profit. Currently she has a good assortment of goods and her business is going well. During our partnership she has repayed her loans on time. Her assets are growing monthly and now she is requesting a loan for buying a new batch of goods.

loans.use: Buying new batch of socks and children clothes

loans.name: Hj. Minah

texts.en: Hj. Minah is 53 years old and married to H.Q., who has no regular job. To meet her family's needs, she earns $5 a day selling clothing on credit door-to-door. Hj. Minah is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more clothes to sell. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nubia Elvira

texts.es:
Mrs. Nubia O. is a 43-year-old woman who works in retail. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her husband, who also works in retail. They have a 25-year-old daughter. She and her husband sell clothing in the districts for a living. Her husband started this business before getting married. When they got married, they both moved the business forward. They have had this business for 30 years now, and it has become the family’s means of support. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase wholesale merchandise in the markets, then go out into the other districts to sell it. Working together, they have been able to obtain many customers, especially the stores that prefer to order clothing from them instead of coming to the capital city to make their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Nubia es una mujer dedicada al comercio, de 43 años de edad, vive en el Barrio de Laureles Sur junto a su esposo quien también se dedica al comercio, tienen 1 hija de 25 años de edad. Su actividad es de venta de ropa en los Departamentos junto a su esposo. Este negocio lo inició su esposo cuando aun no estaban casados y al casarse empiezan a sacarlo hacia delante juntos y ya tienen 30 años en el negocio y les ha brindado el sustento diario de la familia. Solicita el préstamo para capital de trabajo, comprar mercadería al por mayor en los mercados y salir a los departamentos del país a venderlos, trabajando juntos han logrado tener una gran clientela en especial de tiendas que prefieren encargarle a ellos la ropa de venta, en lugar de venir ellos a la capital hacer dichas compras.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale merchandise to sell it in the different districts of the country

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Mr. Agustin lives in the area of Cotahuma, which is one of the poorest areas of the city of La Paz. Mr. Agustin is a man who is very committed to himself. Before, he used to sell electric appliances, until he decided to obtain a loan from our institution. With the loan that was awarded to him, and with a lot of work, he was able to buy a taxi cab. With it, he works as of very early hours in the morning in order to bring home a bit more earnings to his home. He still keeps up with his job selling appliances, and that is precisely why he needs more financing- to be able to reach his goals and invest in the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Agustin vive en la Zona de Cotahuma que es una de las zonas mas pobres de la Ciudad de la Paz El señor Agustin es un señor muy comprometido consigo mismo, antes Él se dedicaba a vender aparatos electrodomesticos, hasta que decidio obtener un crédito en nuestra institucion. Con el crédito que se le otorgo y con mucho trabajo logró comprarse un taxi, con el que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para poder llevar un poco mas de ingresos a su casa El mantiene el trabajo de vendedor de artefactos eletrodomesticos, y es justamente esta razon por la que necesita de mas financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo sus metas, ademas invertira en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo.

loans.use: Will purchase appliances to sell and will give maintenance to his taxi

loans.name: Pihenewe Yawa

texts.fr:
Pihenewe Yawa P. is 42 years old, married, and a mom. To provide for her family's needs, she buys and resells poultry -- hens, roosters, and other birds for consumption. With this loan , Ms. P. hopes to strengthen her commerce by buying poultry and also to expand her enterprise by buying pigs for retail sale. With the profits she is going to make, she can improve her family's living conditions in Kpalimé, Togo.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Pihenewe Yawa P. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille elle achète et revend les volailles – les poules, les coqs et les autres oiseaux pour la consommation. Avec ce crédit, Madame P. espère renforcer son commerce de l’achat des volailles et aussi agrandir son entreprise avec l’achat des cochons pour les revendre. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager, elle peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille à Kpalimé, Togo.

loans.use: To buy poultry and pigs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
For the last two months, Carmen has sold nutritional weight-loss “Herbalife” brand products. Previously she worked as a secretary. However, she got to know Herbalife and as a result decided to leave her job and enter into business. Now she is a wholesaler of these products and invites her acquaintances to join her in business.

Carmen is constantly familiarizing herself with respect to Herbalife’s nutritional products, as this way she can secure sales.

The loans which she has asked for have served to allow advance payment for these products. Carmen wants to continue expanding as a saleswoman inside Herbalife’s Company.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 2 meses, Carmen vende productos nutricionales para bajar de peso de la marca Herbalife. Antes se desempeñaba como secretaria. Sin embargo, conoció Herbalife por lo que decidió abandonar su trabajo e incursionar en esta empresa. Ahora ella es vendedora mayorista de estos productos e invita a sus conocidos a participar de este negocio.

Ella constantemente se actualiza con respecto a los productos nutricionales Herbalife, para así hacer que sus ventas sean seguras.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para pagar por adelantado estos productos. Carmen quiere seguir creciendo como vendedora dentro de la empresa Herbalife.

loans.use: To allow advance payment for the Herbalife products she sells

loans.name: Sikiratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sikiratou S. was born in 1963 in Tabligbo, in the Yoto prefecture in the coastal region of Togo. She is a married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling cosmetics since 2002, and she always helps her husband pay the family’s expenses. During the summer vacation period, she would like to increase her supplies in order to sell a large quantity of them and pay for a part of her children’s education. She is thus requesting this second loan, after quickly repaying the first loan she received, to purchase four boxes of lotion and two boxes of other beauty products.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame S. Sikiratou est née en 1963 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto dans la région maritime au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques depuis 2002. Elle aide toujours son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Pendant ces vacances, elle désire augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre et supporter une partie des frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce second crédit après un prompt remboursement du premier pour acheter 4 cartons de crème et 2 cartons d’autres produits de beauté.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en:
Milijana is a young, unmarried woman. She lives in the town of Derventa. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475). She works in a boutique, and she typically earns approximately 350 KM per month.

With the loan proceeds, she plans to buy new clothes and to sell such clothes from home. In fact, she has experience in the sales industry, so she thinks that she can earn more money by operating this other business after work. She states that she needs this loan because her current income is insufficient to support her and her family members.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mariam M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania!

This is 45-year-old Mariam H.. She is married, and has four children aged between 10 and 32. In 2004, Mariam established her phone/voucher business. She opens her business 7 days a week, and 9-12 hours a day. She is assisted by her children. Mariam requires a loan in order to purchase more vouchers in bulk. In the future, Mariam plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Irma Felipa

texts.es:
Irma tiene 23 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada, madre de tres hijos menores de edad, (dos varones de 06 años y 09 meses y una mujer de 05 años de edad) y vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia el Collao, Puno.

Desde hace dos años integra el Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo. Con su crédito inicial de S/. 300 compró 01 oveja con S/. 150 y 02  porcinos con S/. 150. A los 15 años de edad empezó a elaborar trencillas y los vendía en la ciudad de Ilave los días domingo, generalmente vendía en paquetes a S/.17.00 (en esa fecha). Actualmente se dedica al engorde de porcinos y ovinos, negocio que empezó con los créditos del Banco Comunal.

Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 02 ovinos con S/.300 y 02 porcinos con S/.300 para engorde y su posterior venta.

Su sueño es comprar más terrenos en el campo para sembrar avena y alfalfa para engorde de vacunos, ovinos, porcinos y también que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Irma is 23, finished elementary school, she is married, has three young children (two six year and nine month old boys and a five year old girl), she lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, Collao, Puno. Two years ago she joined the community bank “June 24th” in Alintuyo. Her initial loan of $100 was used to buy 1 sheep with $50 and two pigs with the other $50. At age 15 she started making braid beads and sold them in Ilave on Sundays, generally at $6 per package (back then). Currently, she raises pork and sheep, business that she started with loans from the community bank. With this $275 loan, to be repaid in three months, she has planned to purchase two sheep and two pigs to raise and sell. Her dream is to purchase land to grow oats and alfalfa to feed the cattle, sheep and pork, and also to see her children get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El Sr. Orlando R., pequeño productor y socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza junto a su esposa se dedican a la produccion de arroz por esfuerzo propio con 4 Mzs establecidos en el ciclo secano; diariamente a tempranas horas el Sr. R. atiende el manejo agronomico de su cultivo acompañado de su esposa en estas actividades.  A traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de acceder como socio de la construccion de 1 trillo arrozero, lo que le permitira reducir sus costos y llevar su cosecha hasta el final y asi obtener mejores beneficios de su cultivo; su vision del futuro es ser socio de este trillo y contar con mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar y formar un mejor futuro a su familia, para lo cual solicita financiamiento de C$.15,000.00 a AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Orlando R., a small producer and a member of the cooperative La Esperanza. Along with his spouse, he works growing rice. By his own effort with 4 Mzs established in the dry season. Daily in the early hours Orlando attends to the agricultural work of his fields, accompanied by his wife in these activities. Through the cooperative he has had the opportunity to join as a member in the construction of a rice thresher. This allows him to reduce his costs and carry his harvest through the end, and so obtain benefits to his crop. His vision of the future is to be a member of this thresher and to have better incomes that would allow him to improve the conditions of his family’s life, and to make a better future for his family. For this he is asking for a loan of CS.15,000.00 from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% of the construction of the thresher La Peña

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum H., 58, is married and lives with her three young children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband is a village doctor making US$10 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Prum H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more medicines for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.en:
Norma Luz M. Vasquez is forty-three years old, married and has two children. She sells clothing and accessories for a living from her home. During the holiday season, Norma is requesting additional funds to stock up on products. Norma is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of goods for her to resell. She plans to buy shoes, bed clothing, pants, blouses and t-shirts with the funds she receives. Norma will repay her loan over the course of four months, making monthly installment payments.

Norma is a member of the Talented Women’s communal bank of Manuela Ramos located in Pucallpa, Peru. The city is the capital of the steamy, jungle district of Callería in the Ucayali department in Peru. The only paved road leading from Lima into the jungle ends here in Pucallpa. For this reason it is a major city and main transportation hub in the region.

loans.use: Norma would like to buy shoes, bed clothing, pants, blouses and shirts to sell with the funds she receives.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos Antonio R. García tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soltero, Carlos tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguiente su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de representar la calidad de su ganado ya que esto le daría un mejor prestigio, sus sueños son de incrementar su negocio ya que así obtendría mas ingresos para su familia y les ofrecería mas estabilidad a sus hijos ya que están en una etapa en la cual es necesario que se preparen para el día de mañana, sus deseos son de comprar un terreno que estará destinado para sus hijos para que el día de mañana no pasen dificultades y sepan lo difícil que es trabajar y así logren interesarse por el negocio ya que esto le serviría  de beneficio como medio de trabajo.

Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado menor y mayor, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, Don Carlos inicio este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de la familia y también es importante resaltar que Don Carlos es agricultor por lo que decide introducirse a este negocio ya que no fue fácil superar la situación con su esposa pero aun así recurría las diferente comarcas en busca del ganado que estuviera en venta para el hacer ofertas de pago por lo que no fue difícil aprender este tipo de negocio y además de la compra de ganado le intereso la venta de cerdo por lo que a esta también le sacaba provecho, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de los diferentes animales tanto ganado como cerdo.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio R. García is 41 years of age and is single. Carlos has 2 children, his oldest son is 18 years old and is in his fourth year of high school and his youngest son is 10 years old and is in his fourth year of primary school. His goals are to show the quality of his cattle since this is what will increase his prestige. His dream is to expand his business to be able to earn more for his family and to provide more stability to his children now that they are in a stage when it is necessary to prepare for the future. He hopes to buy land for his children so that they do not have difficulties in the future and for them to know how difficult it is to work and so that they become interested in the business which would be a benefit to them and also a way of working.

He purchases and sells large and small livestock. His business is located in his home. He has had this business for five years. Don Carlos started his business with the goal of meeting his household expenses. It is important to highlight that Don Carlos is a farmer who decided to start in this business since it was not easy to survive the situation with his wife. Despite this, he resorted to the different regions in search of livestock for sale so that he could make offers to buy. For this reason, it was not difficult for him to learn this type of business. He was interested in the selling of pigs which also benefited him. The financing is for business capital that he needs to buy different animals, cattle as well as pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Tang Kuoy Naing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, consisting of nine members, is located in Pech Entrea village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loans which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Tang Kuoy N. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods for her business. Her husband, Mr. Pa Touch, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Tang Kuoy N. is a 57-year-old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Tang's husband is shown in the picture.

Seven members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora G. is a 32-year-old married woman with two children in elementary school. She lives with her family in a house in Nkwaateng in the eastern region of Ghana. Her husband is a food crop farmer. Most of the people in Nkwaateng work in farming or sell farm supplies. Very few people run other types of business.  

Dora trades in second hand textiles. She buys all types of textile fabrics -- including second hand clothing and bed spreads -- from Kumasi, a nearby city, and resells them at the market square in her community. She also treks to nearby markets to sell. To supplement her income, she prepares cold cocoa drinks and sells them with bread in the afternoons. 

She has been in the textile business for eight years and would like a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase textiles in bales.  She believes the loan assistance will enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually help improve her family’s finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called ‘Adom’ (Grace) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral for the loan and hold one another responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Flordelina T., 56 years old, is married and lives at San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a government employee. She has also other source of income derived from her “sari-sari “(general) store.

She started it up with a small amount of capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, having joined in September 2004. Fortunately, the business has been going well until now. Some of their daily needs such as food come from the income from the store. Today, she is applying for Php 10,000 to buy additional goods for re-sale. She’s looking forward to having a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Saoudath

texts.fr:
A. Saoudath est née vers 1959 dans la Commune de Bantè dans le Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Saoudath est mariée à OKE Bruno. Saoudath est Mère de quatre enfants. Les enfants de Saoudath, Bertin âgée de 29 ans, Angèle âgée de 26 ans, Mariame âgée de 23 ans ne sont plus à sa charge. Seul Deen âgé de 18 ans, apprentis mécanicien est encore à sa charge. Depuis dix ans, Saoudath vend de l'igname frite et des beignets de haricot. C'est une nourriture que les gens du Bénin prennent tous les soirs comme goûté. C'est dans son quartier sous un hangar en tôle que Saoudath fait et vend cette nourriture tous les soirs. Saoudath par manque de moyens financiers est obligée d'acheter ses provisions au quotidien après chaque vente. Saoudath sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour parrer à cette difficulté et ainsi arriver à acheter l'igname et le haricot dont elle a besoin en gros par semaine. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Saoudath A. was born around 1959 in the township of Bantè in the county of Collines in the center of Bénin. Saoudath is married to Bruno Oke and the mother of 4 children. Saoudath's older children, Bertin, 29, Angèle, 26, and Mariame, 23, are no longer in her care. Only Deen, 18 and an apprentice mechanic, is still her responsibility.

For 10 years, Saoudath has been selling fried cocoyams and bean fritters. These are dishes that the people of Bénin have every evening as a snack. She sells her food in the evenings, in her own neighborhood, in a corrugated iron shed. Since she lacks working capital, Saoudath has to buy her supplies every day, with money from the preceding day's sales. She is asking ALIDé for a loan to improve this situation so that she can buy the cocoyams and dried beans, that she needs to make her food, wholesale, on a weekly basis.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next door to Nigeria, where the GDP per inhabitant stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of cocoyams, dried beans, and jerrycans of peanut oil

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a woman of strong determination. She wants to give her family a better standard of living. She is 29 years old and married to Joji, a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Jeana Jodel, 8 years old and studying in primary school. The second is Dan Justine, 4 years old. Adelaida is happy with her children and does not have any plans of having another one due to the economic situation. With their simple livelihood, Adelaida is aiming for a successful life someday.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to be used for the maintenance and repair of their passenger tricycle. She hopes that her loan will be granted since the school year is fast approaching and they have to save for their child's school allowance.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion A. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old. Presentacion is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Presentacion owns and operates a business venture selling "sawali," or woven bamboo wall products, to local businesses and community members. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the first loan taken out by Presentacion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in order to manufacture additional products

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
Vị Đặng Thị is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make her living, Vị owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members. Vị has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from this work.

In 2006, Vị joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and incrase her ability to engage in business activities. Vị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Vị is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Vị plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote S., 52, is married with seven children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and general public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about 145 USD). SPBD loans are Salote’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemical weeds, gallon of gramoxone, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Roslita

texts.en: Roslita U. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. Roslita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. As an extra venture, she also engages in farming cassava, bananas and coconut. She has been engaged in her businesses for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Roslita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roslita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: Marian Elizabeth C. L. vive en el departamento de  Ahuachapán en el occidente del país.  Su esposo, es un policía empleado en la Policía Nacional Civil, y casi no tiene tiempo de acompañarla en la casa ni en el negocio. Marian con mucho valor montó su propia venta de pupusas hace ya seis años, negocio que ido creciendo poco a poco cada   vez más. Marian solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima para elaborar sus pupusas y ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Marian Elizabeth C. L. lives in the Department of Ahuachapán in the western part of the country. Her husband is a policeman who works for the National Civil Police. He almost never has time to help her around the house or with the business. Six years ago, Marian courageously started up her own business making and selling pupusas. The business has been growing little by little over time. Marian is seeking a loan in order to buy raw materials for preparing her pupusas so she can offer her customers an even better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Yusufu Hawa’S Group

texts.en:
Y. is forty years old and single with three children between the ages of seventeen and twenty-two years. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. Y. doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she sells charcoal. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she buys from her place of work.

Y. sells charcoal in the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and on average she receives thirty customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last five years. Y. has been with MCDT for five years servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Y. hopes to see her business grow bigger and wants to eventually own a permanent business location and home.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ISABEL Q. R., tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA UNIDA.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria  no pudo continuar estudiando porque a la edad de 17 años quedó embarazada.
MARIA ISABEL está casada , tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran en el colegio.
MARIA ISABEL se dedica a la atención del locutorio que tiene en su casa, junto con la ayuda de su hijo mayor.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la fabricación de su segunda cabina de locutorio.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para  comprar una fotocopiadora y poder también dar ese servicio.
MARIA ISABEL sueña con ampliar su negocio de locutorio con servicio de Internet , fotocopia , tipeos y anillados.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel Q. R. is 50 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo and the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the community bank Esperanza Unida (United Hope). This businesswoman completed schooling until the 5th year of secondary school when she couldn’t continue studying because at age 17 she got pregnant. Maria Isabel is married, has 3 children and they all depend on her economically because they are in high school. Maria Isabel tends to the telephone booth she has in her house, together with the help of her oldest son. The first loan she received (300 nuevos soles) she invested in building her second telephone stall. She will use this loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase a photocopier and be able to give this service. Maria Isabel dreams of increasing her telephone booth business with internet, photocopier, typing, and binding services.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Thiébo

texts.fr: Thiébo N.  est âgée de 45 ans, elle est restauratrice de cantine scolaire dans une école privée dans la ville de Mbour  et pendant les vacances elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus. Les revenus tirés de ce commerce lui permet de participer aux charges de ménage et d’entretenir ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en achetant des tissus pour la fête de korité

loans.use: achat de tissus

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been dreaming to alleviate her poor living condition someday. She is married to Ceser who works as a farmer in their village. They have four children.  Clarito, twenty-two years old and Arlene, twenty years old, are both married already. Armie, her third child, is now in Manila working as a maid.  Their youngest is seventeen years old and has finished studying. Her family lives in the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Ilagan, Isabela. 
	
Anita has been engaged in her hog raising business for years. For daily income, she also sells vegetables to their entire village. She retails her vegetable products which she purchases from the town market. She hopes to gain more profit from both of her businesses to able provide the primary needs of her family. 

Anita is requesting to use a loan of PHP4,000 to have capital to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs, vegetables and other commodities that she may add to her product line. She hopes to use the loan because she believes that it is the best way to make her businesses more productive. By growing her businesses, she believes that their ways of living will somehow be uplifted.

loans.use: expanding both her livestock and retail business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es casada, tiene 3 hijos mayores que viven en forma independiente, pues, todos ya están casados y tienen su casa propia, ella es una señora con 61 años y sigue teniendo ganas de superación.

Ella monto su despensa en el año 2000, ya que es la única actividad que le gustaba, era docente y hoy día vive de la jubilación y su actividad  es el comercio. 

Su máximo sueño es refaccionar su casa porque hasta ahora sigue teniendo de madera y alguna vez piensa modificar por uno de material.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is married and has 3 children who are all married and have homes of their own. She is 61 years old and still has aspirations to better herself. She opened her grocery store in 2000, as it is the only activity that she enjoyed. She was a teacher and is nowadays living off retirement and her main activity is commerce. Her biggest dream is to repair her home as it is currently still made of wood, and would like to refurbish it with sturdier materials.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Xochil

texts.es:
La señora Xochil L. C. es una oficinista en la ciudad de Managua. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda. Pero ella dice también que en momentos de emergencia los utiliza para resolver asuntos importantes como reparación de vivienda y pagos de deudas.

Xochil es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo los cuales están en edad escolar. Tiene 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL tiempo en el que ha recibido 2 créditos.
texts.en:
Sra. Xochil L. C. works as a clerk for the city of Managua. She is requesting this loan to invest in home improvements. Xochil notes that she has also utilized loans in times of emergency or for resolving major issues such as home repairs or debt payments. She is a single mother with three children attending school. Xochil has been a client of CEPRODEL for two years and has received two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is from Dapdap, a resettlement area established after the pyroclastic flow from Mt. Pinatubo’s spectacular eruption in 1991 destroyed the village of San Roque, among others. Dapdap is located in Central Luzon in Tarlac, a municipality of Bamban Province. Alma is 45 years old, married and has five adult children. Alma owns and runs a general store stocked with a variety of different products which she sells to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Alma is requesting a loan from ASKI, her fourth, of 12,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Alma successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, also used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and –women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kroch
