texts.en: B. is a low-income farmer who lives in an area that is well-suited to growing crops. She is 57, married and has six children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. B. is very happy that three of her children have good jobs -- two work in the garment industry and one is a civil service officer. Her husband works for the ministry of religious affairs. B. will use this loan, her first, to buy a plot of good farmland, on which she will farm a variety of crops.

loans.use: To buy a plot of good farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 41 years old, living in Banga, South Cotabato. She has a hog raising and rice farming business. She owns 2 hectares of rice field and has 12 piglets and one sow. She is the mother of four children (her eldest is  21 years old). She makes enough money for her family when she has a good harvest from the farm.

Dolores would like a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to purchase farm inputs. This will be very helpful to sustain her family and business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nanssi

texts.en:
Nanssi is a 31 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children.

Nanssi sells Tupperware (she actually buys them, and then resells them). Before, her loan, her husband helped her with her Tupperware expenses, but now she wants to increase her sales and that is why she is taking a loan.

This is the first time Nanssi has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase Tupperware and increase her sales. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors, and also sometimes some mini-markets. She decided on starting her business because she wanted to be financially independent and also supplement her husband’s income.

In the future, Nanssi plans to keep on improving her work... and why not one day opening her own Tupperware shop?

loans.use: To purchase more Tupperware to sell

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a 25-year-old engaged woman. She's living with her parents and two siblings. Her fiancée has owned a mobile shop for the past four years. In 2007, he joined the military and as a result, she has taken over all the responsibilities of the shop. She's trying to help her fiancée provide better living conditions and get married next year. She sells mobile phones, mobile accessories and rechargeable cards. 

Today, Amanda is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a big quantity of merchandise needed at good prices to fill her shop.

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of merchandise needed in good prices

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Feliciana vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en donde tiene su propio negocio de comida, que durante varios años ha logrado administrar. Tiene 58 años de edad, y se siente muy activa en sus ventas, el cual comenzó solo vendiendo enchilada y con dinero prestado de una amiga, luego para aumentar las ventas recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic en donde ha logrado aumentar las variedades de comida de fritanga. Ya que logro cambiar su negocio de comida por la artesanía ya que ante era ese su negocio. Con este préstamo quiere reparar las divisiones de los cuartos es decir levantar paredes nuevas ya que las que tiene son de madera y están en malas condiciones lo que le es de gran necesidad personal para una privacidad y mejor comodidad de su familia. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en la variedad de ricos platos de comida día a día, ya que es su medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Doña Feliciana lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino, where she has a food business that she has managed for several years. She is 58 years old and very active in making her sales. Using the money loaned to her from a friend, she started selling enchiladas. She later increased her sales with the help of recurring loans from AFODENIC, which she used to expand the variety of fried foods that she produced. Selling food was a change for her since she previously made handicrafts in her previous business.

With this loan, Feliciana wants to repair the room divisions within her house. She will have new walls erected that are made of wood since the existing ones are in bad condition. This is of great personal necessity since it will give privacy and greater comfort to her family. Her plans include creating a variety of flavorful dishes to serve every day in order to earn income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to erect new room dividers (walls) in her house

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey A. O. is 31 and married with three children. His wife is a tailor. Geoffrey's business is in a busy market in Kakamega where he has done shoe repair for the last twelve years. He says business is good but there is a lot of competition meaning less work. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy nails, thread, and tires to do shoe repair and expand his business. Geoffrey repairs shoes using tires and, in Kenya, men often wear sandals made from tires. He describes himself as hardworking and hopes one day to have a shoe store.

loans.use: To buy tires, nails, and thread for shoe repair.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mocumí, una zona netamente agrícola donde predominan los cultivos de maíz y arroz, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era joven a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, en la zona la mayoría de mujeres se dedican a esta actividad con la finalidad de apoyar a sus esposos en el sostenimiento del hogar. Martina cría aves de corral y cerdos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta vivos (a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona, en el caso de las aves) o sacrificados ( a sus vecinos, en el caso de los cerdos). Ella es ayudada por su hija en las labores de crianza.

Martina desea ampliar su negocio para poder captar mas ingresos y poder salir adelante, por ello desea adquirir más animales y sus respectivos alimentos con los cuales puedan desarrollarse favorablemente, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Martina es una mujer hogareña y que trabaja siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, ella también ayuda a su esposo en las labores de siembra, el sueño que ambos comparten es hacer mejoras en las vivienda en donde viven , ya que esta construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Martina is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the Muy Finca area of the district of Mocumi. This is primarily an agricultural area where corn and rice are the main crops. It's located in the Lambayeque province which is an hour outside of Chiclayo. Since she was young, she has raised and sold small animals from her house. In this area, most of the women do the same in order to help their husbands support the family. Martina raises poultry and pigs at home and sells the poultry, live, to the retailers who visit her area, or the sacrificed pigs to her neighbors. Her daughter helps her raise them. Martina would like to grow her business to be able to earn more money and get ahead. She would, therefore, like to buy more animals and their feed so they can grow heartily. Following her objective, she finds it necessary to take out her first loan. of 800 soles. from "Edpyme Alternativa." Martina is a woman who loves her home and always works thinking of her family's well being. She also helps her husband with his planting. They both dream of making some improvements to their home since it's built with rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhase animals and feed to grow their business of raising animals and selling them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase maize and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Alexandra Del Rocio

texts.es:
Este es el banco comunal Alfa nos pudimos dar cuenta que es un gran grupo de señora bastante trabajadoras y muestra de ello es la socia Alexandra, nos comentó  que se dedica a la venta de ropa en la cual invierte el crédito que recibe de la Fundación.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa para adultos y niños en varias marcas y precios, tan solo lleva 6 meses en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien está contenta con los resultados tanto así que con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en surtir su mercadería, le tocara viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil para realizar sus compras y poder obtener mejores ganancias ya tiene varios pedidos por entregar como pantalones, blusas y camisas que son las prendas que mas se venden.

Alexandra está casada tiene una niña de 3 años de edad  el esposo es de profesión albañil, cuenta nuestra socia que la situación económica en  la cual estaban atravesando fue lo que la animo a ingresar al mundo de las ventas, antes solo era ama de casa pero ahora no se arrepiente porque este negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante económicamente y a relacionarse.
texts.en:
This is the Alfa communal bank. We can see that it is a great group of very hardworking women, and Alexandra, one of the members, is an example of that fact. She explained to us that she sells clothing, which she uses loans received from the Foundation to buy. Our member sells clothing for adults and children. She sells various brands and sizes. She has only been in this business for 6 months, and it has gone well for her and she is happy with the results; so much so that she will invest this new loan entirely in stocking her merchandise. She will travel to the city of Guayaquil to make her purchases so she can obtain higher earnings. She already has several orders to fill for pants, blouses, and t-shirts, which are the items that sell the most. Alexandra is married and she has a 3 year-old girl. Her husband is a bricklayer. She explained to us that the economic situation that they were in is what motivated her to get into sales. Before, she was a housewife but now she is not sorry because this business has helped her to get ahead economically, and to socialize more.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, t-shirts, and pajamas

loans.name: Felicidad Otura Group

texts.en: Felicidad O. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Felicidad O. Group. Felicidad is widowed. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month. In 2009, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly T. is from Iligan City. He is 31 years old. Rolly is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Rolly owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle  services to local community members. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rolly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rolly from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama “Virgen de Juquila”, está ubicado en la comunidad barrio San Miguel, Cohuecan, estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen. Este es el préstamo no. 12 con Fundación Realidad.
La integrante del grupo Manuela S. S. tiene 40 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos, 2 hombres y 1 mujer, José David de 11 años, Juan Diego de 9 años y María Esther de 7 años, ella se dedica a la alfarería,  su préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar barro y leña para tener almacenado ya que en temporada de lluvia se escasea la mercancía. Ella trabaja sobre pedido, sus cliente son de Tlayacapan, las piezas que realiza en barro son pedestales para poner las flores, jarrones para lámparas, juego de botellones grandes, inicio su negocio hace 14 años, comentando que ya viene de familia su papa le enseño a trabajar el barro, es motivo de orgullo la alfarería ya que hay ocasiones que se hace una promesa religiosa de decorar la iglesia con pedestales para las flores o candeleros para las ceras el día 24 de agosto que se celebra a san Bartolo. A tenido desafíos como cuando el barro llega a fallar no resiste el fuego y se rompen las piezas, Manuela nos dice: “es importante para mí el negocio porque con las ganancia voy sacando para los gastos de la casa, la educación de los niños y seguir comprando mercancía para seguir trabajando”.
Los integrantes de grupo son la señora Petra Constantina V. M., Luisa S. González, Maura A. V. y Manuela S. van a comprar barro para la alfarería. Diana Martínez López va a comprar llantas para su taxi.
texts.en:
The communal bank called “Virgen de Juquila” is located in the San Miguel neighborhood of Cohuecan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. This group is made up of 5 members who know each other. This is their 12th loan with the Fundación Realidad. Manuela S. S. is a member of the group. She is 40 years old and completed her education through the 3rd year of secondary school. She has 3 children: 2 boys and a girl. Jose David is 11, Juan Diego is 9, and Maria Esther is 7 years old. She sells pottery. She will use this loan to stock up on clay and firewood, since these items become scarce during the rainy season. She works by advance orders, and her customers are from Tlayacapan. The pieces she makes from clay are pedestals to put flowers on, lamp bases, and large sets of bottles. She started her business 14 years ago. She comments that it runs in her family; her father taught her to work with clay. She is proud of her pottery business, since at times she makes a religious commitment to decorate the church with pedestals for flowers or candelabras for the wax candles on August 24th, when they celebrate Saint Bartolo. She has had setbacks, such as when the clay fails to resist the fire and the pieces break. Manuela tells us "my business is important for me, because with the earnings I am able to cover the household expenses, the educational expenses for my children, and I can continue to buy merchandise in order to keep working." The members of the group are: Petra Constantina V. M., Luisa S. González, Maura A. V. and Manuela S.. They will buy clay for the pottery business, and Diana Martínez López will buy tires for her taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clay and firewood to make pedestals, lamp bases, and sets of large bottles

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 33 years old and she is still single. Gaudence is well known for her business selling cloth as shown in the photo. This is her fourth successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

Gaudence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Gaudence will expand her business by purchasing cloth. With this additional cloth, Gaudence's sales as well as profits will increase.  If successful, Gaudence will keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of raw cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements and some personal expenses

loans.name: Edwin Roberto

texts.es: Edwin es de 33 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo varón y una mujer, es jefe de cobranza de créditos, en la actividad tiene 1.5 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para acabados de vivienda, con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades del solicitante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida personal y la de su familia en general, las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable, por lo que nuevamente se confiara que podrá efectuar los pagos sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Edwin is 33 years old, married and has a son and a daughter. He is in charge of collecting loans and has been doing it for the past year and a half. He is requesting his second loan to finish his house. He wants to fulfill his obligations as an applicant and improve his living conditions for himself and his family in general. His personal references say that he is a responsible person and they are confident that he will be able to make his payments again without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, fish, meat, pepper, salt and so on

loans.name: Ruby Emperatriz

texts.es:
Ruby Páez de San Jacinto Bolívar es una gran artesana que sabe cómo  generar ingresos trabajando en varias actividades y es que esto lo hace desde muy joven; primero inició con una tienda, producto de su experiencia como empleada de un almacén, pero los clientes querían todo a crédito y no recuperaba el dinero de inmediato como lo amerita este negocio;  luego decidió vender mercancía a clientes que estaban empleados y le fue muy bien y desde allí adicionó también lo que más le gusta hacer y que es parte de su naturaleza:   tejer  mochilas y hamacas y al mismo tiempo empezó también su negocio de preparar  almuerzos corrientes, porque es una experta en comidas,  mientras simultáneamente continua con la venta de calzado y ropa que es una necesidad permanente de sus clientes y hasta le ha agregado la comercialización de artículos para el hogar. El credikiva es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con sus anteriores financiamientos ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y con ello que sus hijos estudien, porque tiene  como su sueño principal trabajar persistentemente hasta que terminen en la Universidad, pues ellos son muy estudiosos y también sueñan con ser profesionales; también con sus crèditos ha logrado adquirir herramientas y enseres para adecuar su negocio de alimentos y ampliar y diversificar la oferta de productos, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Con este financiamiento comprarà hilaza, pita y otros insumos para elaborar mochilas encargadas e insumos para elaborar comidas como arroz aceite, sal y carnes en mayor volumen, asi como mercancias variadas.
El  mayor desafío de Ruby  es elegir clientes responsables cuando le compran a crédito, pero cada día aprende más y gradualmente asume riesgos controlados, como solo venderle a quienes trabajan y son recomendados de sus mejores clientes. Otro  de sus desafíos es educar ella sola a sus hijos después de la separación de su esposo, pero da gracias a Dios porque sus esfuerzos no resultan infructuosos pues sus hijos, son muy conscientes de sus esfuerzos y están aprovechando las posibilidades que ella está construyendo.
texts.en:
Ruby Páez is a talented artisan from San Jacinto Bolívar who knows how to generate income by working at various activities from a young age. At first she opened a store, utilizing the experience she gained while working at a retail business. However, all of her customers requested credit, so she was not able to collect payments in a timely fashion as required by her business. She then decided to sell merchandise to customers who were employed and did very well. From there she also chose to pursue the activity she enjoys the most and comes to her naturally – making woven purses and hammocks. At the same time, Ruby started another business preparing lunches to go because she is a food expert. She continued to sell clothing and shoes as a necessity because she had established customers and later on added household goods to the inventory of products she offered.

This Kiva loan is the third time she has requested financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With her previous loans, Ruby was able to increase her earnings and pay for her children’s schooling because her greatest dream is to see them work tirelessly until they can finish university. Her children are very studious and also dream of becoming professionals. In addition, her loans helped her to acquire tools and equipment to retrofit her food business so that she could expand and diversify her product offering which she has already achieved. With this loan she plans to buy thread and natural fibers for making purses for which she has received orders. In addition, she will buy ingredients such as rice, oil, salt, and meat in large volume, as well as a variety of other merchandise.

Ruby’s biggest challenge is selecting customers who are responsible when purchasing on credit. Every day she is learning more and gradually controlling the amount of risk she takes by only selling to individuals who are working or have been recommended by her best customers. Another challenge she faces is paying for her children’s education by herself since she has separated from her husband. Thanks to God, her efforts have not been fruitless because her children are very aware of her hard work and are taking advantage of the opportunities she has created for them.

loans.use: Purchase thread and natural fibers for making purses; ingredients for her food business; and a variety of merchandise for her retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Elena Ángela L. G. es una fémina trabajadora la cual se cataloga como una botánica y esotérica originaria de la costa Caribe de Nicaragua. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde hace ropa, fundas, ropa de cama, etc. las cuales comercializa en sus dos tramos en waspan. Fantasía 
Ella trabaja junto con sus hijos por los cuales ha trabajado arduo y sueña con que cada uno de ellos logre sus metas, tener su casa propia y que nunca les falte el pan. L. invertirá en una mantenedora para iniciar a vender pollo, mortadela, carne etc.
texts.en:
Elena Ángela L. G. is a working woman originally from the Caribbean coast of Nicaragua, an area known for its plant life and its mystique. She manages a small sewing workshop where she produces clothing, bags, bed linens, and other articles that she sells from two carts in Waspan. Ángela works with her children. Since they work extremely hard, she dreams that each of them is able to achieve their goals.

Ángela has her own home and her family never goes hungry. She will invest in a refrigerator so that she can begin selling chicken, bologna, meat, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle G. is from the village of Calao West Santiago. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Anabelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anabelle from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne de vaca, ella cria ganados y luego la carne lo vende en el mercado de Vinocanchon que queda ubicado en la plaza de San Jeronimo, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de carne. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicia belongs to the community bank "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO." The bank is located in the Cusco District, within Cusco Province, in the Cusco Region.

Felicia is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She varies her daily activities with selling beef. She raises cattle and then sells the beef at the Vinocanchon market located in San Jeronimo Plaza. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She wants to improve her business. She requests the loan to buy wholesale livestock.

Felicia thanks those who become part of this dream through this method and agrees to repay her loan in the established period of time.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale livestock

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the village of Northern Poblacion. She is 44 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Rosita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Del C., Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephine is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chicken for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Ynocencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ynocencia; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas del distrito de Oropesa, la socia prepara diferentes tipos de pan, ella atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  insumos para preparar el pan como harina, mantequilla, manteca y azúcar al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ynocencia is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Ynocencia is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She sells her bread as an itinerant street vendor in the main square in Oropesa.  She makes different types of bread and works from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  Ynocencia would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread, such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale.

Ynocencia is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread, such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food kiosk (stall) and cereals shop for the last seven years, selling from the roadside to her neighbors and passersby. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During holiday season, the price of food products is very high and hence a decrease in demand for the food products. She hopes to open a big cereal shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, Rehema wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of maize flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts

loans.name: Umutkan's Group

texts.en:
Umutkan D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. She is 37 and married to a builder. Together they are bringing up three sons; the first son is at school and the other two are not yet. In order to earn money to cover the family budget, Umutkan takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national clothes, carpets and pillows. She started five years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now she earns 10,000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials needed for sewing. In the future she wants to increase the turnover of her business up to 50,000 soms.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Zeina

texts.ar: زينه في عمر 34 سنة متزوجة وعلى عاتقها اربع اولاد تعمل في محل لبيع ادوات التنظيف لها في عمله 10 سنوات تحب عملها وتجيده تريد تأمين حياة سعيدة وكريمة لها ولعائلتها دائمة التطور وتحب التقدم في العمل وفي الحياة تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء مواد جديدة للمحل وتطوير المصلحة وزيادة المدخول لأنها تتميز في محيطها بالدقة في العمل والتطور الدائم
texts.en: Zeina is 34, married and has the responsibility of supporting 4 children. She works in a shop selling household goods. She has been doing this for 10 years and loves her work very much. She wants to secure a comfortable life for herself and her children. She likes progress and advancement both in her work and in life in generA.. Through her loan she wants to purchase new stock for her shop and increase her profit and income. She is recognised by those around her for her attention to detail and her constant development.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for the shop, including vacuum cleaners and other raw materials

loans.name: Shirley Fazileth

texts.es: Shirley Fazileth R. D. C.,  D. Veintiún años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad y municipio D. Soyapango, departamento D. San Salvador, en casa D. sus padres, Shirley es madre soltera, tiene bajo su custodia la responsabilidad D. su hija, y si bien el padre D. su hija mensualmente aporta una cantidad D. dinero, resulta muy poco para las necesidades diarias tanto D. su hija como ella. Razón por la cual Shirley encontró en la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo una excelente opción D. cuidar D. su hija y hacerse D. dinero para costear necesidades básicas D. sus vidas. Este es uno D. los mejores momentos comerciales por los que esta pasando Shirley , por lo que espera con este crédito, invertir mas en su negocio a fin D. incrementar su inventario y contar con nuevos productos que le piden sus clientes y vecinos a fin D. mejorar cada día la calidad D. vida tanto para ellas como para sus padres que tanto le están apoyando.-
texts.en:
Shirley Fazileth R. D. C. is 21 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador in her parent's house.  Shirley is a single mother who has the primary responsibility for her daughter.  Her daughter's father contributes a sum of money every month, but there is little left for the daily necessities for her and her daughter.  For this reason, Shirley found that selling cosmetics by catalog was an excellent option to care for her daughter and earn money for basic necessities.  

This is a good time for business for Shirley, so she is hoping she can use this loan to invest more in her business.  She would like to increase her inventory and have new products to offer to her customers and neighbors so that she can improve her life and her daughter's life, and also help her parents because they have given her so much support.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, hand and body creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 58-year-old married woman with 11 children. Her oldest child is already 41 years old.

Cecilia is engaged in farming. She grows rice and corn crops. She sells her harvest to the community. Cecilia works hard to improve her business and provide for her family.

Cecilia's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jimalyn

texts.en:
Jimalyn works hard to support her family.  She is single and has an E-loading business in the Philippines.

Jimalyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy LoadWallet (pre-paid air time service) for her E-loading business.

Jimalyn has been in this business for the past 2 years.  In the future, Jimalyn would like to open another business.

loans.use: To purchase air time for her E-loading business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a natural fruit juice making business that she sells from home to her neighbours and local residents. Margaret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 sheshe wants to repair her freezer and purchase a variety of flavors for making juice. Margaret decided to work with Yehu Microfinance because of efficiency of their loan products.

loans.use: To repair her freezer and purchase a variety of flavors for making juice.

loans.name: Rosa Refugio

texts.es: Rosa Refugio, vive con su compañero D. vida y se dedica a la venta D. granos básicos y leña en un lugar accesible D. la zona en la que vive, es visitada por muchos clientes todos los días, pues es muy servicial y siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita. Para Rosa lo que importa es cuanto amor le pone a su trabajo para que este le dé frutos en un futuro y para que la clientela queD. satisfecha; Ella quiere estar a disposición D. lo que sus clientes necesiten y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, maíz y mayor cantidad D. leña antes que finalice el verano, dado que en invierno incrementa su valor y así el valor D. reventa resulta ganancioso para Rosa. Es así como Rosa piensa atraer nuevos clientes e incrementar su negocio; pues  esto le pueD. asegurar la estabilidad económica D. su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Refugio lives with her life partner and has a business selling staple grains and firewood in an accessible location that is visited by many customers each day.  She is eager to please, and always has what her customers need.  For Rosa, what matters is the love that she puts into her work, so that it will bear fruit for her in the future, and so that her customers leave satisfied.  Rosa wants to be ready to give her customers everything they need, and for this reason she requests a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase staple grains, rice, beans, corn and a large quantity of firewood before the summer ends since prices will go up after that, and thus allow her to benefit.  In this way, Rosa plans to attract new customers and increase her business, which will help to ensure the economic stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood, grains, rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married and the father one child who is in third grade.  Felix was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands Office and he is requesting a fifth loan from Kadet.  He has been in the shoe selling business for twelve years. He will use the loan to buy 10 bales of shoes for resale. He sells the shoes in an open air market in Kenyatta market, which is a well-populated area.

With the extra profits he will increase the stocks of shoes and he hopes to be able to maximize his income, open a shop, and sell the shoes from it. Felix believes he is a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy 10 bales of shoes for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 65 years old and a widow with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lucia runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 40 years. She has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria Ysidora

texts.es:
María tiene  25 años de edad, ella es soltera no cuenta con hijos, vive con sus padres en un caserío anexo del distrito de Morrope con aproximadamente  300 familias es una zona rural a 20 minutos de Morrope, la mayoría de pobladores en sus comunidad son personas que se dedican al comercio y ala agricultura.

María cuenta con una bodega, instalada en su domicilio  la cual e es atendida por ella misma allí ella ofrece a sus  vecinos y amigos productos de primera necesidad, así como también productos de uso domestico,  María cuenta con  experiencia de 5 años  ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija, adicionalmente se dedica ala comercio y crianza de animales menores.

María desea invertir en su negocio comprando mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio con más productos novedosos para ofrecer a su clientes, por ello maría a creído por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para poder realizar dichas actividades.

María es una mujer de buen carácter, tranquila que desea poder superarse y poder brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old, single, and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in annex village in the Morrope district that has about 300 families.  It is located in a rural area about 20 minutes from Morrope.  The majority of the people in the community are people who work as merchants and in agriculture.

María has a small general store located in her home that she runs herself.  She offers her neighbors and friends staple products as well as domestic products.  She has five years of experience and has regular customers who also work in trade and raising small animals.

María wants to invest in her business by purchasing more merchandise to expand her store with more new products to her customers.  To do this, María asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles. 

María is a calm woman of good character who wants to improve herself and be able to give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: María Noemí

texts.es: María Noemí D. treinta y uno años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. fruta, verdura, pollo, huevos, los venD. D. manera ambulante en las colonias cercanas a donD. ella resiD. ya se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues venD. producto D. buena calidad, fresco y por supuesto a precio accesible, María les da un buen servicio a las personas que compran su producto las atienD. con gran amabilidad y siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro. Para María Noemí lo que importa es cuanto amor, esfuerzo y dedicación le pongamos al trabajo que realizamos para que en un futuro tengamos una transformación exitosa en nuestras vidas, es por eso que con ese pensamiento positivo se deciD. solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como fruta, verdura, huevos, pollo, carnes entre otros. María tiene la confianza que su trabajo le dará la posibilidad D. darle a su familia una calidad D. vida mejor y una estabilidad económica para su hogar.
texts.en:
María Noemí is 31 years old, and she lives with her life partner and their children.  She sells fruit, vegetables, chicken, and eggs.  She sells in an itinerant manner in the neighborhoods close to where she lives.  She has already gotten a lot of customers because she sells good quality products that are fresh. Of course, she sells at an accessible price.

María gives good service to the people who buy her products.  She waits on them with great kindness, and she always has a smile on her face.  What is important to María Noemí is how much love, effort, and dedication we put into our work.  We do this so that in the future we will have a successful change in our lives.

That is why, with a positive outlook, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow her to buy more merchandise like fruit, vegetables, eggs, chicken, and meat, among other things.  María is confident that her work will give her the chance to give her family a better quality of life and financial stability in her household.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, eggs, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with two children and her husband. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Thanh has owned a clothing store that sells trousers, shirts and dresses for women for nearly 10 years. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater range of clothing to sell to her customers in the local community. 

She hopes that with a greater range of products, she will be abL. to attract more customers to her store and earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell in her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma;  tiene 36 años de edad  y es casda la socia tiene 2 hijos de  14, 6 años de edad, La soica se dedica a la administracion de su negocio, la socia tiene una empresa de eventos, la socia atiende todo tipo de compromiso como por ejemplo, matrimonios, quinceañeros, fiestas infantiles, bautizos, bodas de plata y oro, cumpleños; La socia para esto siempre esta comprando todo tipo de menajeria según las horas en las que son sus eventos, como en las mañana, trades o noches y requiere desde manteles especiales, forors de asientos, servilletas, copas para todo tipo de bebidas, vasos, platos, platillos entre otros mas. La socia desea implementar y aumentar su menajeria por lo cual ella requiere invertir en la compra de menajeria para sus eventos.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Illary III” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 36 years old, married, and has two children (ages 14 and 6). Vilma manages an events business in which she plans all types of celebrations such as weddings, “quinceañeras”, children’s parties, baptisms, golden and silver anniversaries, and birthday parties. She is always buying all types of decorations based on the time when the events are held. For example, morning events are more traditional while the ones at night require special tablecloths, seat covers, napkins, stemware for all types of beverages, glasses, plates, saucers, and other items. Vilma wants to restock and expand her inventory of decorations, so she is requesting a loan to buy these items for her events.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase various types of decorations for her events business.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a house that he owns; it neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a carving business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a carving school in future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two bulls to use in farming. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls to use in farming.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 45 years old and widowed, with 3 children, ages 15 to 25.  She runs a local commodities store in Waterloo, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also has two children who are currently attending secondary school.

Aminata has owned this business for 15 years and sells rice, beans and palm oil at her market. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local items. Aminata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more local commodities such as rice, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Kondokpogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPOGBE est composé de  trois  personnes qui  sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier  au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sègbégnon Blanche  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sègbégnon  Blanche est âgée de 34 ans  et vit au Bénin. Sègbégnon  Blanche est mariée à un Mécanicien du nom de Paul.  Le couple a deux  enfants  à leur  charge. L’un des enfants est scolarisé.  Sègbégnon  Blanche et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants.  Sègbégnon  Blanche n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Sègbégnon  Blanche vend depuis sept ans  de l’huile d’arachide.  A côté de cette activité, Sègbégnon  Blanche  vend des chaussures et du charbon de bois dans sa boutique. Sègbégnon  Blanche s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sègbégnon  Blanche sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPOGBE, un troisième crédit.  Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The KONDOKPOGBE group is made up of 3 friends who live in the same neighbourhood in Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Sègbégnon Blanche, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sègbégnon Blanche is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to mechanic called Paul. The couple have 2 children in their care, one of which attends school. Sègbégnon Blanche and her husband live together with their children. She has never attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her children, Sègbégnon Blanche has been selling peanut oil for the past 7 years.  In addition to this, Sègbégnon Blanche sells shoes and charcoal in a shop. She sources her products from Benin. In order to satisfy her clientele and to increase her sales and revenue, Sègbégnon Blanche is requesting, along with the other members of the KONDOKPOGBE group, a third loan. The previous loans have all been duly repaid.

loans.use: Acheter  de l'huile d'arachide, des chaussures et des habits.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Lizbeth es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se desempeña como director de una escuela de la región.
Se dedica a la venta de caldo de gallina cerca de una escuela y lo realiza en horas de la mañana de lunes a sábados, este negocio le permite atender también su casa sin ningún problema, al mediodía ya tiene el almuerzo listo para cuando lleguen sus hijos del colegio y su esposo del trabajo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 2 ollas de 20 litros, 1 cocina surge, 1 balón de gas, 1 ciento de taper para caldo, servilletas, 1 bolsa de fideos.
Ha decidido invertir en este negocio porque ha visto en éste una gran oportunidad y lo aprovecha mientras  duren las clases escolares.  Los días domingos es para que comparta su tiempo con su familia.
Piensa seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque  es parte de su vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Lizbeth is a member of the Nuevas Amigas communal bank in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is the principal of a school in the region. 

Lizbeth sells chicken soup near a school in the mornings, Monday to Saturday. This business allows her to care for her home without any difficulty and also to have lunch ready at noon for her children when they come from school and her husband when he comes from work.

With her new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles she will buy two 20 liter pots, 1 Surge cooker, 1 cylinder of gas, 100 Tupperware containers for the soup, napkins and 1 bag of noodles. She has decided to invest in this business because she sees it as a great opportunity to profit from the demand during school hours. On Sundays she spends time with her family.

She intends to continue working with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER, because it has become part of her life.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware, large pots, a Surge cooker and other items.

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe existe il y'a environ 5 ans.il formé par 13 femmes habitant le même village. elles font le commerce et l'embouche ovine comme activités.

madame Fatou debout a l'extreme gauche de la photo est la responsable. elle est agée de 53ans mariée et mére de 08 enfants.

elle a comme activité le commerce de légumes,et en même temps fais de l'embouche ovine. elle en a une bonne expérience car elle la fait depuis longtemps.

avec son crédit elle achètera des légumes et ruminants(moutons), pour les revendre.

de ses bénéfices  elle assura un bon suivi médical a ses enfants, et augmentera ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence for about 5 years, and is made up of 13 women who live in the same village. They fatten and sell sheep. 

Madame Fatou, standing at the far left of the photo, is the group's leader. Alongside fattening sheep, she also sells vegetables. She has plenty of experience in these activities. With her loan, she will buy vegetables and ruminants (sheep), for re-sale.

With her profits, she will be able to pay for good medical care for her children, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and ruminants (sheep).

loans.name: Laura Piedad

texts.es:
Laura de 59 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “Fortín”.
Ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, es una comerciante que vende ropa como: camisas, pantalones, sostenes, etc.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y la competencia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: zapatos, sandalias, tollas, etc.
El sueño de ella es incrementar su negocio donde pueda poner varios locales de venta de ropa.
texts.en: Laura, 59, lives in a periurban zone calle “El Fortín.”  She started her business 20 years ago.  She’s a clothing merchant selling shirts, pants, bras, etc.  The difficulty she faces is crime and competition.  She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like shoes, sandals, towels, etc.  Her dream is to increase business so that she can install several clothing vending spots.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes, sandals, towels, etc.

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 to 12 years and two are currently enrolled in school. His wife, Mwamahamisi, works as a vegetable seller. Kitsao has operated a vegetable kiosk for the past  two years. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kitsao will use the 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and onions to add to his inventory. Kitsao aspires to open more kiosks in the future. He joined Yehu because they have many affordable loan products.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, potatoes, and onions to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Ghanem is a tailor, he has owned a workshop since 2004, making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has more than four years of experience in this field, and a deep understanding of the needs of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a tailoring machine, to build a display case and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, build a display case and pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Rahimkul

texts.ru: Рахимкул женат и имеет одного ребенка. Более 36 лет Рахмонкул занимается купле- продажей скота. За эти долгие годы он набрал богатого опыта и знает все слабые стороны бизнеса. В бизнесе помогает ему его любящая заботливая жена. Рахимкул хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия, чтобы жить в хороших условиях жизни. Рахимкул запрашивает займ для покупки стройматериалов на подстройки подсобных хозяйств и покупки скота для расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Rahimkul is married and has one child. For the last 36 years Rahimkul has been raising and selling cattle. Over the years he has gained a lot of experience and knows all of the pitfalls in the business. His loving and caring wife helps her husband with the livestock. Rahimkul wants to improve his living conditions and so to improve the quality of life for his family. Rahimkul is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to build new barns and sheds and to purchase additional animals for his herd. He is grateful to all of his lenders for their support and charity.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for new barns and animals for his herd

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is married with 4 children ages 8 to 15. All of them are currently in school. Odette owns a restaurant which she has run for 16 years. She would like a loan to increase her inventory of food in the restaurant. Any profits will be used to reinvest in her business. In the future, she would like to see her restaurant prosper.

loans.use: To add more foodstuffs in the restaurant

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. She has lost her husband and is now raising four children by herself. For the past ten years, Margret has been working hard to manage her produce stand in the local market. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes and other vegetables for resale, and it will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her side business (charcoal) and become a major supplier. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Eduardo Aquiles

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre soltero de 25 años de edad, el se dedica al oficio de transporte , le gusta este oficio porque le genera ingresos, Eduardo es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, el empezó en el negocio hace 2 años, gana un promedio de S/. 220.00 soles semanales.
Eduardo trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva por el importe de S/ 1000.00 soles lo invertirá  para darle mantenimiento general  a su mototaxi, uno de sus desafíos diarios que tiene que enfrentar es la competencia, uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano tenga una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar sus cuotas las fechas indicadas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a single, 25 year-old man who works in transportation.  He likes this trade because he can generate an income.  Eduardo is a hardworking and honest man who is very tenacious, and has a strong desire to get ahead.  He started his business 2 years ago, and he earns an average of 220 Peruvian soles per week. 

Eduardo works in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.  

With the loan that Kiva will grant him of 1,000 Peruvian soles, Eduardo will invest in general maintenance work for his mototaxi.  One of his daily challenges is that he faces a lot of competition.  One of his dreams is to have his own house so that in the not so distant future he could have a better quality of life.  His loan officer believes that he is a good client, and that he will make all of his payments by the due dates.

loans.use: to do general maintenance work on his mototaxi

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 48-years-old and married to Edward. They have three children.

She has been in the business for the last 16 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 7,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy enough sugar for selling and to build another business premise.

loans.use: to buy enough stock of sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding  his garden.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el socio  sigue dedicándose a su negocio de restaurant, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas, él socio continua elaborando diversos tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable el cual espera poder continuar trabajando con su negocio para continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos como menestras, carnes, arroz entre otros.

loans.use: para comprar insumos como menestras, carnes, arroz entre otros.

loans.name: Sithol

texts.en:
C. Sithol is married and lives with wife and three young children in a new village in Phnom Penh suburbs. He is a moto-taxi driver but is also sometimes employed as a constructor by the families in the neighborhood. He can make around 15,000 Riel daily profit.

 

C. Sithol has a plan to improve his family standards of living. He wants to sell his old motorbike for around $120 and purchase a new one that can pull a cart and which is worth $300. With his cart, C. Sithol will transport soil for people willing to fill their land. He expects to earn around 15,000 from this business.

 

C. Sithol is also building a new house for his family. He just dismantled the old one, which was made of wood, and will use the remaining $340 to buy materials. The house will have one single big room but they did not yet think about which color they want the walls to be painted.

loans.use: Building a new house and buying a new motorbike

loans.name: Marx

texts.en:
This 39-year-old man was born in Makhmudlu village in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan.
He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
He is married and has 4 children.
Marx has had his business for 8 years and it allows him to support his family. Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought powder, soaps, sweets.Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to begin sale of foodstuffs.

loans.use: General store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation, a local NGO based in Ghana, has been assisting women, especially in business, for quite a number of years now. Joyce B. is a client of this organization. She sells various items in her locality from house to house. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her improve upon her sales.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Estefana

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband works as a printer. Before she started her own business she used to sell clothes, but she decided to change trade as she knew more about jewellery than clothes and she is able to sell them better and has more clients. She started her business to help her husband to cover the household costs and to give her children a better quality of life, even though they do not live with her anymore. She is used to working and wants to be able to leave money for her children and their families.

Maria would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 3 months. She will used the loan to buy graduation rings which someone has asked her for and as they are very popular at the moment. She thanks you for your help that she hopes will enable her to keep on working and acheive her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y su esposo trabaja como impresor, ella trabajaba antes de su negocio actual en la venta de ropa, pero decidió cambiar de giro ya que tenía mayor conocimiento en joyas que en ropa, por ello comenzó a tener mejores ventas y a tener una mayor cantidad de clientes. Inició su negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y pudo dar educación a su hijo el cual ya no depende de ella, pero ella desea mantener y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo, ya que viven solos y nadie ve por ellos, además está acostumbrada a trabajar y quiere dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para ayudarlos con sus familias.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses, utilizará el préstamo para comprar anillos de graduación que le han solicitado, ya que en esta época son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ella te agradece mucho la colaboración que le das y espera seguir trabajando y lograr sus metas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata K. and her husband are both petty traders.  With four children, the twenty-five year old mother runs a small business of selling plastic shoes.  “The reason for both of us running petty trade is to meet our family’s life needs and save for the future of our children’s education”, said Fatmata’s husband.   Fatmata is determined to expand her business and develop her own capital.  She is therefore requesting a $175 loan.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of shoe selling business.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is one of the new members at Malie P centre.  She is 46 years old and has one child.  She joined the Program last week when she needed help for her small business.  She sells handicrafts to people of her village and also delivers to them to shops in town.  She earns $100.00-200.00 a week and uses that money for her family expenditures.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market stall

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Mr. K. is a vulnerable, low-income person. He is 34 and married with two children and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Aslan has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar of Saatli town for 10 years. The business is stable because Aslan has earned return customers during the time he has run this shop. However, there is no capital to diversify the inventory and increase the turnover, and thereby increase the income to provide all the necessities of life of his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral to give to Aslan credit, but Aslan has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, which disburses credit free of collateral, for a $500 loan. This credit would enable him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory

loans.name: Estervina Severino

texts.en:
Estervina is a many-sided businesswoman. She runs a cafeteria and sells vegetables in the public market. She operates the cafeteria just on weekends; during the week, you can see her next to her stall selling her fresh vegetables. Estervina is fifty years old and she has nine children, eight of them boys.

With her loan, Estervina plans on purchasing raw materials for her cafeteria and more vegetables to keep selling in the public market. She explains that she has gained a lot of experience from these long and arduous years of hard work. She says she will keep on working a lot to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase materials for a cafeteria and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Chiku A., who is married without children. In 2006 Chiku established a business selling fish, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock of fish in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Parni

texts.id:
Still at a young age, Ni Ketut Parni is an example of tenacity when it comes to helping her husband I Ketut Royen in meeting the needs of their lives. This includes the education of their child who is still in primary school. The income her husband makes as a laborer does not meet all of the needs of their family. Hence, Ni Ketut Parni operates and manages farmland to increase her family's income. The main crop in her farmland is cocoa trees, which she still grows using traditional methods without fertilizer or pesticides. Her production is sufficient to cover her expenses. However, several months ago her production decreased because of a pest infestation and high rainfall which has prevented the cocoa trees from producing good fruit. The drop in production along with an increase in the cost of living has hit her family hard. She isn't able to purchase fertilizer or medicine to cure her plants because she does not have enough capitol. Due to this lack of funding, she is not able to get her cocoa trees to produce fruit at their maximal rate. She hopes that a with a loan, she will be able to purchase the fertilizer and plant medicine that will allow her to produce good cocoa fruit again.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam usia yang masih cukup muda Ni Ketut Parni menunjukkan keuletannya dalam membantu suaminya I Ketut Royen dalam memenuhi segala keperluan hidup mereka, baik itu untuk di dapur maupun biaya-biaya lainnya termasuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang masih di sekolah dasar. Penghasilan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh tidak mampu memenuhi semua kebutuhan keluarga mereka, sehingga Ni Ketut Parni berusaha semaksimal mungkin mengusahakan pengelolaan kebunnya untuk bisa menambah pemasukan keluarganya. Kebun yang dimilikinya dominan dengan tanaman kakao yang masih dipelihara dangan cara tradisional tanpa penambahan pupuk ataupun obat-obatan pembasmi hama. Hasil produksi yang diperoleh cukup untuk bisa menutupi pengeluaran-pengeluaran yang ada. Namun dalam beberapa bulan terakhir jumlah produksi tanaman kakaonya menurun karena serangan hama dan tingginya curah hujan yang menyebabkan tanaman kakaonya tidak bisa memproduksi buah yang bagus sehingga pendapatannya juga jauh berkurang sedangkan biaya hidup semakin bertambah. Untuk pengadaan pupuk ataupun obat pembasmi hama tidak bisa dilakukannya karena terbatasnya modal yang dimiliki, sehingga perawatan atas tanaman kakaonya tidak bisa dilakukan dengan maksimal. Kemudian DINARI memberinya bantuan modal usaha dan itu dimanfaatkannya untuk membeli pupuk dan juga obat pembasmi hama, dengan harapan tanaman kakaonya bisa menghasilkan buah yang baik.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and anti-desease medicine for her cocoa trees

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: Abdulai Mara is 36 years old and is married with 2 children.  He received a loan from SMT and used the loan proceeds to hire a labourer and to purchase vegetable seeds.  Further, he invested part of that loan to expand his rice farm.  Because of the loan, he was pleased to have harvested 5 additional 50 kilogram bags of rice, and 200 more heads of cabbage.  Not surprisingly, his income increased as a result of the considerable growth he has witnessed on his farm in terms of crop yields.  Abdulai would like to expand his rice farm and is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to do so.

loans.use: To expand his farm to capitalize on the considerable growth on his farm in terms of crop yields

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence prepares and sells plain rice with either tomato or bean sauce to school children. She also garnishes her dishes with vegetables like carrots, cabbage, cucumbers, etc to make them more appetizing. She is a married woman with two children. The children are in school now.

She wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, gallons of vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her operation. She hopes to start saving to be able to pay for the children’s education.

Florence is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Group members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, vegetables, and gallons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr:
Akua A. is 28 years old, married, and a mom. All her children attend school. She manages a shop with her husband in order to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Ms. Akou wishes to use this loan to make a large purchase of beans and corn to resell in the shop, which is located next to the marketplace in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Akua A. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle gère une boutique avec son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et de leurs frais scolaires. Madame Akou désire avec ce crédit, faire un grand achat des haricots et du maïs pour revendre dans la boutique, qui est située à côte du marché à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Cet achat lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To make a big purchase of beans and corn

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Ms. Safiatou I. is originally from Sakete, which is the region of Plateau. She was born around 1968 in Cotonou, south of Benin. She is married to Mr. Sanoussi Razack and they have three children. Their firstborn Adjara is unschooled. I. sells toothbrushes and toothpaste. She wishes to establish herself in a home-based business in a space her husband built in their house. Just as equally, she is considering to strengthen her cosmetics products business, but she does not have enough funds. Therefore, she requests this loan to meet all her expectations.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame I. Safiatou, originaire de SAKETE dans le département du Plateau, est née vers 1968 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN.
