Mariée à Monsieur SANOUSSI Razack, elle a à charge trois enfants dont l'ainée Adjara n'est pas scolarisée. I. vend des brosses à dents et des pâtes dentifrices. Elle désire s'installer dans une baraque que son mari lui a construite en leur domicile. Egalement, elle envisage renforcer son activité par la vente de produits cosmétiques mais elle n'a pas suffisament de liquidité. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour combler toutes ses attentes.

loans.use: Buy 12 boxes of cosmetic products

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, a member of the El Trébol Village Bank, is a widowed 61-year-old mother of five children, one of whom lives with her. Zenaida sells canchas (corn and rice snacks) and wine. Acquiring the wine from taverns in the city of Chincha, she resells it to various stores in Ayacucho. She purchases the cancha from the city of Lima, and then resells her products in the Ayacuchana jungles. Zenaida now needs needs a loan of $375 to purchase additional wine.

Her dream is to construct a home, help her son finish his studies, and ensure the stability of her business.

loans.use: To invest in wine for resale.

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa is 50 years old. She is married and lives in the Máximo Jerez colony. Her husband works in a private enterprise as the sales advisor. They have 3 children of school age which they need to support in their studies so that they become professionals and thus are able to improve their standard of living. For 18 years, in the neighborhood where they live, Luisa has sold foods at night (a fritanga or “grill” style restaurant). This merchant activity began by selling chicken by pound on foot, then in a small truck. Subsequently she located the business in her house to carry out sales, and it was there where she decided to put the fritanga in order to generate more income for the maintenance of her family.

The loan will be used to purchase beef, porki and chicken for investment in her business, and thus to give her more to offer her clients to give them better service.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Luisa tiene 50 años de edad, habita en la colonia Máximo Jerez, es casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada como asesor de ventas, tienen 3 hijos de edad quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, y a los cuales necesitan apoyar en sus estudios para que éstos lleguen a ser profesionales y así poder mejorar su nivel de vida. Desde hace 18 años en el barrio donde habitan Luisa tiene una venta de comidas por las noches (fritanga). La actividad de comerciante la empezó vendiendo pollo por libra de manera ambulante, esto lo hacia en una camioneta, posteriormente se ubicó en su casa de habitación para realizar las ventas, y fue ahí donde decidió poner la fritanga para así generar más ingresos para la manutención de su familia.

El préstamo será usado para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo para inversión de su negocio, y así darle atender la oferta de sus clientes y darles un mejor servicio

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ndate

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndate T. est agee de trente deux ans et fait du commerce depuis sept ans. Elle vend des produits divers d'alimentation générale dans la maison parternelle sise à Ngouye Sombel
texts.en:
Miss Ndate T. is 32 years old and has been working in commerce for seven years. She sells various food items in her father's house located in Ngouye Sombel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell general food items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of equipment to start a beauty salon

loans.name: Cléber

texts.es: Clever tiene 29 años  es soltero vive en casa de su familia. Clever se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chompas tejidas a lana, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años, aprendiendo de su madre quien era muy diestra en este arte. A Cléber siempre le ha llamado la atención el tejido ya que veía desde muy pequeño a su madre confeccionar diversos tipos de prendas, además que le permite crear y desarrollar toda su creatividad. Lo más difícil del tejido es el  utilizar la máquina ya que el tiene que realizar diversos tipos de puntos para elaborar las chompas que posteriormente vende en los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita Clever, comprara más lana para aumentar la producción de chompas de su pequeño taller.
texts.en:
Cléber is a 29-year-old bachelor who lives at home with his family. He makes and sells knitted wool sweaters, a business in which he has been engaged for six years, having learned it from his mother who was a very skilled artisan. Cléber has been interested in knitting since he saw his mother making various types of garments when he was young, and it lets him create and develop the whole range of his creativity. The greatest difficulty in knitting is using the machine as he has to choose all sorts of settings in order to make the sweaters he will later sell in the city’s busiest marketplaces. Cléber made all the payments on his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma on time. With the money that he is requesting, Cléber will buy more wool to increase the output of sweaters from his small workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool to produce more sweaters

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 63, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She runs a grocery store, making around US$6 each day, and her husband sells traditional medicine and makes about US$1.5 per day.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has become out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. San S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more groceries to meet her clients' demands. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana F. T. sells shoes and clothing for a living. She has a post in the local market where she offers sneakers, children’s shoes, and men’s and women’s clothing. The proceeds from Viviana’s business help support her family which consists of her husband (also a clothing vendor) and her three children.

Viviana has been borrowing money through Manuela Ramos for three years to support her business. She is a member of the Las Paykanas communal bank and she first started out with loans of just under $100.

Viviana is currently requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase stock for her market stall. She will buy dozens of sandals, pants for women and men, blouses, and children’s t-shirts. Viviana plans to repay her loan monthly over the course of four months.

loans.use: Viviana would like to purchase mens', womens' & childrens' clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: Rang L. is 19 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and cooking food. Currently, she is pregnant and hopes to have a baby in 5 months. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home making drums. The drums are made from palm trees. He can make around 4 to 6 drums a day to sell at the market to earn an approximate US$ 7.50 per day. This couple would like to take out a loan to purchase more palm trees to use to make drums.

loans.use: To buy palm trees to use to make drums

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: S. is 35 years old and lives in Dongkor District of Phnom Penh City, where he makes a daily income by selling ice-cream. He currently uses his trailer-motorbike to transport ice-creams and sell them in and around Phnom Penh City. Most of his clients are pupils. He is married to Creb, 41, who is a rice farmer. The family has three children; two of them are employed as garment factory workers. S.'s family faces a problem with transportation expenses as they always pay for taxis. To solve the problem, S. is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle for the family to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Diana A., 35, takes care of her four children. Three are in basic school and one has not started school yet. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for five years now.

Diana is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding slippers and plastics to her store to diversify her trading.

Diana is a member of the community group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda R. is 45 years old and married to Rico, a farmer and at the same time, a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver. They have three children; all are studying. Imelda sells her ready-to-wear clothes  or "RTWs" (local wholesale clothing brand) to her  neighbors and in the neighboring barangays (townships) in their area. Imelda is a good member of the cooperative, in fact she has accessed more than 10 loans for her business and she manages it well. She wants to expand her business and to have a better life and a great future for her children.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of assorted RTW clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Rana has owned a photography studio since 2000. She requested a loan of 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for her studio. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her studio by purchasing new tools. Rana is special in her work because she does nice pictures and knows how to suit her clients. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her work, she didn’t have the startup capital and didn’t have all the needed equipment. Rana decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Rana will use the loan to purchase tools for her studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 47 years old. He is married and has six children. He sells provisions and drinks.

He hopes for a loan in the amount of N100,000, which he plans to use to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nimfa M. wishes to apply for a loan from ASHI amounting to Php7,000. This loan would be her source of capital to put up her sari-sari store (mini variety store). At the same time, Nimfa would spend a small portion of her loan for her farm inputs. Rice she will be harvesting, will be sold in her own store.

Out of the income her business could generate, Nimfa plans to save in order to achieve her dream of building a house that would secure her and her only child against any kind of calamity, sickness, and any forms of harm. Nimfa wishes that someday, there will be no more raindrops falling into their house.

Since Nimfa's husband died, she is the one who stood as a father and mother to her only child, Jenilyn M.. Her courage and perseverance were tested several times already yet she remained determined for her child. Furthermore, she was able to send her daughter to school up to college and have her graduate as a teacher. However, because of the country's problem with employment generation, Nimfa's daughter could not practice her expertise and could not get employed. Therefore, she can't help her mother augment their income for their everyday expenses.  

Through Nimfa's membership in ASHI and the loan she availed, she and her daughter were given a chance to get employed by putting up their own business. Nimfa and her daughter had to work hard to achieve their dreams and could experience a better life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita T. runs a sari-sari (general) store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 68 years old, widowed and has two adult children. She is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Paquita has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Paquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda T. is a 44-year-old entrepreneur from Northern Samar who migrated to Manila during her teens. She now lives with her husband, Noel, age 44, a master baker, and their four school-aged children in a social housing facility provided by Habitat for Humanity for poor families like them in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.

Imelda owns and manages a grocery store that also sells rice and an adjacent bakery, because her husband is an experienced baker. She has been in this business since 1995. She also now sells liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) cylinders for household use.

She has just received a new loan of Php 50,000.00 from CCT Credit Cooperative. She used the proceeds from this loan to purchase additional goods for her grocery store and additional raw materials for bread production. Because it is very costly to transport her goods from the market to the her store, she dreams of buying her own delivery vehicle some day.

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her grocery store, raw materials for bread making, and stocks of rice

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 57 years old. Rosalia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a direct seller of Personal Collection products at Christine Village of Cauayan City. She is already 27 years old and is doing her best to become successful in her new business. She earns a monthly income of PHP1, 000 in the business and aside from that, she is also managing a food processing business. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP8, 000 as additional business capital. Jackielyn hopes to fulfill her dream which is to become successful in her direct selling business in the future with the financial support from Kiva lenders. 

She is very patient in dealing with her customers and as much as possible she give quality service them. She is married to Reynaldo D. who is also trying his best in earning income through a tricycle transport business in their town. They have two children namely; Raymark - 9 years old and Mark Joseph - 6 years of age, who are in the primary level of education.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
La señora MARIA DOMINGA T. J. , tiene 47 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de primaria,  refiere que por falta de recursos económicos  no pudo estudiar más.
MARIA está casada , tiene 3 hijos todos pequeños que dependen económicamente de ella.
MARIA se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado cercano a su casa.
La ropa que vende la trae de Lima, pero también vende juguetes y regalos.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra  ropa que trajo de Lima para vender en el mercado.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar ropa, juguetes y regalos.
MARIA DOMINGA sueña con  tener un stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo para vender su ropa , juguetes y regalos y obtener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: lo utilizara para comprar ropa, juguetes y regalos.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is thirty – eight years old. She is divorced and has give birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Yaa is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table top by a road side in her community. Yaa buys bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina I. is now 42 years old married to Hospicio I. now 65 years old work in their place as a Barangay Kagawad, an elected government official who is a member of the Barangay Council (a smallest political unit in the Philippines. Her husband is older than her by 23 years that is why it is more responsible in making income for their family. But Dina as a mother of 4 children Hydin 18 years old, Mary Genevive 17 years old, Jun David 16 years old and Jayvee 14 years old, is very concern with her children in terms of their education. She wants her children finish their studies until college. So Dina thinks of another way to help her husband in making income for them. This is the start of her business which is buy and sells of different kind of fish which place in the market near in their house.

Her first problem is where she will get a capital to start this business. The solution came up when she joined to Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). She used the loan that she received as a capital to start this business. Now she will use again the loan that she received for this business. She will buy necessary things needed by her business like assorted fish to be sell, container with Styrofoam, ice for preserving the fish and weighing scale. Also she wants to use it for her secondary business which raising of pigs, she will buy another piglet to raise and feeds for them.

Dina really wish that her business will continue to run, for her to be able to reach her dream of someday her children will be a degree holder.

loans.use: For additional capital to her buy & sell of fish business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Our client is Sabina. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. Sabina is from Ccorao. She is 36 years old and is married with 2 children who study in primary and secondary school.

Sabina has been working with Arariwa since 2004. She sells artisan paintings that she paints in her home studio. She sells her paintings to large art stores - sometimes even stores in Chile ask her to send paintings to sell in their stores. She will use this loan to buy artist supplies for her artisan painting business. 100 grams of paint can cost from 125 – 150 soles. She buys her supplies from Lima because it’s more economical. Sabina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy artist supplies for her artisan painting business

loans.name: Liz Carol

texts.es:
La señora  LIZ CAROL A. A. tiene 27 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  LA PERBOLA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5TO de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 9 años quien dependen económicamente de ella.
La socia  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos de damas y niñas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para la fabricación de zapatos, compró: cuero, hebillas, tacos, plantas, hormas, terocal, etc.
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará cuero, cuerina, lona, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, etc.
Liz sueña con tener su propio taller de fabricación de calzado parta así poder aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
LIZ CAROL A. A., 27, lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the LA PERBOLA communal bank. She finished 11th grade, has a life partner and has a 9-year-old son who depend on her economically. She makes and sells womens and girls shoes. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought materials to make shoes. She bought leather, buckles, heels, soles, shoe trees, terokal (a high performance adhesive), etc. With this 500 new sol loan she will buy leather, naugahyde, canvas, adhesive, thread, buckles, etc. She dreams with having her own workshop in order to increase her sales and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather, naugahyde, canvas, adhesive, thread, buckles, etc. for footwear manufacture.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 43 años de edad, es separada desde hace cuatro años y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 14 y 18 años de edad en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La separación de su esposo le motivó a trabajar para ganarse el sustento de sus hijas. Se dedica principalmente a la comercialización de animales: todos los miércoles viaja hacia los caseríos de la zona y compra aves de corral (patos, pavos) que luego vende a los comerciantes de carne del mercado de la ciudad. Ella sacrifica a las aves y las vende listas para ser comercializadas. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de su familia.

De otro lado se dedica a la preparación y venta de vino. Empezó en este negocio hace dos años gracias a que una de sus hijas aprendió el oficio en el colegio donde estudiaba. Marcela fermenta la bebida en baldes de plástico y las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos.

Marcela desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para lograr su objetivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre que siempre da todo de sí para sacar a sus hijas adelante. La mayor está estudiando ya una carrera técnica. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su dos hijas convertidas en profesionales exitosas. En la fotografía Marcela nos muestra los baldes en donde fermenta el vino que suele comercializar.
texts.en:
Marcela is 43 years old and has been separated for the past four years. She lives together with her two daughters, 14 and 18, in the San Martín sector of the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

The separation from her husband motivated her to work to earn the means of support for her daughters. She is involved mainly in the animal business: every Wednesday she goes to the farmhouses in the area and buys poultry (ducks, turkeys) which she then sells to the meat shopkeepers in the city market. She sacrifices the birds and sells them ready to be marketed. This business is the main source of income for her family.

On the other side, she is involved in the preparation and sale of wine. She began this business two years ago thanks to the fact that one of her daughters learned the trade in the high school where she studied. Marcela ferments the drink in plastic buckets and sells it to her neighbors and acquaintances.

Marcela wishes to expand her business and enter the goat and sheep market, but she does not have the necessary funds to achieve her goal. As a result, she has seen it necessary to ask for a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

She is a mother that always gives all of herself to help her daughters get ahead. Her oldest is now studying for a technical degree. Her biggest wish is to see her two daughters become successful professionals. In the photo, Marcela shows us the buckets where she ferments the wine that she usually sells.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals to sell

loans.name: Bachira

texts.fr: S. Bachira est née en 1974 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à MOUNIROU Issiaka, Bachira est mère de quatre enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Bachira vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis trois ans de cela que Bachira vit dans ce quartier. Bachira vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Bachira n'a fait que l'école primaire. Depuis près de 15 ans, Bachira vend des tissus (bazins) à Missèbo à Cotonou. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Bachira s'approvisionne. C'est la première fois que Bachira sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à agrandir son activité et à mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Bachira S. was born in 1974 in Sakété, in the department of l'Ouémé in Benin. Married to Issiaka Mounirou, Bachira is the mother of four children. Some of the children are in school. Bachira lives together with her children and husband in the Adogléta area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bachira has lived in this area for three years. Bachira helps her husband provide for the family. Bachira only completed her primary education. For close to 15 years, Bachira has sold fabric (damask) at Missèbo in Cotonou. It is in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin, that Bachira gets her supplies. This is the first time Bachira is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners); this loan will help her enlarge her business and better satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric (damask)

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Mrs. Khai C. is a villager in Chuos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she earns income as a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Khai C. is 54 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Flamencos Group

texts.es:
Venta de CDs, trenzado de mantas, venta de plantas medicinales, venta de verduras,  fabricación de calzados y atención de tienda de barrio. Son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Flamencos que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani. Esta será para muchas su primera experiencia de crédito y están  motivadas y con optimismo de mejorar y hacer crecer sus negocios. Así por ejemplo Elena Q. de 25 años vende Cds en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto  y desea hacer crecer su negocio, Feliza M. de 29 años trenza mantas hace 3 años en su domicilio y quiere fortalecer se negocio.
Todas necesitan comprar mercadería, materia prima  e insumos para sus negocios y ofrecer productos buenos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Flamencos Group are involved in a variety of retail businesses selling CDs, braided rugs, medicinal plants, vegetables, footwear, and groceries. They are part of the Collpani Community Center. For many of the members, this will be their first experience working with credit. They are motivated and optimistic about improving and expanding their businesses. For example, Elena Q. is 25 years old and sells CDs at different fairs in the city of El Alto. She desires to grow her business. Feliza M. is 29 years old and has been manufacturing rugs out of her home. She wants to make her business stronger.

All of the members need to buy merchandise, materials, and supplies for their businesses so they can provide good products to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & materials

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of earning a living of Flora, 46 years old. She owns a rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato. The eldest of her five children is 20 years old. She strives hard in order to support the education of her children.

She needs financial support for her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan amounting to Php 15,000. With this amount she can purchase farm inputs. This way the basic needs of her family will be met.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 53 years old and has a rice-farming business. She has two children in her family and does everything to lift up her family. This is the only way she can provide their needs.

Manuela is now requesting a loan of 8,000 Php to buy seed and supplies for her farm. This loan helps her to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen T. is 28 years old and lives in Kapan. He is married and has a two-year-old son.

For about six years Armen has managed his own café where he serves his clients and also takes orders for meal preparation without home delivery.

Armen wants to increase the number of his clients, so he decided to increase the area of his café. Now he needs 350,000 AMD to roof a new area of his café.

loans.use: To roof a new area of his café

loans.name: Betzaida

texts.es: Betzaida, de 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus  2 hijos pequeños, en una casa  ubicada en una populosa zona al sur de la ciudad.Antes  sólo administraba el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet,  que instaló  su esposo en su casa; pero desde hace 3 meses,  también realiza bordados  a polos de algodón, mientras atiende el negocio de su esposo. A diario realiza estos bordados para un mayorista que los recoge terminados, y trabajar  la  llena de mucha satisfacción,  pues se siente  muy contenta por la agilidad  que tiene en sus manos, y está muy agradecida con su amiga que la recomendó. Este negocio le parece muy rentable, por las buenas ganancias que le genera, y lo realiza en la tranquilidad de  su casa, sin descuidar a sus hijos. Además está satisfecha porque ahora puede trabajar y ganar  su propio dinero.Es el primer préstamo que tiene, y se compromete a pagar las cuotas establecidas puntualmente. Espera llevarse  bien con las integrantes de su banco comunal ya que quiere trabajar con posteriores créditos.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá  en la compra de diversidad de hilos, para realizar su trabajo efectivamente, y así continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Betzaida, 33, lives with her husband and two, small children in a house located in a densely-populated area in the south of the city. She used to just administer an Internet service, renting Internet booth time that her husband set up in their house. But, for the last three months she has been doing embroidery on cotton polo shirts while watching over her husband’s business. She works on her embroidery daily and delivers her finished products to a wholesaler. Working makes her feel much fulfilled because she is happy with the agility in her hands and very grateful to her girlfriend that recommended her. She believes this business is profitable because it generates good earnings and she can do it in the tranquility of her home without neglecting her children. Besides, she is satisfied because she can now work and earn her own money. This is her first loan and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She hopes to get along well with her fellow communal bank members because she wants to be part of subsequent loans. She will use the funds to buy a variety of threads so that her work will be more efficient and continue thereby to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery thread.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is widowed with five children and all her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Ruth takes care of additional family members.  The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Ruth owns grocery shop selling cold drinks and edibles. She works six days a week. Ruth receives at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Ruth has been in this business for 30 years and her business challenges include the rainy season because she works from a muddy place and seasonality. Ruth has been with MCDT for six years servicing her 14th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, boxes of minerals water and other juices plus cakes and donuts. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more soda, passion fruit and mineral water

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean C. is from the village of Mahayahay, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Jean is married and has 3 school-aged children. Jean owns & operates a food production/sales  business where she sells snacks & other delicacies. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as start-up capital. Jean is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es:
A pesar de que nuestra socia Mercedes le ha tocado criar a su hijo sola eso para ella no ha sido un impedimento para salir adelante, actualmente forma parte del Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

La señora Mercedes tiene 34 años es madre de un pequeño niño de 8 años, su ocupación es de comerciante, tiene la venta de ropa para damas, caballero y niños, al mismo tiempo que sale a recorrer productos de Yanbal y utensilio de cocina, es una mujer bastante luchadora se las ingenia para que el tiempo le alcance y pueda vender y no descuidar a su hijo que tanto la necesita, por las mañana se levanta a preparar el desayuno para su niño lo lleva a la escuela y se queda recorriendo sus productos hasta el medio día para reunirse con su niño no tienen que le ayuda a cuidarlo, y cuando tiene que salir en las tardes lo lleva con ella.

La señora Mercedes invierte todo el crédito que recibe de la Fundación en sus negocios, por decir en los productos de belleza tiene que comprar al contado, para poder dejar a crédito a sus clientas,  en la venta por cartilla de pagos es donde mejor se gana según sea el electrodoméstico mejor es la ganancia.

El sueño de nuestra socia es estudiar párvularia le gusta mucho tratar con niños y aspira poder algún día hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Even though Mercedes has brought up her son by herself, this has never been a problem for her. She is currently a member of the Pequeños Comerciantes (Small Businesspeople) Community Bank in the town of Portoviejo. Mercedes is 34 years old and has an 8-year old son. She runs a business selling clothing for men, women, and children and also sells Yanbal beauty products and kitchen equipment. A very hard-working woman, Mercedes juggles her time so that she can both work and look after her son who needs so much care. Every morning she gets up and prepares food for him to take to school. She spends the morning travelling around selling her merchandise, and then at midday she meets her son again. There is no one else to help look after him. When she has to go out again in the afternoon, she takes him with her. Mercedes invests all the money she gets from the Foundation back into her business, in other words into the beauty products that she has to buy on account. She then lets her clients purchase them on credit. Catalog sales provide good profits, with sales of kitchen appliances being best of all. Mercedes’ dream is to study to be a nursery school teacher as she loves working with children. One day she hopes to turn this dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Yanbal beauty products and small kitchen appliances

loans.name: Bella Aurora

texts.es:
Tiene 60 años, casada y  5 hijos. Trabaja 10 años de cocinera en una quinta, es jefa del área de cocina; también  se dedica una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa en la ciudadela nuevo paraíso de la parroquia nuevo colon, es de Chone y  vive en Portoviejo hace 30 años, tiene casa propia; su esposo trabaja en la quinta de su hermana en varios oficios y le va muy bien.Compra jabón y azúcar al por mayor.

 Tiene 6 nietos y   todo el dinero que se gana es para ayudar a  sus nietos, que se los dejo un hijo que se fue a vivir a España y nunca mas regreso.

  Vende también útiles de escuela, se dedica a tratar las piscinas del negocio es de su hermana, una quinta recreacional.

Lo que le queda de vida quiere dedicarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Bella is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She has worked ten years as a cook at a boarding house, where she heads up the kitchen. Bella also operates a small grocery store out of her home in the city of Nuevo Paraíso in Nuevo Colon Parish. She is from Chone, but has been living in Portoviejo for the past 30 years and owns a home there. Her husband performs various jobs at her sister’s boarding house and is doing very well. She will buy soap and sugar in bulk.

Bella has six grandchildren and all the money she earns goes toward helping them. One of her children moved to Spain and has never returned. She also sells school supplies and maintains the swimming pools at her sister’s business, since it is a recreational boarding house.

She wants to remain devoted to her family for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mr. C. is a married man who has two school-aged children who depend on him. He resides with other family members in his own small family home in Siem Reap province.

C. owns a machine that he uses to mill rice belonging to farmers who bring the rice directly to his house. In addition, C. uses any bran from the process to feed a few pigs. His wife is a good housewife and also assists him in the business activity.

C. desires to accumulate more piglets for his stall by asking for a $150 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To accumulate more piglets

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en: Pamella is a 40-year-old married lady. She is blessed with three children ages 14, 9, and 5. She has been tailoring for ten years in Kibera slums in Nairobi. She used to operate a salon. She also earns extra income from her retail shop. Pamella has been saving her money in a group in Faulu Kenya.   This has helped her because she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya. Previously, she took out a loan of 20,000 KES and successfully repaid it. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cloth lining, thread, and buttons. She hopes to expand her shop into a wholesale shop. She plans to use her profit from tailoring to improve the shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth lining, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Damba

texts.fr: T. damba est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et de bazins, elle  a 3 ans d'expérience dans ce commerce, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. voulant gonfler son stock pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire elle sollicite son premier crédit pour l'achat de d'une vingtaine de pagnes et d'une dizaine de bazins. elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. elle est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
T. Damba is a very energetic woman whose line of business is selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric] and “basins” [damask-type fabric]. She has three years of experience and her customer base is diverse. Wishing to expand her stock and increase her income, she is seeking her first loan in order to purchase about twenty sets of “pagnes” and a dozen sets of “basins.” She sells her goods as a street vendor. She is single and has one dependent.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional fabrics for resale

loans.name: Tugolokoke Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Nineteen years is the time 40-year-old Eva N. has spent having an oversight role over her retail business in Kyetume-Mukono. With 70,000 shillings as weekly profits, Eva has shown that through hard work and determination, one can achieve a great deal. This business has been bringing her dividends since she began it. 

She initially was a farmer and after the idea of diversifying her business crossed her mind, she made a decision to start her retail shop. She also operates a pig husbandry and poultry business. These have contributed to her drive to make more profits. With this loan, she wants to purchase retail items, such as sugar and maize flour, in bulk for resale.

loans.use: The purchase in bulk of more retail items such as sugar and maize flour, amongst other things, for resale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 41 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en hermosa selva  tropical peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Rolando, recuerda mucho que desde su adolescencia le encantaba vender el  producto de cacao que sus padres cultivaban. Hoy tiene su propio negocio agrícola, además sus clientes están más que contentos por el producto que les brinda y a un precio razonable. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, para que de esa manera puedan facilitarlo en la extracción y traslado de su producto de cacao hacia los centros de acopio de su  comunidad. En el futuro anhela ampliar su producción para adquirir nuevos terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de que pueda aumentar sus ventas de manera considerable. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus respectivas cuotas, además se siente contento con su banco comunal, ya que todos los socios están comprometidos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra, de insumos y abono, con la finalidad de que le dé un cuidado adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Rolando is 41 years old. He lives with his spouse and has four school-age children. They live in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located in the beautiful tropical jungle of Peru. They have their own house there made of adobe. Rolando remembers that since his adolescence he has loved selling the cacao that his parents grew. Today he has his own farming business and his customers are very happy with the product that he offers at a reasonable price. In generalm, he works on his own, but during the planting and harvesting seasons, he works with laborers so that they can facilitate the extraction and transport the cacao product to the warehousing centers in the community. In the future, he hopes to expand his production to adquire more arable land so that he can increase his sales considerably. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is committed to continue making the respective payments. In addition, he is happy with his communal bank, since all og the members are dedicated. With the loan that he is asking for he plans on buying materials and fertilizer so that he can adequately care for his cacao plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve the quality of cacao that he produces.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Recuerda que para llegar a lo que tiene ahora le costó mucho sacrificio y el saber aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentaba, ya que desde muy joven anhelaba tener su propia tienda, y lo logró, pero su adaptación no fue tan rápido, ya que obtenía pocas ventas, debido a que no tenía experiencia en la buena atención a sus clientes. Hoy con la experiencia que tiene, se siente más en confianza, incluso sus clientes están más que satisfechos por el producto que los ofrece y de la buena atención que los brinda hacia ellos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda con el propósito de que pueda mantener a sus clientes más antiguos, de esa manera pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme  con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de suministrar su tienda.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 43, is married and has three school age children. They live together in Quimbiri, which is located in the edge of the Peruvian jungle. That is where she has her own house, which is made of wood. She recalls that it cost her a lot of sacrifice and knowing how to take advantage of the opportunities that presented themselves in order to get where she is today. Ever since she was very young she longed to have her own store, and she got it. But, her adjustment was not so fast. She had few sales because she did not have experience in giving her customers good service. Now, with the experience she has, she feels more confident. Even her customers are more satisfied with the products she sells and the good service that she gives them. She generally works on her own, but during vacation times she gets help from her children. She sells in her own neighborhood. Her future plan is to expand her business so that she can keep her oldest customers. That way she will be able to improve her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to continue making her payments on time. Also, she gets along well with her communal bank because it provides many benefits. She will use the requested loan to buy basic needs merchandise in order to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with basic needs products

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es: Natividad tiene 66 años y es viuda, lleva 8 años sustentándose con el alquiler D. los cuartos en sus casa y ah trabajado con Edaprospo desD. hace 2 años y medio, hace poco acaba D. hacer mejoras en su casa para tener a sus clientes contentos y si tuviera un buen capital D. dinero lo invertiría techando su casa y haciendo mas cuartos. El grupo D. la cual es socia se llama “Las Esteritas” el cual esta conformado por sus vecinos  y lleva el mismo nombre D. la Urbanización.
texts.en:
Natividad, 66, is a widow. She has been supporting herself for 8 years renting out rooms in her house. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for two and a half years. A short while ago she completed improvements in her home to keep her lodgers happy and, if she had a good amount of capital, she’d invest it in reroofing her house and building more rooms. The group she is a member of is called “Las Esteritas” and its members are her neighbors and it’s named after their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Genisa

texts.en:
Genisa C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 35 years old. Genisa is married and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 2. To make a living, Genisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Genisa works very hard to be able to provide for her family.

Genisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Genisa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos para moto que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, ella junto con su esposo tienen este negocio de venta de repuestos de moto y sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para las motos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elaine belongs to the community bank Richhary Anteña, located in the district of Izcuchaca which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Elaine is 35 years of age and married with three children. She alternates her daily tasks with her business selling spare tyres for motorcycles, working from 8am until 7pm so that she and her husband can raise their children. She would like to expand this business and so she is applying for a loan to purchase spare motorcycle tyres.

Elaine is grateful to everyone whose contribution makes her dream a reality and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase spare motorcycle tyres

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Ramiro reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo, él es empleado tiene 22 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en una tienda de ropa y Ramiro en una empresa de mensajería, son una pareja joven y juntos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar, Ellos desean construir y para esto deben comprar materiales de construcción pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario.
Él solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión ayudándoles a que cuenten con su propio hogar ya que por el momento viven en casa de la mamá de Ramiro; Su principal objetivo es construir su propio hogar, una vivienda digna y cómoda mejorando así las condiciones de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Ramiro resides with his wife and young child in El Transito, Department of San Miguel. He is 22 years old and employed. His wife works at a clothing store while he is employed by a message delivery company. This young couple works together to meet their household expenses. They want to build a house and need to buy construction materials, but they do not have the necessary funds.

The loan Ramiro is requesting will be used as an investment to help him secure his own home since he currently lives at his mother’s house. His main objective is to build his own house, a decent and comfortable home that will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina A. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Lorina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles and snacks in the local community. Lorina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Lorina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lorina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Kelly Samanta

texts.es:
Kelly de 21 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Empezó a vender productos de uso personal desde que salió del colegio. Poco a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes y puso un local con vitrinas para vender a mayor volumen.  Trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, shampoo a un precio muy económico. Debido a la delincuencia en su local a puesto rejas para una mayor seguridad (aparece en la foto).    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como perfumes, cremas,  vitrinas. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en: Kelly is 21 years old and sells Yambal products (a company that offers enterprising women opportunities for independent sales).  She lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist destinations that is known for its diversity of seafood.  She started selling personal use products when she left school.  Little by little, she has increased her customer base and set up a local with a display case to sell more products.  She starts work very early selling to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and shampoo at a very affordable price.  Because of crime in her area she put up bars to provide better security (as it appears in the photo).  With the loan she wants to buy products such as perfumes, creams and display cases.  In the future, she wants to have her own house and to go to college.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams and deodorants

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn N. is a single woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham Province, which is the best territory for farming. She was married but she divorced her husband years ago. Korn N. is devoted to her three children, and all of them are employed in various occupations in order to share their income with Korn N. for daily expenses. Korn N. has a few farmlands that she inherited from her grandmother. Korn N. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect her profits when they are mature. Recently, her crop has not been growing well because it lacks fertilizers. Because of that obstacle, Korn N. has decided to seek a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her planting. The rest of the loan she will use to purchase an extra piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and land for farming.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun S., 23, is employed at a hotel, earning U.S. $1.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat and other temples.

Her family spends U.S. $50 on food, $15 on electricity, and $30 on other expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of U.S. $700 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to repair a house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, D. 51 años, vive con su hija pequeña en su casa que es propia.DesD. hace 4 años, se dedica a varios negocios, ligados al comercio, entre los que se encuentran la venta D.  cerveza y también paralelamente mercería. En la búsqueda D. nuevas oportunidades ha decidido implementar un nuevo negocio, y así hace unos días comercializa  comida aprovechando la ubicación D. su casa que esta ubicada en una avenida muy transitada. Ella ofrece almuerzos y su pequeña hija la ayuda en la atención D. las mesas cuando realizan los pedidos, y esta muy satisfecha pues estas actividades le permiten sostener los gastos D. su hogar. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un puesto D. venta D. prendas D. vestir.Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Isabel tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito  en la compra D.  mercadería en víveres y también gaseosas pues necesita abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 51 years old.  She lives with her young daughter in her own home.  She has been working in several sales-related business activities for 4 years.  These businesses incluD. selling beer and also sewing supplies.  Seeking new opportunities, Isabel has decided to set up a new business and so she has just started selling meals, taking advantage of the fact that her house is located on a very busy avenue.  She offers breakfasts and her young daughter helps her to serve at the tables when people make their orders.  She is very satisfied because these activities allow her to cover her household expenses.  In the future, she is planning to set up a sales location to sell clothes.

This is Isabel's fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments and she likes being a member of her community bank because the members are all responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She thanks all the people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Isabel is planning to use her loan money to buy foodstuffs and soda as she needs to stock her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and soda for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three children who are attending school. She cooperates with her husband who works in the construction field in meeting the family's income needs. After having 8 years of experience in the clothing field, she decided in 2005 to open a clothing store. She purchases her products from a local clothing center. She has obtained 3 Kiva loans and she has been a very good client with punctual payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplementary products so she can increase her sales and therefore improve her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing staple foods for resale

loans.name: Kamako

texts.en: Kamako A. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 64 years old and married with 8 children, 4 of them in school. A. is involved in agriculture whereby he has a banana plantation enterprise and he sells matooke [steamed green bananas] for a living. A. employs one laborer in his shamba and his major customers are the local community. On average, he makes 120,000 UGX as monthly profits. In addition, he is also involved in the sale of alcohol that he makes himself as well as buying from others in times when the production is low. He has been in business for over 10 years and he needs a loan to be able upgrade his banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides for the plantation. A. hopes to be a model farmer in his area due to his determination.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides for the plantation

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo, tiene 40 años, es casada y tres hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos. Sonia y su esposo tienen un restaurante en la Urb. María Parado de Bellido, está en Finca Perú hace varios años, le gusta por los créditos que le otorgan y puede ahorrar, estando en Finca Perú ahorro y pudo comprarse un terreno, implementar su restaurante, también porque pasa momentos gratos con las compañeras de su banco. Su sueño es poder ahorrar para abrir una pollería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven). She is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 21, 19, and 17). Sonia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing food. She and her husband have a restaurant in Urb. María Parado de Bellido.

Sonia has been with FINCA Peru for several years. She enjoys the loans that have been provided and being able to save. Using her savings with FINCA Peru, Sonia was able to buy a plot of land and maintain her restaurant. She also has a good time being with her fellow Communal Bank members. Her dreams include saving enough money to open a rotisserie chicken shop and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng A., 55, sells porridge in the province of Siem Reap, making a profit of approximately $6 each day. Veng doesn’t have a life partner because she has been divorced from her husband for several years, and now lives with her two single children. There is no additional income from her children, but her nephew works delivering boats and earns A. income of around $3 each day.

Veng is going to use her loA. from Kiva to open a grocery kiosk selling a variety of products. This will enable her family to accrue extra profits to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to open a grocery kiosk selling a variety of products

loans.name: Marguba

texts.en:
P. Marguba lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Marguba is an honest and hardworking woman. She began a business selling fabrics, and she has been in this business for 12 years. Four times a month she travels to Dushanbe to import fabrics from Korvon Market. Marguba would like to get a loan of 5,000 somoni for purchasing new fabrics. She thanks all lenders who support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Martina Candelaria

texts.es:
Martina, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, como familia se dedican al cultivo de maíz y pipián, también a la venta de frutas, desde hace 8 años, esta venta la realiza dos semanas de cada mes, en un centro escolar, este trabajo lo realizan juntos y dependen económicamente de él.
Ella solicita un préstamo para el alquiler de terreno, son tres manzanas las que reserva para iniciar la siembra, este es todo un proceso ya que después de pagar el alquiler debe trabajar en la preparación del suelo.
Este préstamo ayudara a tener con anticipación el lugar adecuado para cultivar, el objetivo de ella es aumentar la producción de maíz y pipián, también ingresar una mayor cantidad de ganancias a su hogar.
texts.en:
Martina lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután where she lives with her husband and their children. As a family they work together growing corn and pipián [squash seeds used in traditional sauces] as well as selling fruit which they have done for eight years. They sell fruit two weeks out of every month at an educational center; this work is something they perform together and they depend upon it economically. 

She is requesting a loan to pay rent on some land. Three square blocks [about 5 acres] is what she reserves in order to begin sowing their crops. It is a whole process since after paying the rent she must work to prepare the soil. 

This loan will help her to secure an appropriate place for farming ahead of time. Her objective is to increase the production of corn and pipián, and also bring in more income for her home.

loans.use: to pay rent on a plot of land.

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
Vena is 26 years old and married with two children.

Vena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of  PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries for her store.

Vena has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming and raising pigs.

Vena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her sari-sari store to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is thirty-six years old, married, and a father of four. His family lives in Endebess in the outskirts of Kitale, where he works with Kitale transporters. He also has had a shop of his own in Kitale for two years and gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings. 

This will be Benard's second loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use it to buy two bags of sugar, rice, etc. for his shop business. He plans to use the income he will get to repay the loan. 

In the future he wants to expand his shop and also give his family a comfortable life financially.

loans.use: to add stock to his shop like sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon earns an income by offering chickens and ducks for sale in her local community. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is applying for a loan in the amount of $400 to buy additional chickens and ducks to offer for sale.

Lon is a widow with two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village aL. National Road Number Six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens and ducks to offer for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 35 años de edad, convive con augusto de 55 años, con quien tiene 2 hermosas criaturas, Xenia de 17 años y  Zulma de 14 años, juntos viven en casa propia en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de pichari. Isabel es una  madre de familia, desde muy joven logró adquirir una tienda, negocio que le ayuda a generar ingresos y a sostener a su familia. Asimismo su esposo la apoya con los gastos de la casa, y en la educación de sus hijas. Ella se siente satisfecha con su labor, todo esto gracias  a su desenvolvimiento en las ventas y al buen trato con sus clientes. El único problema que tiene  es que aún no cuenta con un local adecuado para su negocio. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes, por otro lado se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Isabel habilitara un local para su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage with Augusto, age 55. They have two beautiful children, Xenia (age 17) and Zulma (age 14). Isabel and her family have their own home in the central village of Natividad in the District of Pichari. Being a mother, Isabel acquired a store at a young age. This business helps generate income to support her family. Her husband also helps with the household expenses and their daughters’ education. Isabel is satisfied with her work. Everything she has achieved was a result of her sales performance and the good service she provides to her customers. The only problem she experiences is not having an adequate location for her business.

This will be her first loan with MFP and she hopes to receive everyone’s support. For this reason, Isabel promises to be punctual with all of her payments. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to acquire a location for her business so that she can offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to rent a larger location for her store.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una sastrería la cual es muy visitada por las personas de la localidad pues Don Julio es el mejor sastre realiza las mejores prendas a muy buenos precios, además ocupa tela de excelente calidad; El es un hombre muy trabajador siempre está al frente de su competencia. Para Julio el mundo está en manos de aquellos que tienen el coraje de soñar y de correr el riesgo de vivir sus sueños es por eso que está decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela,  sierres, botones, hilos, agujas, entre otros, de esta forma Julio está haciendo crecer el negocio y tiene la confianza de que en algún futuro lograra darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Julio, age 43, lives with his life partner and their children.  He has a tailoring business, which is very popular with the people in the area.  Julio is the best tailor.  He makes the best garments for very good prices.  He also uses fabric that is of excellent quality.

He is a very hard-working man who is always out in front of his competition.  To Julio the world is in the hands of those that have the courage to dream and to take the chance to live their dreams.

That is why he decided to request a loan from Integral.  A loan will allow him to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, and needles, among others.  This way Julio is making his business grow.  He is confident that in the future he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  She does small-scale farming and also practices dairy farming to boost her income.  She is 51 years old, married to Samuel and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of KES 20,000, which she used for planting potatoes, well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Dorcas hopes to buy more dairy cows and practice dairy farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende diferentes variedades de papa, ella compra papa al por mayor, ya que le traen de lugares como Anta y Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 30 sacos de papa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is a member of “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”, a communal bank located in the Cusco district, province and department.

She is 46 years old, she is single and has 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her retail activity: she sells potatoes of different varieties that she buys at wholesale price in places like Anta and Urubamba. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her son. She would like to increase the potato sale activity, and she is asking for a loan to buy 30 bags of potatoes.

She is pleased with the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Yesica Velit

texts.es:
Yesica
doña Yesica ella es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que en horario de la mañana se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de plátano en su domicilio donde distribuye por mayor y menor, ahora implemenT. su negocio con venta de chocolate decorado del cual distribuye en tiendas donde venden regalos y ropa eso le ha ayudado porque aparte de ser un trabajo entretenido ayuda a relajarse  es su segundo crédiT. kiva en fape y a demostrado ser muy responsable y puntual esta solicitando este crediT. para la compra de platanos por mayor y chocolate.
texts.en:
Yesica

Yesica is a very enterprising woman who runs a home-based, wholesale and retail banana selling business during the morning.  She has now also opened a business selling decorated chocolate that she distributes T. gift and clothes shops.  This has helped her because besides it being an enjoyable job it helps her relax.  This is her second Kiva and Fape loan.  She has shown herself T. be very responsible and punctual.  She’s asking for this loan T. buy bananas and chocolates at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bananas and chocolate at wholesale.

loans.name: Iris Emili
