texts.es: Emili   es  una  joven  emprendedora,  actualmente  elL.   vive   con sus  padres   y  los ayuda   económicamente   con los  gastos  D.   su  hogar, ellos  tienen  una  tienda  D.   abarrotes  que  le permite   obtener  ingresos  para  salir  adelante   día  con día,  es  por  ello  que  su mayor  sueño  es  contar con inventario D.  mercancía  disponible para   cuando  sus  clientes   acuden a su  negocio  puedan  encontrar   todos lo productos  que  ellos  desean,  ve  en el crédito L. posibilidad   D. hacer   crecer   su  negocio   y   poder  seguir  apoyando   a  su  familia, agradece  el apoyo para  L. realización D.  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Emili is an enterprising young woman who currently lives with her parents and helps them financially with the household expenses. She and her family have a grocery store, which allows them to generate income to move forward day after day. Her greatest wish is to have enough merchandise available for when her customers come into her store looking for all the products that they want.

Emili sees this loan as a possibility of making her business grow so that she can continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the support that has been provided so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 33 years-old and married to Benrodgers.  They two children aged thirteen and eight years old.

She has been selling charcoal for the last five years making a monthly profit of KES.9,000 , she has been loaned KES.20,000 which she plans to use to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

With the anticipated profit she intends to support her husband in the provision of the family's basic needs, expand her business and educate their children.  In the future she hopes to have a a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maxima Leticia

texts.es:
Máxima Leticia tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y varios nietos, y reside en el Barrio Las Acacias en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Doña Máxima posee un puesto de frutas el cual tiene una excelente ubicación ya que está a un costado de la carretera que conduce hacia la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y ésta es muy transitada. En este puesto comercializa todo tipo de frutas, sobre todo aquellas que están de temporada. Inició su negocio hace 14 años con una chiclera y vendía churros, galletas, dulces, etc. pero luego de un tiempo se dio cuenta de que ese tipo de productos no eran atractivos para los transeúntes que pasaban por su puesto así que decidió vender frutas. Con el préstamo comprará una mayor cantidad de frutas como sandias, naranjas, bananos, refrescos, churros, galletas y confites, y así podrá obtener más ganancias que le permitirán llevar el sustento a su familia y cubrir con los gastos escolares de su hijo menor. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta es que uno de sus nietos no camina ni habla y la mayor parte del tiempo tiene que estar hospitalizado y eso le ocasiona grandes gastos. Sus sueños son que la salud de su nieto mejore, tener un establecimiento propio que sea grande y bonito, y tener su propia casa ya que donde reside es alquilado y el pago de la renta mensual es muy caro. Desde hace seis años es clienta de FAMA y con los préstamos obtenidos ha podido superarse y tener una mejor vida económica.
texts.en:
Máxima Leticia is 46. She is a single mother of five children and has several grandchildren. She lives in the Las Acacias neighbourhood of the Juticalpa municipality.
Mrs. Máxima has a fruit stall in an excellent location on the side of a highly-trafficked road which goes all the way to Tegucigalpa city. There she sells all kinds of fruits, mainly those that are in season. She started her business 14 years ago with another street vendor. She sold cakes, cookies, sweets, etc. But later on, she noticed that these products were not very attractive for the passersby, so she decided to sell fruits. With this loan she will buy a greater quantity of fruits, such as watermelons, oranges, bananas, as well as drinks, cakes, cookies and candies. This will help her to make a better income, allowing her to better sustain her family and cover her youngest child's school costs. One of her challenges has been that one of her grandchildren does not walk or speak, and normally has to be hospitalized. This is very expensive. Her dreams are for her grandchild's health to improve, to have her own big and beautiful establishment, and to have her home--she currently lives in a rented home, and the monthly rent is very high. She has been a FAMA client for six years and she has been able to get ahead and have a better life through these loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as bananas, watermelons, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: El joven Jorge es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora,  el cual  labora  actualmente  con un dentista,  de esta  manera  obtiene ingresos  pasa  salir  adelante y  poder  ayudar   en su casa  con los   gastos  del  hogar, Jorge   nos  comenta  que desafortunadamente   hace  tiempo   sufrió un accidente  automovilístico en el  cual  perdió   algúnos de  sus dientes, es  por  ello  que  esta  muy  contento de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que   ayudaremos en la realización de  su proyecto   el cual consiste   en arreglarse  los  dientes , agradece  el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en: Jorge is a responsible and very hard-working young man who is currently working with a dentist.  In this way, he makes the income he needs to get ahead in life and help at home with the household expenses.  Jorge tells us that he unfortunately suffered a car accident some time ago and lost some of his teeth as a result.  He is very happy to have found us as we will help him to carry out his project of having his teeth fixed.  He is grateful for the support we have offered him.

loans.use: to buy dentures

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is 40 years old. She is married and has no children. Leata owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. Leata needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and an oven. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Leata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Leata's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and an oven.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 28 years old and is married with two children. His spouse is Sally who buys and sells vegetables in the nearby market, thus adding income to the family. Richard owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Richard has borrowed loans of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD for his second term loan after he successfully paid the previous one. He wishes to use this loan to purchase more stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves for sale.  

The profits will be used to repay back the loan and improve his business stock. His dream is to excel in business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella is married with three children. Adella is 35 years old and lives in Pereyra Village, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.
Adella has been raising ducks to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan of P35, 000 to purchase feeds for her duck raising.
She is a new member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her duck raising

loans.name: Apiya

texts.en: Apiya is 31 years old and lives with her father, sister and brother in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her sewing business in 2008 by renting a small space. Now her business is stable and she has one employee. She sews work clothes. Now that the mining business is booming in Mongolia, her business is going well; however, she is lacking equipment and staff. In order to improve her business, she needs a little support. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to buy more materials.

loans.use: To buy more materials.

loans.name: Ball Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ball Group in Western Kenya! Betina is the facilitator of the Ball group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Betina takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Betina had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Betina was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Betina  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Betina will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ball group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Betina and her group with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.es: Francis, de 20 años, es una señorita buena y emprendedora, es aun soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes trabaja a diario para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Francis consiste en la venta de comida, específicamente en la venta de comida rápida. Ella tiene un restaurante de venta de pollo broaster, en donde trabaja a diario junto a sus padres. Es así que desde muy temprano se levanta y sale al mercado en compañía de su madre, que van en busca de productos y carnes más frescos y nutritivos para poder realizar su trabajo y brindar a su distinguida clientela siempre lo mejor. En su casa por las tardes se encargan de alistar todas sus cosas y así tener todo listo para que a partir de las 6 de la tarde comiencen a vender los deliciosos y muy bien servidos platos de pollo broaster. Ella viene realizando este negocio por dos años, y cuya administración lo hacen ella. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene muy buenos ingresos que le permite pensar las dificultades que tenía antes y ahora los supero. Tiene como meta poder expandir su negocio, pero por el momento espera consolidarse y poder crecer de a poco. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará materiales para realizar una mejora en la condiciones de su local, además de abastecerse con productos no perecibles y tenerlos en su almacén por si que mas adelante sube el precio de los productos.
texts.en: Francis is a hardworking and ambitious 20 year-old young woman.  She is single and has no children.  She lives at her parents' house with whom she works with daily in order to be able to have a better quality of life.  Francis' job consists in the sale of food, specifically in the sale of fast food.  They have a restaurant where she sells grilled chicken alongside her parents.  She wakes up very early and leaves for the market with her mother in search of fresh and nutritious products and meat that she uses for her dishes with the intent of offering her distinguished clients the best.  In her home in the afternoon, she is in charge of getting everything ready so that at 6pm she can begin to sell her delicious and well-cooked plates of roasted chicken.  She has been doing this job for over two years, including its administration.  It is going quite well since their earnings have allowed her to reflect on the difficult times that she has had before and that she has been able to overcome.  Her goal is to be able to expand her business, but at the moment she hopes to consolidate and be able to grow little by little.  This will be her third credit with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support which will help her advance with her business.  She also promises to again fulfill her payments like she did in the past.  With the solicited amount of 3000 soles, she will purchase materials to improve the conditions of her establishment and stock up on non-perishables in her garage in case the price of these products increase in the future.

loans.use: purchase non-perishable products and improve her establishment.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
58 year-old Fermina is a married woman with 5 children. Her youngest is 21 years old and still goes to school.

Fermina has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Fermina earns 5000 PHP per month doing this farming. She applied for this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Fermina hopes for her business to grow and for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Jenny Margoth

texts.es:
Jenny Margoth tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su compañero y a su hijo de 10 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicado en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
 Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz comprar semillas, urea, abonos, fertilizantes, líquidos.

Con el apoyo del crédito ya no acudirá a los chulqueros y podrá comprar los productos sin ningún problema y también le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir progresando en la agricultura.

Le gusta leer mucho.
texts.en:
Jenny Margoth is 33 years old and lives together with her common-law husband and her 10-year-old child.  They live in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

The 'Nuevo Amanecer' (New Dawn) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Jenny is a farmer who grows corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, manure, fertilizers and liquid fertilizers for growing her corn.

With the support of this loan, Jenny will no longer need to turn to loan sharks and will be able to buy her products without problems.  It will help her financially to meet her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue making progress with her farming. 

Jenny likes to read a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, manure and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso 72, lives in the village of San Jose with his wife Isabela and two children. Asked to recount how many children he has, Alfonso counts studiously naming different villages where they all live. 

Alfonso has been farming for 30 years, and works one of the bigger cacao farms in the area, spread out in 3 plots encompassing 4 acres and around 1,600 producing trees. One of the most productive families in the Maya Mountain Cacao network, Alfonso’s farm has been under constant expansion. “The happiest moments are when the trees are producing well and we have you guys here buying every weekend,” Alfonso told MMC, adding that on the few occasions when there’s no production to sell it really feels like he’s losing out, but that’s cacao. There’s money to be made in cacao, and if everything goes perfect and he manages to keep the diseases in check, he says he’ll be a rich man.  

Alfonso is getting ready for cleaning the underbrush surrounding his cacao trees before the upcoming harvest season. Cacao pod production is picking up slowly and will reach full swing in March-April and continue until it slows again In July-August. Cleaning is a routine activity on shade-grown cacao farms in tropical lowlands and needs to be repeated every three to four months. It is necessary to clear access to the trees for pruning, harvesting and or planting new seedlings as well as to prevent fungus diseases common in the rainy season. 

Alfonso got introduced to cacao when his father started planting even before the big push in the industry when Hershey’s arrived to Belize in the early 90’s and introduced a new market and seed varietals from Costa Rica.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning his 3 plots of cacao in preparation for the upcoming harvest season.

loans.name: Fente Allabo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FENTE ALLABO ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités  d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales, du savon et du poisson.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FENTE ALLABO sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. MASSARAN, 1ère  femme debout à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat  du savon

loans.name: Jose Ursulo

texts.es:
José recurre a Padecomsm para solicitar un nuevo crédito, debido a la atención que la institución le brinda, invertirá en zacate picado, concentrado y profiláctico, para alimentar al ganado y venderlo robustos.
El crédito anterior le ha dado resultados positivos para seguir desarrollando sus actividades agropecuarias y agrícolas, José dice estar mejorando mucho en su negocio y en su situación financiara, su grupo familiar se mantiene y él puede darles un estilo de vida más confortable.

loans.use: invertirá en zacate picado, concentrado y profiláctico, para alimentar al ganado y venderlo robustos

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and fortunately all her children are out of school. Susan is a good member in the group and actively brings in new ideas that promotes its growth.

Susan has been a farmer for over 20 years. She grows and sells maize, beans, coffee, and milk from her own cow. Selling of maize, beans and coffee is seasonal; thus, most of her income comes from selling milk because it’s sold daily. Susan earns $42 and $28 from sale of milk and other produce per month respectively. Though the earnings are little, she is able to cater for her needs; she is not worried about food at home, she gets it from her own farm. This will increase her income and supplement the little she is getting from the farm. She is optimistic the business will succeed because of its uniqueness within the area.

loans.use: She wants to buy plates to be hired by funeral ceremonies, weddings and other functions in the area.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a very industrious and enthusiastic man in spite of the difficulties he has had to endure. Some years ago he had an accident. Because of that he is confined to a wheelchair, thus he has not been able to work as he used to before. Then his wife became pregnant and was also unable to work. Nevertheless, he began to sell packaged duritos and chips. Thanks to this he has been able to take care of his wife and 3 small children.

Now he needs a loan of $200 in order to buy materials to roof the premises in order to keep his business going as it has up to now. Your help is very valuable, have no doubts about it.

Please support Efren and his family. They will be sincerely grateful.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho is 62. Tho’s husband died a very long time ago. Now, Tho lives with her daughter, who is 40 and is single. It is difficult to imagine how they have overcome many problems in their life. They have no land aside from their home. Only the daughter can earn money by catching fish on a small canal of the Hau Giang River in the Mekong delta. Daily, the daughter has to spend much time catching fish on an old boat that isn’t safe. Their income is only $7 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 so that they can purchase a small new boat that is safer and nets to continue catching fish on the canal. They are going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat and net in order to continue catching fish

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Thirty eight years old Aisha K. is a married mother of four children.  Aisha started her business with initialcapital of $60 borrowed from a relative.  With the capital, she started selling African print cotton materials but could not do much business as the capital was too small.  In 2005, Aisha joined SMT where she got loans to expand her business.  Later, she expanded her business to the selling of window and door curtains, table clothes and other female clothes.  She uses the income from the business to supplement her husband's salary.

loans.use: Increase inventory of fabric for window and door curtains and women's clothes

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty T. is married with two children. This twenty-five-year-old mother runs a small business selling cosmetics in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Many Sierra Leoneans start out their business by taking goods on credit from the Lebanese merchants, and the cost of these goods is always high. This leaves traders like Mabinty with very little profit and they have a very hard time building their own capital as they have to make cash repayments daily or weekly.

The previous loan from SMT enabled Mabinty to begin building capital for her micro-business. She is requesting another loan of $350 to further enhance her business.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en: Koreti P. is struggling for a better tomorrow for her eight children who are all in school. She works hard on her plantation, which is the main source of income for her family.  Her husband does the manual labour of maintaining their plantation.  She sells the taro crop at the new market in town. Koreti only visits the market twice a week, on Fridays and Saturdays. She earns a good profit from selling her products which she uses to meet her family weekly needs and also for her loan repayments. Koreti appreciates the help of S.P.B.D. for lending her the money to run her plantation smoothly.

loans.use: To buy, knives, cloves, weed sprayer, a wheel barrow, crowbars, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O., 42 years old, is from Edo State, married with 6 children. She sells tailoring materials. She has been a LAPO member for four years. She has been in business since 2003. She has repaid her first loan and she is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sales

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes Y., 58, is a mother of one child and lives with her husband in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at home selling boiled duck eggs, grilled chicken, candy, biscuits and other provisions to the people in her area, making on average about $5/day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and generally makes about $3 each day. Mrs. Tes Y. hopes to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more products to meet her clients’ needs and use the remainder of the money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more products to meet her clients’ needs and use the remainder of the money to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Agip A 2005(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Ssanyu is married with three children. Her current business is selling used clothes. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land in the village. Jane and Hasifah both run restaurants.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand clothing resale business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Hadija S.. She is married with three children, aged 10, 18, and 24, and has two other dependents, who live with her because their parents live in a remote area.

In 2002, Hadija established a café and take-away shop. Working more than 16 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her two employees, she earns about $60 per month from this business. Hadija has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase stocks of soft drink, milk, chicken, and other ingredients, in bulk. In the future, Hadija also plans to open another business.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of soft drink, milk, chicken, and other ingredients, in bulk.

loans.name: Glendys Melina

texts.en:
Glendys Melina P. G. runs a family business selling spare parts for motorcycles in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She started the business 1 year ago because her husband had business experience and the streets of Pucallpa are jammed with motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.

Glendys is 22 years old with a baby and happily married. She loves being able to work from home where she can take care of her baby and earn money at the same time. Her goal is to continue to invest in her business until they own a large store and employ many people.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Glendys is requesting a loan of s/1200 (US$ 450) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy oil, tires, and more.

loans.use: to buy oil, tires, and more for re-sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn Q. is married and has four dependents. She sells tom brown and wheat but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more tom brown and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama H. is 36. She is married and had four children but unfortunately, she lost all of them through tragic disease. However, she is consoled by the fact that there is still hope for her to make new babies. She owns and operates a little grocery shop selling items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, etc. She deems this an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Ama belongs to the community group called Anyidado (Hope) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Ernestine Assiba

texts.fr:
Born around 1959 in OUIDAH, in the Atlantique district in the south of Benin, Ms. Ernestine Assiba W. is a widow and the mother of four children, who are all in school. Previously, she used to sell food in the bus station parking lot in Cotonou Porto-Novo Cotonou, the nerve center for travelers. As a result, the crowds were so big that it had been difficult to meet the ever-demanding customer expectations, due to financial means. This is why, in order to improve, she came to obtain her first loan of 50,000 francs CFA in 2006. For her second loan, she obtained 100,000 francs. Currently, she lives in her father-in-law's house near the DANTOKPA marketplace, opposite the exposed gutter, where she switched to selling beverages (products of the Béninoise de Brasserie Company), imported beverages, and charcoal. She started this business about four years ago. The demand is growing so much that, at midday, she no longer has anything for the numerous customers lining up in front of her shop. To be able to get supplies in sufficient quantities and to meet the demand without fail, she is requesting a fourth loan of 250,000 francs. She is aiming at devoting 2/3 of these fund to buying beverages and the rest for buying charcoal.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1959 à OUIDAH dans le département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin, dame W. Ernestine Assiba est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Auparavant, elle vendait de la nourriture sur le parc auto gare Cotonou Porto-Novo Cotonou, point névralgique des voyageurs. L’affluence était donc si importante qu’il lui était devenu difficile de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus exigeante des clients, faute de moyens financiers. C’est ainsi que pour se renforcer elle vint prendre son premier crédit de 50.000fcfa en 2006. Pour son deuxième crédit, elle prit 100.000fcfa. Actuellement elle vit dans la maison de son beau père proche du marché DANTOKPA en face du caniveau à ciel ouvert où elle s’est reconvertie dans la vente de boissons (produits de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie), des boissons importées et du charbon de bois. Elle a débuté cette activité il y a environ 4ans. La demande est si croissante que déjà à la mi-journée elle n’a plus de quoi satisfaire les nombreux clients qui font la queue devant sa boutique. Pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante et satisfaire sans faille les demandes, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt de 250.000fcfa. Ainsi, elle vise à consacrer 2/3 de ces fonds à l’achat des boissons et le reste à l’achat de charbon de bois.

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of beer in cans, 20 boxes of soft drinks in cans, and 25 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Construction, Recycling, Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy Nam Thi N. is 31 years old. Both she and her husband work in the construction industry. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in a construction company and to pay worker’s wages. She has two children who are going to school. She and the other members in the group have completed one successful cycle of funding and repayment. The money Mrs. N. is able to borrow helps her reduce her costs. Her family’s income is about 150,000 per day.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Hanh Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND as capital for a recycling business.
  • Mrs. Dung Thi M., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy feed for pigs.
  • Mrs. Luong Thi N., requesting 2,016,000 VND to raise pigs.
  • Mr. Minh Dinh N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to raise pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn Thị Thùy Nam (MS: 020046), năm nay 31 tuổi. Cả hai anh chị đều làm nghề xây dựng. Chị vay 4.256.000 VND để phục vụ cho việc xây dựng cơ sở hạ tầng, trả tiền công thợ. Chị có 2 con hiện còn đang đi học. Chị cùng các thành viên khác trong nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả xong. Chị muốn vay vốn vì nó giúp chị tiết kiệm được rất tốt. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là khoảng 150.000 VND/ ngày.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (MS: 020018), vay 4.256.000 VND để lấy vốn đi buôn đồ phế liệu.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Dung (MS: 020021), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Nghiêm Thị Lương (MS: 020048), vay 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Anh Nghiêm Đình Minh (MS: 020049), vay 3.808.000 VND đê chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Invest in construction company, recycling business, and livestock

loans.name: Dilmelith

texts.es:
Dilmelith is a member of the Las Lemeñas Community Bank and lives in Lamas, Peru. She makes a living selling groceries at a post in the Lamas central market, generating daily income. The earnings help her and her husband support their two children's education, the motivation for starting her work. She also likes being in constant contact with friends and customers. With the $425, which she plans to repay with six months, she will purchase various grocery items such as: different brands of soap, toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergents, and different brands and sizes of milk to satisfy her customers' demands.

Dilmelith is 37 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband share responsibilities with the business. She has always been known as being a hard-working and responsible woman. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and sell and distribute products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Dilmelith es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, vive en la provincia y distrito de Lamas, departamento de San Martín se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su puesto de venta que ella tiene en el mercado central de la ciudad de Lamas, generar sus ingresos diaR. y las ganas de ayudar económicamente a su esposo para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos, le motivó a iniciarse en el negocio, además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes. Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como: cajas de jabón por cada marca (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.) papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, para ofertar a sus clientes. Tiene 37 años, tiene 02 hijos quienes están estudiando, junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas, desea en el futuro ampliar su negocio, vender al por mayor, llegar a tener su distribuidora de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase various grocery items / Compra de diversos artículos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Dame A. Mathilde est née le 05/02/1966 à Cotonou. Mariée à TCHOUBADE Abdoulaye (agent de l’OCBN), elle est mère de trois enfants. Elle mène l'activité de vente de charbon depuis 18 ans et vit à Scoa gbéto (un des plus anciens quartiers de Cotonou) depuis sa naissance. Vu son dynamisme et sa crédibilité, elle nous a affirmé qu’elle assure la majorité des charges familiales grâce aux revenus de son activité puisque son mari est un polygame. Elle est actuellement à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mathilde A. was born on February 5, 1966 in Cotonou. She's married to Abdoulaye TCHOUBADE, an agent of OCBN (Bénin-Niger Railroad and Transportation Organization) and is the mother of three children. She's been living in Scoa Gbéto (one of the oldest neighborhoods in Cotonou) since she was born. For 18 years, she's been selling charcoal. Thanks to her energy and credibility, she says she's providing for most of the family expenses with the revenues of her business, her husband being polygamous. She's now seeking her third loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria de los Angeles R. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que tengo de realizar hace varios años, soy muy responsable y tengo muchos deseos de superarme, de mi actividad dependen mis dos hijos uno de 12 y el otro de 7 años de edad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para tener una mayor produccion y por lo tanto una mayor ganancia, mis clientes son muy biuenos ya que les gusta mucho mi producto y sobre todo que mis clientes ven mi producto muy higienico, es por eso que mis ventas son my buenas.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Angeles R.. I make and sell tortillas. I have been doing this for several years. I am very responsible and have many dreams of bettering myself. I have two children, a twelve-year-old and a seven-year-old, who are dependent on me. At this time, I need a loan to improve my production and earn more income. My clients are good since they like my product, and, above all, my clients think my product is very hygienic. As a result, my sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy limestone, salt, corn flour, firewood, and water

loans.name: 01-Xuân Lộc Group

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Kỳ sinh năm 1960 có chồng là Lê Văn Cần. Gia đình chị có năm người con. Hai con đầu đã có gia đình riêng. Ngoài làm ruộng ra anh chị còn làm thêm cả nghề đấnh bắt cá nhỏ ở ven biển. Chị mới tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả. Kỳ này chị đăng ký vay 1.626.900 VND. các thành viên khác trong nhóm:
Chị Ngô Thị đông vay 1.626.900 VND để mua lưới đánh bắt cá, ngoài ra chị còn nuôi gà, vịt.
Chị Ngô Thị Tính vay 1.626.900 VND để bán hàng khô ở chợ
Chị T. Thị Thơm vay 1.626.900 VND để chăn nuôi gà , lợn
Chị N. Thị Lý vay 1.626.900 VND để chăn nuôi gà, vịt ...
Chị Ngô Thị Sâm vay 1.626.900 VND mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá
Chị Lê Thị Lý vay 1.626.900 VND để bán bánh mì rong ngoài ra chị cong chăn nuôi gà, vịt.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Kỳ was born in 1960. She is married to Lê Văn Cần. They have 5 children, the oldest 2 are married. They cultivate their paddy field. They also fish at sea. Mrs Kỳ has already paid back her first loan. This time she is seeking a loan of 1.626.900 VND, the same for other members in her group.
  • Mrs Ngô Thị đông, she needs a loan to buy fishing gear. She also raises poultry
  • Mrs Ngô Thị Tính, she sells dry food at the market
  • Mrs T. Thị Thơm, she raises chickens and pigs
  • Mrs N. Thị Lý , she raises chickens and ducks
  • Mrs Ngô Thị Sâm, she needs a loan to buy fishing gear
  • Mrs Lê Thị Lý, she sells bánh mì and raises poultry

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mama B. (Theresia) was married but her husband died some ten years ago. Before his death they had five children. Unable to care for the family single-handedly and needing capital to expand her business (sale of cooked food), she joined GHAPE in 2003. She’s been having a lot of problems with her late husband’s brothers, and this made her sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education.

Mama B. states that she feels better each time she provides something small for her children. Her inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for her to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. With her previous loan of US$ 600, she succeeded in running a restaurant that provided her community with good food.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a two-wheeled motorcycle, koki beans, and palm oil. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she has a good rider for the motorcycle. She plans to use the profits generated to pay for her children's schooling and to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment of the repayment shall be due on the fourth month after the loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of a two-wheeled motorcycle, koki beans, and palm oil

loans.name: Tuilagiula

texts.en: Tuilagiula A., 38, is married and has five children.  She has many years of experience in the fishing business and she sells to the general public six days per week. She has had six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (333 USD).  SPBD loans are Tuilagiula’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will help to start a new shop and part will be used to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a canoe. Her husband is lending a helping hand to run the business.

loans.use: To build a shop and to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a canoe

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S. is 41 years old, a mother of six children and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She purchases rice crops from individual growers and resell it to earn approximately US $8 every day, while her husband is a carpenter and makes around US $10 a day. Six of her children are in school and sometimes work. Nhem would like to take out a loan to add to her rice stock to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To add to her rice stock.

loans.name: Laiy

texts.en: Laiy E., 59, lives in the Battambang province with his wife and three of his children. He works as a blacksmith and earns around US$2 per day. His wife, pictured here with their oldest daughter, sells desserts and soft drinks in the village. On average, she earns US$5 per day. This couple would like to take out a loan to invest in a new business selling ice-cream for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase ice-cream for resale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: B. Jackson is 50 years old and he owns a coffee plantation in the Kinyamugusha Bugomora cell in Ishaka. Jackson has been in the business for over 12 years. He is married with six children. He uses some of the profits from the business to look after the family. He is using the loan funds to work on the field in order to increase output.

loans.use: To purchase better seeds for the plantation.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. All of her children are in school – junior high and basic school. Gifty lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

She works very hard to support her husband financially and help him to provide for the family. Gifty runs a grocery store in her community. She sells products such as tins of milk, sugar, bread, milo (instant chocolated drink), etc. She says her shop is located by the side of the road. Gifty has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy more goods. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Lovinsa's Group

texts.en:
G. Lovinsa is the leader of the K. group of Ivunamba. She has a retail-shop business that she has been running for a long time. She is grateful to have watched her business grow over the years, and, as a result of her success, her daily sales, income, and savings have improved.

Right now, her income is 80,000 shillings, and she has more than 150,000 shillings in her personal savings. However, she plans to more than double this so that she will easily be able to pay school fees for her children.

Lovinsa needs a new loan so as to be able to stock her shop with more products.

loans.use: To restock goods for sale in her retail shop.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
Sadullo J. is a hardworking young gentleman who works in the cattle raising business. He is married and provides for his little son. He works hard to provide everything his family needs. Presently, Sadullo is making sacrifices and working hard to make his business grow. For that he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase baby cows with the purpose of feeding them and raising them. His goal is to then be able to get the most return from the sale of milk products. This will be his first loan with IMON and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of calves

loans.name: Bisokina

texts.ru: Бисокина – женщина 43 лет. Разведенная, имеет 2-х детей. С мужем развелась по личным причинам. Бисокина занимается продажей золотых изделий изделий на рынке Джума-базара и Якшанбе-базара. Золотые изделия она привозит из разных городов зарубежья, в т. ч. из Ташкента, Самарканда, Турции и т. д. Бисокина старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать изделия из Российской Федерации, потому, что там качественные изделия, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Bisokina is a 43 year old woman. She is divorced and has 2 children. She divorced her husband for personal reasons. Bisokina sells gold jewelry at the markets Djuma-bazaar and Yakshanbe-bazaar. She brings the gold jewelry from different cities abroad such as Tashkent, Samarkand, Turkey, etc. Bisokina tries to grow her business and to purchase jewelry from the Russian Federation because the jewelry there is of high quality in order to grow her product assortment. She would like to increase her family income that way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of gold jewelry

loans.name: Gerrilyn

texts.en: Gerrilyn J. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has seven infant children. Gerrilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling fish in bulk in Puerto public market. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gerrilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to support the needs of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sulaimon

texts.en:
Sulaimon is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard at raising cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. His wife (pictured) helps him with the business. Currently, Sulaimon wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Shoirachon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Шоирачон 24 года, она замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. У нее есть Дилерский центр в районе старого автовокзала. Шоирачон обслуживает абонентов нескольких сотовых операторов Таджикистана, таких как: Индиго-Сомонком, Вавилон, МЛТ, М-теко, ТК-мобайл и др. Она пополняет счета, продает сим-карты и карты экспресс-оплаты. В районе Автовокзала очень много людей, как местных, так и приезжих. У Шоирачон много клиентов, так как её помещение находится на остановке, на очень видном месте. Шоирачон планирует расширить свое дело и закупать побольше сим-карт и карт экспресс оплаты. Для этого она просит очередной займ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shoirachon is 24 years old, she is married and a mother of one child. She has a dealer center in the region of the old automall. Shoirachon services telephone customers of several mobile providers of Tajikistan such as Indigo-Somonkom, Vavilon, MLT, M-techo, TK-mobile and others. She tops up their accounts, sells SIM-cards and cards for express payments. In the region of the automall there are a lot of people locals as well as visitors. Shoirachon has many customers because her center is in a very good location near the bus stop. Shoirachon plans to expand her business and buy more SIM-cards and express payment cards. For this she is requesting another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy SIM cards and express payment cards

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P., age 36, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she goes to work in town as a construction builder, typically earning US$3.75 per day. The family is also assisted primarily by her husband who is a speaker repairman and a construction builder with an income of US$5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase speakers and a trailer. By doing so, she will use the trailer to transport speakers to rent to the people who want to use them in any ceremony.

loans.use: To purchase speakers and a trailer

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va S., age 51, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she operates a business selling food (Chinese noodles) for breakfast, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is on the staff of a public water-supply department and has a reasonable to income to support his family. The family is also assisted by three of her children, who are employed at different workplaces in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more ingredients to expand her food shop. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients to expand the food shop

loans.name: Nicolaza Jesús

texts.es:
La señora NICOLAZA JESÚS Y. R., tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de Enfermería Técnica, no pudo ejercer porque al finalizar su carrera quedó embarazada y se dedico al hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos.
Nicolaza está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: talcos, cremas, colonias, joyas, perfumes, shampoo, etc, los mismos que distribuye en diferentes puestos del mercado que esta cerca a su casa y también vende directamente a sus vecinos, amistades, profesoras y madres de familia del centro educativo de su hijos.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas productos de belleza.
Este crédito de 2,500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor para poder tener en stock luego venderlos a precio de catalogó y poder aumentar así sus ganancias.
Nicolaza  es actualmente capitana de un grupo de 15 vendedoras de la empresa de productos de belleza que vende, lo cual le permite obtener los productos a menos costo y poder ganar mas.
NICOLAZA sueña con tener un stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo en donde pueda vender sus productos con mayor rapidez.

loans.use: lo utilizara para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor

loans.name: Julia Vanessa

texts.es:
Julia Vanessa Rodríguez V. es socia del Banco Comunal  Dapreydi  en el cantón Tosagua de la Provincia de Manabí. Vive en compañía de su abuelita Bartola desde muy niña, juntas han compartido grandes momentos su abuelita la poya en todo lo que hace.

Julia es  estudiante de parvularia de la universidad Laica de Tosagua  está por terminar sus estudios le falta un año y sin embargo ya está  ejerciendo su carrera, ahora mismo está brindando ayuda a niños de un jardín de la localidad.

Julia es una joven  dedicada a la cría de pollos, ella tiene una pequeña granja en un terreno que le  prestó un familiar. Tiene un aproximado de 50 pollos de incubadora y gallinas criollas, ella cría y luego los vende en pie a los comerciantes del pueblo, el proceso de criar los pollos dura tres meses y  están listos para  la venta. Nos comenta que se siente feliz con su negocio  y le deja buenas ganancias.

El crédito que está solicitando a la fundación es para invertir en su negocio comprando  más  pollos, vitaminas, alimento como maíz, balanceado y más productos necesarios para la crianza de sus aves e incrementar la granja.

El sueño de Julia  es  tener su propio jardín de infantes,  sin dejar de lado la  granja que es su mayor esfuerzo  fruto de su trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Julia Vanessa Rodríguez V. is a member of the Dapreydi Community Bank in Tosagua, province of Manabí, Ecuador. She has lived with her grandmother since she was very young and together they have shared many great moments. Her grandmother supports her in everything she does. Julia is studying preschool education at the secular university of Tosagua and even though she doesn't finish for a year, she is already putting her education to work. Right now she is caring for kids at a local nursery school.

Julia makes a living raising chickens. She has a small farm on some land a relative lent to her. She has approximately 50 chickens and hens, which she raises and then sells to the towns merchants. The process of raising the chickens takes three months and then they are ready to sell. She tells us that she feels proud of her business and she makes good profits. The loan she is requesting is to invest in the purchase of more chickens, as well as vitamins, food and other products to help raise the birds and expand her business. Julia's dream is to have her own nursery school, without leaving behind the farm that has been the source of her greatest effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, as well as vitamins, food and other products to help raise the birds and expand her business

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
H. Lê V.  (20213010070) is a 33 year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh..  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh2 - nhóm 13 (13).


H. is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 0, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.    He is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị H. (20213010071) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Chu Thị H.  (20213010072) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Ngô Thị T. An (20213010073) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010074) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lê V.  (20213010070) là 33 tuổi nam.  A. ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh..  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh2 - nhóm 13 (13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo mới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 0, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    A. ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị H. (20213010071) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Chu Thị H.  (20213010072) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Ngô Thị T. An (20213010073) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. quần áo.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010074) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Carmelita is married and has 6 school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a variety store selling food and other daily-use items to the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Flor Yusselina

texts.es:
La señora  FLOR YUSSELINA, tiene  38 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios  superiores de Enfermería Técnica  pero no pudo ejercer porque  salió embarazada cuando estaba cursando el ultimo ciclo, motivo por el cual empezó a convivir con su esposo, se dedicó a la crianza de sus hijos,  del cuidado de su hogar.
La socia tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella, se encuentra en edad escolar.
Flor se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, papas, golosinas, cerveza, gaseosas, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosa, golosinas, leche, fideos, aceite, etc. Con este crédito de 1,200 comprará cajas de cerveza al por mayor para estar abastecidas por las fiestas de fin de año.

Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio,  por lo cual esta ahorrando y así lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Flor Yusselina is 38 years old and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Santa Elena II communal bank. She enrolled in higher educuation to become a Nurse Technician but she could not practice because she left when she was pregnant during her final cycle. For this reason she began to live with her husband and dedicated herself to raising her children and taking care of the house. She has 3 children who depend on her economically and who attend school. Flor works selling rice, sugar, milk, noodles, potatoes, candy, beer, soda, etc. in the store in her house. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she purchased rice, sugar, beer, soda, candy, milk, noodles, oil, etc. With this loan of 1,200 soles she will buy wholesale boxes of beer to be stocked for the festivities at the end of the year. She dreams of growing her business, so she is saving and that way will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase wholesale boxes of beer

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es:
La señora Fanny María A. B. es socia del Banco Comunal Artesanal en Jipijapa, ubicado a  una hora de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la región  costa de Ecuador, esta región es muy conocida por sus hermosas playas, su gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente cualidades que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Fanny tiene 51 años vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aun es soltero ya que los otros han formado su propia familia y viven independientes,  su cónyuge es obrero en Jipijapa, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas lleva muchos años con éste negocio que lo tiene en su casa propia, aquí  expende colas, cervezas, helados, vino y leche y más.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Fanny solicita a la Fundación ESPOIR con él va a comprar más bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, cerveza y más para abastecer su negocio.

Su sueño es ir incrementando su negocio para que al momento que ella no pueda trabajar su hijo se haga cargo del mismo.
texts.en:
Fanny María A. B., 51, is a member of the Artesanal communal bank in Jipijapa which is an hour from Portoviejo in the Manabí province along the coast of Ecuador. This region is famous for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and for the kindness of its residents, qualities that attract tourists both from home and from abroad. Fanny lives with her husband and one of her sons, who is still single; the others have formed their own families and live independently. Her husband is a laborer in Jipijapa; she sells soft-drinks from her home, an activity that she has been involved in for many years. She sells colas, beers, ice-cream, wine, milk, and more. This is Fanny's third loan request from Fundación ESPOIR and will use it to buy more drinks like beverages, soft-drinks, beer, and more to stock her business. Her dream is to see her business grow enough so that, when the day comes that she can no longer work, her son will take carge of it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, soft-drinks, beer, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Mercy is a trader in soap that she prepares out of soda, palm oil, and other ingredients and supplies to retailers. Mercy has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy soda and other soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk so she can produce on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede B. is 41years old, married with 5 children. The family lives in Oyo State. Bosede produces and sells polythene bags. She has been in this trade for over 17years. Bosede is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase material for the production of polythene bags. This loan will reduce basic costs, costs of transportation to market and increase profits.  She will be able to serve her clients better and this also will better help her in caring for her family. Bosede says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more material for production of polythene bag to sell

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe es una mujer muy querida por sus compañeras, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 59 años, madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y semiindependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería (por campaña), al alquiler de su carro y a la administración de un taller de mecánica donde trabaja su hijo, la venta  de mercadería la desempeña saliendo a ofrecer a amigos y amistades, es madre soltera. Lupe forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Almendras”, desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra y posterior venta de mercadería para campaña escolar.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido en la reparación de su carro para alquilarlo y a la venta de mercadería para atender la campaña escolar. La meta de Lupe es seguir aumentando el negocio que tiene y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lupe is a woman who is well loved by her friends. She lives in the district of Callería in the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three children all of whom are grown-up and semi-independent. She sells goods by the season, rents out her car, and manages a mechanics shop where her son works. She sells the goods to her friends and acquaintances. She is a single mother. Lupe has been part of the community bank "Las Almendras" for three years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in buying and later selling goods for the school shopping season. At this moment, she needs a loan of 2,000 soles ($725), which she will invest in repairing her car so that she can rent it out and in selling goods for the school shopping season. Lupe's goal is to continue increasing her business and to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to repair her car to rent it out and in selling goods for the school season

loans.name: Elsa Lucia

texts.es: Elsa tiene 23 años de edad ella es soltera vive  en la casa de sus padres juntamente con sus hermanos ellos viven  en el Asentamiento Humano Micaela Bastidas  en casa de 1 piso de material  noble, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y la venta de bebidas en la casa de sus padres, Elsa es una joven muy activa con muchas metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder crecer en su negocio, con el dinero que solicita  invertira en capital de trabajo de la venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Elsa is 23 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s house along with her brothers. They live in Asentamiento Humano Micaela Bastidas in a one floor house made of good materials. She sells beauty products, and drinks, from her parent’s house. She is very young and active and has lots of goals and plans. One of which is to be able to grow her business with a loan she would invest as working capital in the sale of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement her business

loans.name: Gaveli

texts.en: Gaveli, 49, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She needs farming supplies to operate her rice field. However, she lacks capital for her rice farming business. She is seeking help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. by requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm. Perla is the mother of 6 children: the eldest is 29. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Immah

texts.en:
Immah K. is a 40-year-old woman from Freetown in Sierra Leone. She has four children.

Immah K. sells cooked rice served with potato leaves or cassava leaves. She has been with LAPO, SL for about two years now.

With the help of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders, Immah K. hopes to use this new loan to expand her business by purchasing more rice, potato leaves and cassava leaves. In addition, it is her dream to use her profits to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, potatoes leaves and cassava leaves

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua S. sells doughnuts at Elmina. She is a single mother of two children. Efua has not received any formal education. The money she is able to generate from her doughnut business is used to care for her children. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, and other ingredients to make the doughnuts that she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

She was sold out of doughnuts at the time the picture was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how it is done.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is divorced with children and her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Berna takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Berna owns a stall selling bananas in Ntinda Market and sells bananas at retail only. She works six days a week. Berna receives at least 20 customers a day. Berna has been in this banana business for a long time. She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 16th loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of bananas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a delivery van to get bananas from villages. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and worked with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Oriente Group

texts.es:
