El grupo Nuevo Oriente  está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras  las cuales trabajan con Adim desde hace años. La coordinadora del grupo es Rosa Virginia Fran una señora alegre y esforzada la cual se dedica a realizar sartenes con la ayuda de un  nieto. Ella con el préstamo comprar materiales para la fabricación de dicho producto.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Ana Paulina C. quien vende perfumes por encargo, Elivee T. M. comercializa prendas en oro laminado y perfumes y Ángela S. comercializa de todo un poco desde ropa, perfumes, cosméticos,  cremas, panas, bolsos…etc.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Oriente group is comprised of four hard-working and enterprising women. They have worked with Adim for several years. Rosa Virginia Fran is the coordinator of the group. She is a happy and dedicated woman who makes pans with the help of a grandson. She will use the loan to buy material to make this product. Ana Paulina C. is a colleague in the group. She sells perfume by order. Elivee T. M., another colleague, sells articles that have been laminated in gold and perfume. Ángela S., a colleague, sells a little of everything like clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams, bread, and purses, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to make pans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: install electricity in his house

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the village of Brgy.Nangalisan,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Liza is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Liza raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Liza has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Liza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Liza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sangha Nheanh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of 10 people who live in Svay Ta Ok village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Sangha N. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sangha N. is 38 years old. She is a pig breeder who can earn some money from selling pigs to support her family. Now her breeding pig business is good, so she wants to expand. Thus to improve breeding, Mrs. Sangha N. is asking for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. 

Her husband Mr. Peou Pom is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria Esperanza C. mujer emprendedora, esforzada y luchadora  quien es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio vendiendo gaseosa, chiverías y dulces.

Ella con el préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, jabón, ace, cloro, papel higiénico, pañales, toallas, salsa, productos maggi, medicamentos, tang, pastas, cereales, chiverías y leña. Asimismo semanalmente realiza nacatamales comida típica a base de masa y cerdo.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza C. is a strong, resourceful and tenacious woman who owns a small corner shop she initially opened to sell fizzy drinks, yogurts and sweets. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, soap, ACE bleach, toilet paper, diapers, towels, sauce, Maggi products, medicines, Tang drinks, pasta, cereals, yogurts and firewood. On top of this, she weekly prepares nacatamales, a typical dish made of masa (type of dough used for tamales) and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en:
Phoibe is 36 years old and married with three children. The oldest child is 14 years old, the next is 11 years and the last one is 8 years old. Phoibe’s husband works in government. They both work hard in order to provide their children all the necessary things. Phoibe, in particular, has five years of experience in her business but she has only a little capital, which is a challenge for her. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Phoibe is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With the extra money that Phoibe expects to earn, she will be reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Diosnel

texts.es:
El señor Diosnel tiene 61 años de edad, es separado, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes a él, vive en el barrio denominado Calle Ybaté de la ciudad de Itá.
Posee un puesto comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad hace mas de 20 años, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouteri y artículos de  santería.
Solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería con la compra de camioncitos, pelotas, muñecas, mochilas y otros juguetes atendiendo que se acerca el día del niño y en esta época tiene mucha venta.
El señor Diosnel demuestra ser una persona muy seria, responsable y trabajadora, manifiesta que dichas ganas de trabajar lo trae desde muy joven ya que proviene de una familia muy humilde que siempre le inculcó la responsabilidad.
Gracias a esta profesión mejoró su nivel de vida y  ayudó a sus hijos a  estudiar y que puedan ser personas útiles a su comunidad
texts.en:
61-year old Sr. Diosnel is separated and has grown-up children who have left home. He lives in the neighbourhood of Calle Ybaté in the town of Itá. He has run a stall in the municipal market for more than 20 years where he sells various items such as giftware, toys, jewelry, and religious articles. Diosnel is seeking a loan to increase his stock of toys. He wishes to buy small trucks, balls, dolls, backpacks, and other toys in preparation for the Day of the Child when business is brisk. He has proven to be a serious, responsible, hardworking person who has been keen to work ever since he was very young. He comes from a simple family who has always taught him to be responsible. Through hard work Diosnel has improved his standard of living and helped his children get an education so that they could be useful members of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toys, jewelry etc. for his market stall

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and single. She has a shop where she sells sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil and beans. She believes the success of her business comes from her good customer care. Also, she keeps her shop open for many hours so she can sell to clients throughout most of the day.  

With this loan, Mary will increase her inventory of the items she sells. She currently sells five sacks of rice per week and hopes to increase this to 20 sacks per week within a year’s time. She also hopes to increase the sales of her other products significantly.

loans.use: Buying home items such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijas Yoselin de 14 y Lisbeth de 12 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la comodidad de su hogar Margarita teje a mano sus coloridas prendas artesanales, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, ya que tiene que cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus compradores. Ella no solo se dedica a vender lo que teje, sino que también recolecta de otras tejedoras, quienes igualmente reciben una buena paga por su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que de cierta forma también ayuda a sus compañeras a progresar, lleva 15 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que amanecerse para cumplir con los pedidos. Para más adelante, espera formar una empresa con sus compañeras tejedoras, con la cual todas puedan desarrollarse. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus anteriores pagos siempre fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, las socias de su banco comunal le tiene mucho cariño, ya que es muy responsable. Con los cuatrocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Margarita is 38 years old, and is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her two beloved daughters, Yoselin who is 14 and Lisbeth who is 12 years old, and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. In the comfort of her home, Margarita weaves colored handcrafted garments by hand. Every day she starts working very early, since she has to complete the orders that her buyers make. She not only sells what she weaves, but also she collects garments from other weavers, who also receive a good payment for their work. What she likes most about her work, is that she also helps her coworkers get ahead. She has been doing this work for 15 years, and what she considers most difficult is to be able to wake up early in order to complete the orders. In the future, she hopes to form a business with her weaving colleagues, so that they can all develop themselves. This is her fourth loan with MFP, in her previous payments she was always very punctual and she expects to be so now also. The members of her community bank are very fond of her, since she is very responsible. With the 400 soles requested, she will buy more wool in order to make new handcrafted garments.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool in order to make more woven garments

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum S., 57, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province.

She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2 each day and her husband raises pigs and grows rice. Her husband typically makes about US$1 each day as a pig farmer. 

Oum S. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase more pigs and increase the stock of her grocery items.

loans.use: To raise pigs and buy grocery items.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es: Leyla tiene 45 años ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta muy contenta de su actividad que es una pulpería. Su hijo le ayuda con la atención a los clientes, ella ha tenido cierta experiencia con créditos pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente, pues siempre se preocupa por abonar en tiempo y forma. Tiene muy buena demanda por sus clientes que siempre le solicitan productos básicos para su hogar. Este crédito es para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan entre otros.
texts.en: Leyla is 45 years old and she is a very enterprising woman who very much enjoys managing her grocery business. Her son helps with the customer services. She has had some experience with past loans and she had demonstrated herself to be an excellent client, always making sure to be on time with her payments. Her store sees a good demand from her clients, purchasing basic products for the home. This loan will be used to purchase basic cereal grains, soft drinks, and juices among other merchandise.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: 20 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. 20 de Octubre inicia su primer ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta la señora Maria,  la tesorera  la señora Ledia y la secretaria de actas la señora Karina.

La señora  Maria es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, con  cuatro hijos,  las señoras han depositado su confianza en ella para que asuma el cargo de presidenta. Este es su primer ciclo, ingresó al grupo debido a que se informó de los servicios de Pro Mujer a través del equipo de Promoción.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella cuenta con una “tienda – pulpería” (tienda de abarrotes y otros productos).  La tienda está ubicada en su domicilio, por lo que las ventas pueden realizarse durante todo el día, todos los días.  Su primer crédito fue invertido en compra de mercadería, el nuevo crédito de Bs. 2000.- también será invertido en mercadería y tarjetas de recarga para celulares.
Cuando se le consulta sobre el servicio que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella comenta que el servicio de Salud.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, se cuenta con negocios de comida, venta fruta, venta de medias y ropa, tienda de lanas, hilar lana, venta de fresco, tienda de barrio, taller mecánica.
texts.en:
The October 20th Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group is composed of eight members, seven women and one man. The Board of Directors consists of Sra. Maria (President), Sra. Ledia (Treasurer), and Sra. Karina (Secretary of Records).

Sra. Maria is a 42 year old woman who is married and has four children. The other women have placed their trust in her by electing her to be President. This is her first loan cycle. She joined Pro Mujer because a group promoting the organization told her about the services. With respect to her business, Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries and other products every day. Her first loan, in the amount of 2000 BOB, will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She will also acquire rechargeable calling cards for mobile phones. When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, Maria said she likes the health services.

With respect to the other members, they have businesses involving the sale of food, fruit, socks, clothing, wool, soft drinks, as well as managing a neighborhood store and an auto repair shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & rechargeable calling cards

loans.name: Parsitau Ole

texts.en:
Parsitau S., aged 40 years, trades livestock in Enkaroni market in Kitengela. He sells his livestock to Kenya meat commission suppliers and to butchers in Kitengela and Kajiado for slaughter. He is married to Simayiyian S., a farmer who is 37 years old. Together they have two children, Salaash, age 22, who is a farmer and Jane, age 20, who is in college. He has been running his livestock trading business for one year and receives a monthly profit of Kshs. 11,000.

Parsitau was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.  With the Kshs. 20,000 loan, Parsitau plans to use Kshs. 10,000 to buy cows, Kshs. 5,000 to buy goats and Kshs. 5,000 to buy sheep for trading.  If the loan boosts business, he will open a butchery in Kajiado town.

Parsitau’s dream is to develop his livestock trading business and open many butcheries in Kajiado, Kitengela and Bissil. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy cows, sheep, and goats for trading.

loans.name: Sandra Karina

texts.es:
Sandra, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. helados y tienda D. productos D. uso domestico, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 13 años y 3 años D. edad, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo D. su esposo trabajando en lo propio, no tiene horario, y actualmente están con la iniciativa D. surtir el negocio preparándose ya para la época naviD.ña, motivo que les lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería.
Este préstamo le ayudara a crecer con el inventario y a disponer D. muchas opciones en productos para los cliente, así estará dándoles un mejor servicio y atención manteniendo siempre al fidelidad D. ellos.
Sus aspiraciones con respecto al préstamo son crecer cada vez más, mejorar su condición económica y establecer una mejor solvencia económica para la familia.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in Concepción Batres, in the department of Usulután. She has a store that sells ice cream and household products. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are 13 and 3 years old. She started this business with her husband’s help, with him working at the business. She doesn’t have a schedule. They are currently looking to stock up for the Christmas season, which is why they are requesting a loan to purchase merchandise.

This loan will help her to increase her inventory and have a variety of products for her customers. This way she can proviD. them better service and attention so that she can secure their customer loyalty.

Her hopes for the loan are that she’ll be able to grow her business, improve her economic situation, and establish better economic circumstances for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Masudakhan's Group

texts.en:
Masudakhan B., 47, is the leader of this group. She has raised cattle since childhood. Being very experienced, she has already acquired 27 sheep and 24 goats. She is a mother of two sons, 27 and 19. She is a proud veteran of cattle breeding for 20 years. For her business start-up, she spent 8,000 KGS. She has applied for this loan to improve the living conditions of her cattle and to buy fodder. Masudakhan thanks all lenders for making attempts to change her life. 

Kyrgyzstan's principal exports, which go overwhelmingly to other CIS countries, are non-ferrous metals and minerals, woolen goods and other agricultural products, electric energy, and certain engineering goods. In turn, the Republic relies on other former Soviet states for petroleum and natural gas, ferrous metals, chemicals, most machinery, wood and paper products, some foods, and most construction materials.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fodder

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He is from Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has been making pastries for over eight years and he opened his own pastry shop in 2006. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. He helps his father to meet the family's expenses.  

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional merchandise that he needs, such as flour, sugar, and oil, so he is prepared for the coming holidays. He also wants to increase his productivity and further develop his shop. He is planning to continue expanding his business and he is positive about the coming year. 

His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shop and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Glivid Ecuador

texts.es:
Glivid de 37 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. El y su esposo han sido muy unidos por eso cuando trabajaban en la camaronera decidieron retirarse para conseguir nuevas oportunidades con un negocio propio. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana con una casa de ladrillos han trabajado durante estos años repartiendo comida a sus conocidos y vecinos. Poco a poco han incrementado la lista de cliente que tienen. Ellos se levantan en la mañana a preparar la comida en la cocina de la casa y las reparten en la tarde cuando les comienzan a pedir los clientes almuerzos.  

Tienen muchas aspiraciones con el negocio por eso quieren continuar repartiendo comida para poder seguir quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como aceite, arroz, azúcar para hacer mas comida. En el futuro quiere tener un local para tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Glivid is 37 years old.  He is married and has two children aged 7 and 3.  He and his wife have always been very united.  For this reason, when they were working in the shrimp industry, they decided to quit their jobs and follow new opportunities with their own business.

Glivid lives in a peri-urban area in a brick house.  He and his wife work delivering meals to their acquaintances and neighbors.  They have gradually increased their customer base.  They get up in the morning to prepare food in their kitchen which they then deliver in the afternoon when their customers start ordering lunches.  They have a lot of aspirations for their business.  They would like to continue delivering food.  Glivid is requesting this loan to buy food products such as oil, rice and sugar so that they can make more meals.  In the future he would like to have premises so that they can serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne owns a business that sells cattle. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one and four. Her husband sells meat. Yvonne has been selling cattle for seven years. Her loan will be used to buy goats, cows and hens to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy new equipment to use in establishing a restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with one child who is 37 years old. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food vending business and coconut selling for the past five years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  Asha faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of food for sale is low and the demand is high. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase building materials to renovate her food stall and add sacks of coconuts. Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her food stall and add sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a retail shop business; her neighbours and also passersby are potential customers. Meali faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, detergent, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of sugar, detergent, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Eutropia faces the major challenge of seasonality, and especially during outbreaks of poultry diseases. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. Eutropia joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Indira's Group

texts.en:
Indira M., 23, is the leader of this group. Recently, her friend advised her to join a company producing beauty products. Indira is very interested in the beauty industry and its potential and therefore immediately accepted the offer. Indira is a consultant salesperson, whose responsibilities are to promote the product and attract a large amount of customers. Indira knows all the innovations in the company’s products and provides catalogs to her friends and other potential customers through door-to-door sales. She has her own team and receives bonuses for providing services for customers on a regular basis. Her main goal is to ensure customer satisfaction with a product and to get more profits. She applied for a loan in order to invest funds in ordering more products. Indira sees her future with a further partnership with this company and with increased income.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es: L a Sra. Yngrid de 32 años de edad, Casada con el Sr. Brismak hace 8 años tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en casa propia por la  Zona norte de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. La clienta  se dedica   a la venta de abarrotes  hace 5 años. El crédito que se le otorgo  a la clienta es para la compra de  una rockola para instalarla en su tienda y así poder tener mas ingresos. La Sra. Yngrid Agradeció a la Institución por la confianza que depositaron ella, es un apersona muy trabajadora desde tempranas horas de la mañana atiende su tienda siempre amable con los clientes, con muchas ganas de superación y con deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yngrid is 32 years old, married to Bismark for 8 years, and has 3 children, all of school age. She lives in her own house in the northern zone of the city of Santa Cruz. For the past 5 years she has sold groceries.

The loan she requests is to buy a “rockola” (“juke box”) to install in her store in order to produce more income. Yngrid is grateful to this institution for the confidence it has placed in her. She is a hard-working person, present in the store from the early hours of the morning. Yngrid always treats her customers with kindness. She has considerable drive to advance herself and to improve the quality of life of all her family.

loans.use: TO BUY A "JUKE BOX" TO INSTALL IN HER STORE FOR EXTRA INCOME

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pilar; es casada, la socia tiene 49 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos,  de los cuales tres de ellos son independientes y uno de ellos tiene 16 años de edad; la socia tiene un pequeño abarrotes, ella vende todo tipo de productos desde los de primera necesidad, hasta las gaseosas y cervezas, la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas y de este modo implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This lady belongs to the community bank "Hands Together Rumichaca-Alta". This bank is located in the town of Rumichaca, in the province of Urumbamba and the department of Cusco. 
The bank member is called Pilar; she is married and 45 years old. She has 4 children, 3 of whom are grown up and one who is 16 years old. She has a small grocery store where she sells all sorts of goods from basic necessities to sodas and beers. She wants the loan to buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, and flour, and in this way strengthen her business. She is requesting the loan to buy basic necessities. 
The bank member is very grateful for the loan and she promises to may the repayments for this loan in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en: Mut Y. has four children: three of them are single and one is married and living in a separate house. Mut Y. and her husband work together cultivating rice in Kompong Cham province. From this, they earn around $3 a day to use for family expenses. She will be using this loan to plant cucumbers and corn, and she hopes she can sell them in the local market for extra income when they are mature.

loans.use: to plant cucumbers and corn.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and the married mother of four lovely children. She lives with her family in Kitale, where she runs a grocery store. Sarah has been in this business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Sarah is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy merchandise for her shop such as a variety of vegetables and fruits. She plans to use the profit from her loan to purchase more stock for her grocery store. In the future, Sarah plans to be a large supplier of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en: Almeda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Almeda has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of blouses, t-shirts & beauty products. Almeda is new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Almeda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, t-shirts & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene  36 años de edad, es padre de 2 niños de 3 y 5 años , carlos cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en el caserío La Zaranda  del anexo Batangrande, ubicado en un zona rural de dicho distrito.

Carlos se dedica a la cría y comercialización de animales menores , como ganado caprino y ovino los cuales los cría en su domicilio y cuando alcanzan el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local y con personas que concurren el caserío donde vive, adicionalmente se dedica a realizar labores como obrero de campo, en  el caserío La Zaranda.

Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y para mejorar sus corrales.

Carlos es un hombre responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo desea salir  adelante con sus familia y que poco apoco obtengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old and the father of 2 children, ages 3 and 5. He owns his own house, located in the settlement of La Zaranda, pertaining to Batangrande anex, in that district's rural zone.

Carlos raises and sells livestock, mainly goats and sheep, that he raises at home. When they reach the ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market, or to people who come to the settlement where he lives. In addition, he does rural labor in and around La Zaranda.

Carlos is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 800 new sols to buy feed for his livestock and to improve his corrals.

Carlos is a responsible and hard-working man who desires through his efforts to get ahead with his family, and who, little by little, hopes to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock and to improve his corrals.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is 42 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three grown children. Edison has a motorcycle transport service. He has owned and operated the service for 10 years. He earns approximately PHP 10,200 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle. Edison has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Edison hopes to gain more profit and purchase more motorcycles for transport.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Peninaa

texts.en: Peninaa is a determined 33-year-old lady. She is married and blessed with five children. She has been operating a restaurant for the last year to be able to provide for her family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has acquired skills in financial management. This has helped her to improve her business.  She hopes to open other outlets of her business in five years. Her dream is to venture into other businesses. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sodas and beer and open another branch of her business.

loans.use: To buy sodas and beer and open another branch of her business

loans.name: Froilana

texts.es: Froilana tiene 62 años, es viuda pero vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad D. Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito ecológico D. Sivia. Froilana al ver que los vecinos D. su comuna se ganaban la vida en el campo, no quiso desaprovechar, es por eso que incursionó en la siembra D. cacao y café; productos que no hay mucha competencia en su zona. Hoy le va muy bien, además que le proporciona buenos dividendos no descuida D. los gastos D. su hogar y la D. sus hijos. Él reconoce que este trabajo requiere D. mucho esfuerzo, por ello cuando llega la temporada D. cosecha debe contratar peones para facilitar la extracción D. estos frutos. Lo que más anhela es tener capital para invertir en su chacra, y con las mismas ganas y entusiasmo que lo caracteriza, desea mejorar las técnicas D. cultivo para así tener una mejor producción D. café y cacao. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Froilana is 62 years old and widowed.  She lives with her two children in her own house located in the Santa Rosa Alta community in the ecological district of Sivia. Froilana, upon seeing that her neighbors were earning a living in the fields, refused to fall behind.  She thus began growing cacao and coffee, products for which there is not much competition in her area.  Now it is going very well for her, and it also brings her good profits so she does not neglect her household expenses and those of her children.  She recognizes that this work requires a lot of effort, so when harvest time comes she has to hire laborers to facilitate the harvest of this produce.  What she most longs for is to have capital to invest in her farm, and with the same desire and enthusiasm that characterize her, she wants to improve her cultivation methods to have a better harvest of coffee and cacao.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual in her payments.  With the 3,000 soles she is asking for, she will purchase sacks of organic fertilizer to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina, es casada con el señor Harvey,  en donde procreo cuatro  hijos quienes  dos ya están casados y dos siguen a su responsabilidad y son: Mirna Fabiola de quince años  de edad y la más pequeña es Liliana Montserrat dieseis años de edad. 

    Ella es ama de casa y se dedica a la compra de pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado o en pie, y solicito el préstamo para comprar más pollos por reja, así como también comprar pollos de rancho para venderlo rostizado.

     Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fue su familia para que también ella aporte con los ingresos de la casa aun que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  decidió trabajar para así sacara adelante  a sus hijos que están estudiando.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida y teniendo ahorros para sostener a su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is married to Sr. Harvey. They have four children, two of whom are already married. The other two are still their responsibility, Mirna Fabiola (age 15) and the youngest Liliana Montserrat (age 6).

Catalina is a homemaker and buys farm-raised chickens that she will sell whole or in pieces. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more chickens for grilling. Catalina will also buy free-range chickens to sell roasted.

Her family inspired her to start this business because she wanted to be able to help with the household income. She has the support of her husband, who decided to take on additional work so that their children could study.

What Catalina wants most is to move forward with her small business so that she can improve her quality of life and have some savings to maintain her family. They are what is most important to her.

loans.use: to buy chickens for grilling and roasting.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Humberto se dedica al transporte público de esta misma ciudad Acuña desde hace 21 años. En este momento Humberto el no conduce ninguna unidad ya que tiene dos choferes que le trabajan y le pagan una cuota como renta. Comenta que en este momento uno de los camiones necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagara al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. El señor Humberto ya es una persona grande de edad y eso no le impide trabajar por lo que desempeña como supervisor en el trasporte urbano, cerciorándose que los camiones vallan a lugar del destino correcto y una velocidad moderada. Aparte de su ingresos como renta de unidades el recibe un pensión mensual para sostener sus gastos.
El señor Humberto es el que porta una camiseta color blanca.
texts.en:
Señor Humberto has been working in public transportation in Acuña for the last 21 years.  Currently Humberto does not drive a vehicle himself, as he has two drivers who work for him, and who pay him a rental fee.  He comments that at the moment one of these vehicles needs maintenance, and this is why he wants a loan to purchase the parts he needs, and to pay the mechanic who will do the work.  

Señor Humberto is an older person, but this does not prevent him for working.  He serves as a supervisor for the urban transport service, making sure that the vehicles go to the right destination and at a reasonable speed.

In addition to his income from the rental of the vehicles, he receives a monthly pension to cover his costs.  

Señor Humberto is the man in the white T-shirt.

loans.use: to maintain a vehicle.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of the lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro es un joven trabajador, entusiasta con muchas ganas de surgir en la vida, y ser un hombre exitoso; hace 3 años ha emprendido el negocio de elaboración y venta de ladrillos en crudo , es soltero con grandes metas y sueños , eligió este tipo de trabajo porque de pequeño veía a sus familiares laborar así y le gustó, el señor Pedro invertirá el préstamo kiva para comprar más tierras y así tener mas materia prima para laborar, el Señor Pedro sueña con tener en el futuro una empresa de elaboración de adobe y ladrillos en crudo, también para su vida desea tener una esposa e hijos a quien enseñar el arte de la labranza de ladrillos. El con su trabajo y su entusiasmo lo logrará. El Sr. Pedro esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Pedro is is a hardworking, enthusiastic young man who really wants to get ahead in life and be a successful man. Three years ago, he started a business making and selling raw bricks. He is single wnad has big goals and dreams. He decided on this type of work because when he was little he saw relatives working at this happily and he liked it. Pedro will invest the Kiva loan in buying more land and thus have more raw material to work with. Pedro dreams of having a business making adobe in the future. He would also like to have a wife and children to teach the art of brickmaking to. With his hard work and enthusiasm, he will achieve it. Pedro is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to buy land and get raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José, tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos  actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de café. El con el crédito comprara los fertilizantes y insumos necesarios para asistir de la mejor forma su cafetal. El cuenta con la plantación en producción y condiciones regulares por lo cual quiere mejorarla y así tenerla en condiciones optimas para la próxima cosecha. El quiere obtener de su cafetal los mejores resultados  y las mayores ganancias para así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan José is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.  He will use his loan to buy the supplies he needs to care for his coffee crops.  He will use his loan to buy fertilizers and the supplies he needs to better look after his coffee plantation.  His plantation is currently in production and in regular condition.  He would like to improve it and thereby have it in optimum condition for his next harvest.  He would like to extract the best results and the best profits from his coffee plantation so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.  This is Juan José's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't obtained previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have provided him with this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, es soltero,  vive en su casa propia, la cual cuentan con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Pacanga que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace 5 años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en su mismo domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos de primera necesidad y golosinas. Cuenta con una clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones personales.

José observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente desde un principio. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como productos de consumo diario y golosinas.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles. José es muy trabajador y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para tener un negocio más amplio y bien surtido.
texts.en:
José, 54, is single and lives in his own house that has electricity and running water, located in the Pacanga district, La Libertad department.  This is an agricultural and cattle raising area.

For the last 5 years he has had his own business in his house where he sells various staple goods and sweets.  He has a good customer base and the income is used to cover his personal expenses.
José has noticed that his business has grown well since the beginning.  He wishes to expand it by buying more staple merchandise and cookies.  He's going to purchase his products in big quantities to keep prices down.  That's why he decided to request a loan of 2000 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa.

 José is very hardworking and responsible and he wants to have more earnings to have a larger and better supplied business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as basic staples and sweets to continue offering to his customers

loans.name: Jappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Seynabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par son frére.

Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It consists of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is commerce. 

Madame Seynabou, who is on the right of the photo raising the hand, is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. She also has another child in her care entrusted by her brother. 

She is active in the sale of breakfast. She has good experience in this field of activity, which she has practiced for several years. 

This loan would permit her to build her capital and to better develop her business. 

The profits will permit her to improve the quality of live for her family (health, food, clothing etc....) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy diverse products

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 47 years old and married with 2 children.

Jelly works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Jelly has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF.  She has been in the rice business for 10 years, and also earns an income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Jelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 24 years.  He is 42 years old, married to Sara, and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for his grocery business.

In future, Peter hopes to own a lorry to transport his farm produce to the market, thereby increasing his income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his grocery business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married and has 3 daughters and 2 sons. Except the youngest one, all are getting their education by attending a nearby school. 

Razia is very supportive and helps to support her husband's animal selling business.  Her husband purchases sheep and goats at a young age for low prices, raises them and sells to butchers to make a profit.  Razia takes care of the cattle by giving them food and keeping their living place clean.

She also performs house work very well.
 
Razia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business.  With the loan investment, he will buy goats and sheep.

He has been operating his business for many years and Razia is hopeful that an investment will be productive.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Minyali Fc Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Minyali FC Group in Western Kenya! Susan is the facilitator of the Minyali FC group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Susan takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Susan had a good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Susan was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Susan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Susan will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Minyali FC group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha vive en la zona  del plan 3000 la casa donde vive es propia, tiene 43 años esta casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando y también le colaboran en lo que es la elaboración y venta de comida,  la señora Mirtha  se dedica a la venta de comida los platos que elabora son de pollo, bife, milanesa de pollo, asado de chancho, chicha de maíz y otros, su esposo don Guillermo es enfermo de esta manera el colabora con los gastos del hogar, vende fuera de casa y los fines de semana vende frente a una cancha, ella es muy conocida  por su amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes y también por los riquísimos platillos que cocina, con el dinero del  crédito comprar material de construcción para el terminado de obra fina de dos cuartos, es una persona muy  trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado por la institución, su deseo es el ver a sus hijos profesionales y así de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mirtha lives in the "plan 3000" zone where she owns her own home.  She is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  Her children are in school but they also help her prepare and sell food.  Mirtha sells food.  The dishes she prepares are made of chicken, steak, breaded chicken, grilled pork, and a drink made of purple corn, among other things.  Her husband Guillermo is a nurse so in this way he helps with the household expenses.  She sells outside the home and on weekends she sells in front of a field.  She is well known for the kindness with which she serves her customers and the delicious dishes she prepares.  With the money from the loan she will buy construction material to complete the finish work on two rooms.  She is a very hard-working person and she feels happy for the support the institution has given her.  Her wish is to see her children become professionals and in that way improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for the finish work on two rooms.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a  married 68-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 20 and 40, operates a salon to earn a living and has two employees.  She also does poultry farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her two businesses because she has been trained in business management skills.

Lucy needs to supply water to her poultry farm and so is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Irineo, tiene 71 años de edad, originario de Estelí, es agricultor ,muy trabajador es padre de 10 hijos, la mayoría son mayores de edad, son independientes. El se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde muy joven, a duras penas logro terminar el segundo grado de primaria pues se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra. Para sus hijos quiere un futuro mejor  para que se preparen. 
El requiere el préstamo para reparación y mejoras para la finca. Con este crédito podrá hacer cercos, realizar limpieza de terreno, mejorar los potreros de los animales.  Por lo pronto desea prepararse para el siguiente ciclo de siembra de granos básicos
texts.en:
Irineo is 71 years old. He is from Estelí. He is a hardworking farmer and the father of 10 children, most of them grownup and independent. He has been growing basic grains since he was very young. He could only complete second grade in school because he had to work the land.  He wants a better future for his children. He wants them to study. 
He wants the loan to make repairs and improvements in his farm. With the money, he will be able to build fences, clear the land and improve the animals’ stables.  The first thing he wants to do is to get ready for the next cycle of sowing basic grains.

loans.use: to repair and make improvements in his farm.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es una señora humilde, que se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos  como son: sopes, enchiladas verdes, enchiladas rojas, entomatadas y tacos dorados.
Es madre soltera tiene un hijo por quien trabaja para darle un mejor futuro, ella pidió el préstamo para comprar  chile verdes, chile secos, tomate, cebolla. Pollo y cebollas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla en lo que se pueda ya que su trabaja cada día  va creciendo un poco más.
texts.en: Señora Guadalupe is a humble woman who is dedicated to selling Mexican delicacies such as: dip, green enchiladas, red enchiladas, entomatadas and golden tacos.  She is a single mother.  She has a son for whom she works to give him a better future.  She requests the loan to buy green Chiles, dry Chile powder, tomatoes, chicken and onions.  She gives thanks to the foundation for supporting her in her efforts, since her business grows each day a little more.

loans.use: to buy chiles, tomatoes and oil for making food.

loans.name: Benkadi  6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi  6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   SITAN,  2 eme  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 270.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 6" are married women averaging 46 years of age and six children each all living in traditional families in Bougoura, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SITAN, the second one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.75 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 270,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouman V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAH personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business in which she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Jane will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have regular cash flow and a good lifestyle.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: San Hilario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARIO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Zinaida tiene 33 años de edad, 03 hijos  y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa al por menor como casacas, chompas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de productos lácteos, venta de ropa, farmacia, trabajadores independientes, docentes, brindando el servicio de taxi.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the communal bank "San Hilario." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Bank member Zinaida is 33 years old. She has three children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her business of retail sales of clothing such as soccer jackets and sweaters, among other items. She has had her business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells her merchandise to the customers who come to her, such as friends and relatives, among others. She is a responsible and persevering person, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy soccer jackets.

The other members have businesses of selling dairy products, selling clothing, a pharmacy, working independently, teaching, and offering taxi service.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

The members who are shown in the added photos asked permission to arrive late for the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy soccer jackets

loans.name: Sabaly 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABALY 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  FOUGATIE un des villages de Yanfolila 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5èmeprêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  AWA, 3ème personne debout de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  FOUGATIE après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco continua con sus estudios en ciencia de la educación, esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograr su meta de ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de sus conocimientos poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder pagar sus cuotas.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Diegane

texts.en:
This is a group loan request submitted by the twenty-one members of the village credit and savings association Aspovrece, represented by Diegane D..  The group will use the loan to open a small general store and hardware shop, which requires the following investments:

  • Shop building rental and electricity
  • Wholesale purchase of food items, household supplies and hardware for retail

This enterprise will not only generate a profit for the Aspovrece group, but will also make it more convenient and affordable for the local villagers to purchase everyday household items.

  

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: General store/hardware shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy a medium-sized cow

loans.name: Epe

texts.en: Epenesa M. is an experienced artist working in elei, a traditional form of fabric printing. She designs uniforms for committees and companies. Her talent has made her famous in the village, and she is loyal to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and oil

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 46 and has 3 boys and 3 girls, aged 10 to 23. She lives in Nghe An, a poor province of Central Vietnam. Her family grows rice and raises chickens and cows. They also have a small fish pond. Mrs. N. wants to use TYM's loan to buy additional fodder and a calf.

loans.use: buy fodder and a calf

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa Lopez is 48 years old. She is married to Reinaldo Gonzalez, and they have 3 children. They own their house which Narcisa inherited from her father. One of their daughter migrated to the United States due to the bad economic times in the country.

In order to be able to start her own business, she counted with the help of her daughter, who migrated to the United States. Her daughter sent them money and this way they were able to have the sufficient funds to open up their own business in 1995. At first, she opened up a kiosk, but with time the business started to grow and now they have a good size store fully stocked.

Thanks to the earnings they make from the store, they are able to have a better quality of life. With their savings, they have been able to purchase a truck. Her husband travels from house to house selling fruits and vegetables.

Since this has turned out to be a great business venture and sales have increased, she would like to purchase a wide variety of fruits and vegetables in huge quantities for her husband to sell. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase apples, oranges, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Narcisa L., tiene 48 años de edad, está casada con Reinaldo González y tienen tres hijos. Viven en una casa propia que heredó de su padre. Una de sus hijas tuvo que emigrar a Estados Unidos debido a la crisis económica por la cual atravesaban. Para poder abrir su negocio contó con la ayuda de esta hija que se fue a trabajar a los EE.UU. quien les envió el dinero para dicho efecto en el año 1995. Abrió en principio un pequeño kiosco, y con el tiempo gracias a los buenos ingresos el negocio fue progresando paulatinamente y hoy día ya cuentan con una despensa bien surtida. Gracias a los buenos ingresos que le genera su despensa han logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Con unos ahorros que juntaron compraron una camioneta y su marido se encarga de vender casa por casa las mercaderías como frutas y verduras. Como el negocio marcha bien, y da buenos resultados las ventas que realiza su marido, ella desea comprar en grandes cantidades mayor variedad de frutas y verduras por lo que solicita el crédito de $600 para comprar pomelos, naranjas, bananas, piñas, tomates, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit such as apples, pineapples, oranges, bananas, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine T. is a 38 year old single mother. She lives with her children in Marcory, south of Abidjan. Delphine has sold agricultural products in the Marcory market for many years to earn a living for her family.

Delphine's daughter and son go to primary and secondary school. She has to pay all of their school expenses. She is therefore requesting a loan of $850. She has been in AE&I microcredit for a couple of years and has always performed very well, reimbursing her loans.

loans.use: Delphine Teya will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Gie Mayor Group

texts.fr:
Our objective is to buy staples in the cities of Dakar, Ziguinchor or Banjul and retail them locally. This will enable us to supply the local and surrounding populations and offer them easy access to essential goods without the major difficulties we always encounter. Our village is isolated and we are a long way from the main communication routes. This means, therefore, that our business will be extremely helpful to the eco-village population. Items will vary greatly in selection and according to demand. Some of us will sell foodstuffs, and others either cooking utensils and household goods, or clothing.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Notre objectif est de faire en sorte que nous puissions mettre sur place des produits de première nécessité que nous allions acheter dans les grandes villes (Dakar, Ziguinchor ou Banjul) et de les revendre au détail. Cette activité nous permettra de ravitailler les populations locales et environnantes d’avoir accès facilement aux produits de première nécessité sans les grosses contraintes que l’on rencontre tout le temps. En effet, notre village est isolé et nous sommes loin des voies de communication de grandes affluences. Ce qui fait donc que notre activité sera d’une grande utilité pour les populations de l’écovillage. Les articles seront très variés et en fonction de la demande. Parmi nous, il y aura ceux qui vont vendre des denrées alimentaires, d’autres des ustensiles de cuisine et de ménage et celles qui vendront des habits.

loans.use: To buy essential goods and foodstuffs, kitchen utensils, household goods and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en:
Norah N. is a 49 year old divorced mother of 6 who raises pigs. She wants the loan to build more pig sties and breed more piglets. She eventually wants to expand her business and become a specialist pork supplier.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct pig sties

loans.name: Starehe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Starehe S.. She is married with four children, ages 4, 6, 10, and 13. In 2007 Starehe established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $350 in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Khidoyat

texts.en:
M. Khidoyat is 56 years old. He is married and already has four grandchildren.

Khidoyat is an entrepreneur. He is selling foodstuffs like confectioneries and tea. At the same time he is selling  housewares. He has been in this business for 5 years. His wife is also involved in the business and helps Khidoyat in the market. The business is successful and generates income sufficient for supporting their large family. 

Today Khidoyat requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to increase capital for purchasing the foodstuffs for selling. Having proved himself a reliable client, Khidoyat promises to pay the current loan in time.

loans.use: Increasing capital for purchasing foodstuffs for selling.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Mrs. Marlene is a woman of 35 years who lives in the Spring region, she is a single mother and the head of her family, her children are 18 and 12 years old and are her biggest motivators each day, she works to further her family selling clothes in her neighborhood and in different zones, she sells cosmetics and clothes which she purchases at a low price and sells on credit, she has been in this business for 10 years. She requests a loan to better her business, with it she will be able to purchase better merchandise and have more to offer. It has not been easy for her to succeed with her children, alone, but she feels that her sacrifice has been worth it and her efforts can be seen in her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marlene es una mujer de 35 años de edad que habita en el barrio la Primavera, es madre soltera y cabeza de familia, sus hijos de 18 y 12 años edad son su mayor motivación en el día a día, trabaja para sacar a delante a sus hijos por su cuenta vendiendo ropa en su barrio y en diferentes zonas francas, vende cosméticos y ropa la cual compra a precio de mayorista y vende al contado y al crédito, tiene 10 años de estar en este negocio. Solicita un crédito para capitalizar su negocio, con el cual podrá comprar mayor mercadería y tendrá mucho más que ofrecer. No ha sido fácil para ella salir adelante con sus dos hijos, sola, pero siente que ha valido la pena su sacrificio y su esfuerzo al ver a sus hijos educándose.

loans.use: To purchase better merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia is a very hard working person, and is relatively young. She sells hardware products like light bulbs, cables etc. She has to work every day because in addition to supporting her family, she also has to support her parents, who can no longer work because of their old age. She is a very happy and responsible person; she is very self confident and knows that everything must be achieved through much sacrifice. As far as her work with our institution, she has demonstrated a lot of responsibility considering she has not had any problems up to now paying her loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora y relativamente joven, ella trabaja vendiendo articulos de Ferreteria como focos, cables, etc, Ella tiene que trabajar todos los dias debido a que ademas de mantener a su familia, tambien debe mantener a sus padres que por la edad muy avanzada que tienen ya no pueden trabajar ni mantenerse a si mismos. Ella es una perona muy alegre y responsable, confia bastante en si misma y sabe que todo debe lograrse con mucho sacrificio. En cuanto a su trabajo con nuestra instituion ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad ya que hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas con el pago de sus cuotas

loans.use: Incrementara su Capital - Comprará Herramientas de Trabajo y Mercaderia

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a careful, hard-working entrepreneur who has a small business selling women’s clothing at an outdoor market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Before starting her own business Lubov had worked in a manufacturing plant. When the plant was shut down, she decided to start her own business and began selling in the market. She has been self-employed now for about ten years. Her business has done well and she currently makes about $1000 per month – a good middle wage income in Ukraine. Lubov is divorced and has two grown children.

Lubov has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to buy an assortment of new inventory for her business. She has proven to be a very responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine, repaying all previous loans on-time. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist her as she works to continue operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Eva is married and they have one son, but her husband is unemployed due to health problems. She started her business because of financial necessity, as her husband had worked as a supervisor on a farm at the coast, but because of his health problems he had to leave the job. The development of his diabetes prevented him from working in order to provide for his family. Thus Eva began her business 6 years ago when she realized that she would need to work because her husband had been the breadwinner and she had taken care of their son, but after her husband developed diabetes money for food and school tuition became tight. She began by selling beauty products, which has given her the opportunity to make money to maintain her home and help get her son ahead, without neglecting him so much.
