Eva needs a loan for $650, which she will repay over 6 months, to purchase merchandise and in this way have more inventory which will allow her to look for new customers. She will be able to offer them more products, and earn more income. With your help Eva and her family will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eva esta casado, su esposo se encuentra desempleado por motivos de salud, tienen1 hijo. Ella inició el negocio por necesidad economica y ya que su esposo trabajaba como supervisor en un campo de la costa pero debido a problemas con su salud tuvo que dejar de labor, el desarrollo diabetes por lo que ya no pudo seguir trabajando para sostener a su familia. Asi fue como Eva empezo su negocio hace 6 años, cuando se vio en la necesidad de trabajar ya que su esposo era el sustento del hogar y ella se dedicaba al cuidado de su hijo, pero por la diabetes que le dio a su esposo empezaron a escasear los alimentos y a tener problemas con los pagos de la educacion del hijo, empezo vendiendo productos de belleza lo que le ha dado la posibilidad de generar recursos para ayudar a mantener el hogar y sacar adelante a su hijo, sin descuidarlo tanto.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y tener mas inventario ya que buscara tener nuevos clientes y ofrecerles mas productos para i generar mas ganacias. Con tu apoyo Eva y su familia saldran adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Djiguiya (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
On average, the members of the Djiguiyagroup are 37 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives in the Moussabougou area of the city of Koutiala (Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

They primarily trade in cosmetics and clothing. They get their supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala and resell at retail prices via traveling sales to a primarily female clientele. They sell based on credit that is payable on a weekly or daily basis.

When looking for funding in order to increase the size of their operations, they decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program, through which they are receiving their first loan. With this loan, they plan to make a group purchase which will allow them to increase their profit. The group estimates that each member will make 40,000 CFA francs in profit, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, help with household expenses, and increase their operating budget.

In the future, the Djiguiya group plans to open a prominent beauty products boutique in the city of Koutiala.

Note: Mariam S. does not appear in the photo for personal reasons (loss of a family member).

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Les membres du groupe djiguiya,avec une moyenne d’age de 37 ans et 4 enfants; vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec coépouses maris et enfants dans le quartier Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala (Préfecture de Koutiala Région de Sikasso République du Mali.)

Elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de cosmétiques et d’habillements. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès de grossistes à Koutiala et revendent en détail de facon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente s’effectue à crédit payable hebdomadairement ou quotidiennement.

Dans leur recherche de fonds complementaires afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premier prêt. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent faire un achat groupé ce qui permettra d’augmenter leur marge bénéficiaire. Ainsi elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen individuel de 40 000 CFA.qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérets du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et augmenter le fonds de commerce..

Dans l’avenir, le Groupe Djiguiya compte ouvrir une boutique de produits de beauté de reference dans la ville de Koutiala.

NB: sur la photo la nommée Mariam S. n’y figure pas pour des sociales:décès d’un parent.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Las Misiones Group

texts.es:
“Las Misiones” Communal Bank is maD. up of 12 people. Its president is Señora Raquel who sells beauty products. This group meets without fail every Thursday morning. Delia, Alicia, Ilaria and Anabel offer cleaning services, Nancy sells in a kiosk, Gloria sells shoes, Felix is a musician in a band, José drives a taxi and Pilar sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

EL Banco comunal Las misiones se encuentra conformado por 12 personas, su presidenta es la señora Raquel que es promotora D. articulos D. belleza, este grupo se reune sin falta todos los jueves en la mañana.Delia, Alicia, Ilaria y Anabel ofrecen sus servicios D. limpieza, Nancy venD. en un kiosco, Gloria es promotora D. zapatos, Felix es músico en una banda, Jose es chofer D. taxi y Pilar venD. comida.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Fidelina habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja en la policía y juntos se apoyan para sacar adelante a su familia. Doña Fidelina trabaja como oficial de policía y tiene veintiséis años laborando para esta institución. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda en la compra de perlines y zinc para reparar el techo de su vivienda que está en mal estado. Espera conservar su trabajo para seguir mejorando su vivienda y apoyando a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Fidelina lives in the Reconciliación neighborhood, is 49 years old, married, with two school-aged children. Her husband works as a police officer and together they support their family. Fidelina has worked as a police official for 26 years. The loan will be used to make home improvements by purchasing perlines and zinc to repair the roof of her home which is in disrepair. She hopes to use her work to continue improving their home and supporting their childrens' education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and perlines to change the roof of his home

loans.name: David Hernán

texts.es: David tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casado tiene tres hijos. David tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también un sala de video ubicada también en su vivienda. Tiene 2 años de tener la pulpería y debido a la falta de financiamiento se le ha hecho difícil poder crecer. Inició solamente con la sala de video juegos, y gracias a unos ahorros puso la pulpería. El préstamo será usado para comprar un play satation para la sala de video juegos y granos básicos para la pulpería, y así de poquito a poquito invertir en ambos negocios. Sus planes son poder incrementar el inventario de su pulpería para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married and has three children. David has a small convenience store in his house as well as a video game store. He has had the convenience store for 2 years but for lack of financing it has difficult for him to grow. He started out with only the video game store and thanks to some savings, put in the convenience store. This loan will be used to buy a playstation for the video game store and some staple goods for the convenience store; in this way he will invest a little in both businesses. He plans are to be able to increase the convenience store´s inventory so he can meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a playstation and staple goods

loans.name: Davy's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Davy K. is the group leader of five all of whom are living in Skab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Davy K. is a chicken breeder and seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Meng Chhuy, helps her in the  business. Mrs. Davy K. is 23 years old and the mother of a two year old child.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Saony Y. lives in Kork village in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a pig breeder.  Her husband, Mr. Souk Savein, is a fruit seller who earns less income than is needed to support the household. 

In order to improve living conditions, Mrs. Saony Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase more fruits for her husband's business. 

Mrs. Saony Y. is 49-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase more fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en: Faalua S., 28, is married with three children.  She has four years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and general public four days per week. She has had previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 130 Tala ($54 US).  SPBD loans are Faalua’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase materials needed to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, fertilizers, and seedlings

loans.name: I Nengah Dwikayama

texts.id:
Berasal dari keluarga tukang kayu, I Nengah Dwikayama memperoleh warisan ketrampilan yang sangat berharga dari orang tuanya . Sejak masih muda Bapak dari dua orang anak ini kini meneruskan bahkan mengembangkan ketrampilan yang di perolehnya dari turun temurun .Ketrampilan itu adalah membuat Sanggah Yang dalam Umat Hindu bangunan sanggah ini merupakan sejenis Pura Yang terbuat dari Kayu dengan ukuran yang sudah baku yang di letakkan di depan rumah sebagai tempat untuk melakukan Persembahan (sesajen) bagi pemeluk agama Hindu. Dalam pengerjaan sanggah ini memerlukan ketrampilan khusus dan harus dikerjakan oleh orang yang sudah terbiasa seperti halnya dengan I Nengah Dwikayama
Istri dari I Komang Sulasmi ini dalam mengerjakan sebuah sanggah memerlukan waktu kurang lebih satu Minggu, dengan modal bahan (kayu dan alat2 lainya ) berkisar Rp 1.250.000-sd 1.500.000,- tergantung jenis kayu yang di minta oleh pemesan. Sedangkan harga sebuah sanggah saat ini Rp 2.000.000-  . Jadi dalam seminggu pendapatan yang di peroleh I Nengah Dwikayama sebesar Rp 500.000-750.000. Namun begitu I Nengah Dwikayama merasa sangat kawalahan dalam menerima order , hal ini disebabkan oleh karena tidak tersedianya  modal yang cukup untuk membeli bahan baku, khususnya Kayu yang kini semakin sulit di dapat dan harganyapun mahal.
Untuk menunjang usahanya itu I Nengah Dwikayama ingin mendapat tambahan modal dari DINARI yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli kayu untuk stok , sehingga pada saat ada order I Nengah Dwikayama bisa cepat mengerjakannya.
Dengan tambahan modal ini I Nengah Dwikayama optimis hasil yang di dapat akan lebih baik sehingga mampu menunjang biaya pendidikan kedua Orang anaknya Yang kini telah duduk di bangku SMA.          .
texts.en:
I Nengah Dwikayama is coming from a family of carpenters. From his early age he is already in the business of wood carpentry. He is now a master in making Sanggah, a wooden Pura (Pura is a temple in Hindu faith used to place the offerings).

I Nengah Dwikayama and his wife can build one Sanggah in a week time. They needs woods for the material that usually cost them around USD 130, depending on the type and the quality of the wood. They can sell one Sanggah for around USD 172. So they can earn a net profit of USD 40 per Sanggah sold.

At the moment he is having difficulties in receiving orders from customers. Sometimes he doesn't have enough money to buy the woods to build Sanggahs when he has a lot of orders. Therefore he applies for a loan from DINARI so he can get an additional working capital.

He is hoping with more capital he can meet more orders from the customers. With this he can have more income to support his two children who are studying at High School.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy teak wood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
34-year-old Elizabeth J. is a pig breeder and a rice farmer. She invests in these businesses because she loves the work and finds them the most profitable businesses. She wants all of her four children to graduate from college so that they can get good jobs when they grow up. This will help them to better support the needs of their future children when they have their own families.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will also buy four piglets and bags of feed for her pigs.

CEVI supports Elizabeth with her growing business. Through CEVI, she enjoys credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is single. He lives in Korolyovo and runs a small business offering hairstyling services in his hometown. He is a talented and creative hairdresser who has been in business for over 10 years. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas. His expenses don’t usually exceed 2,000 Grivnas a month.

Stepan has been dreaming about opening his own beauty place for awhile. He believes beauty makes this world brighter and helps people smile more often. Stepan is seeking a loan of  9,000 Grivnas which would be a significant investment in his dream.

loans.use: To open his own beauty salon

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice C. is 55 years old. She is divorced and the mother of one child. She was divorced a long time ago. She has been providing for herself and her child, too. Life has not been that easy for her. At one point, she was very sick and getting money for the hospital was a horror for her until the government introduced a health insurance plan.

She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. For the past fifteen years, she has run a clothing stand where she sells clothing materials, lace and slippers. When the pace of business slowed, she opened a grocery shop in front of her house where she sells items like milk, sugar, canned tomatoes, flour etc.

Unfortunately, she has insufficient working capital to run her business. With this loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to improve her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality items in large quantities to upgrade her inventory.

She says she would be grateful for the assistance. She belongs to the Maranatha village bank. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials, lace materials, slippers sugar, flour and tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Ufoma

texts.en: Ufoma is a 30-year-old single woman. She has sold men's shoes and clothes since 2007. Ufoma is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more male shoes and clothes to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more men's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
K. Hadiya is a married mother of four. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has been helping him for the last 16 years. Hadiya has a small piece of land on which she cultivates wheat and corn. Her business helped give her children an education, and she wishes to continue the working so she can take care of them while they live with her. Hadiya is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Hadiya and her family thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Linus

texts.en: Linus is thirty-four years old and married with five children. He sells VCDs (video compact discs) to make a living. He hopes for a loan to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Chhit's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is for four borrowers who hope to use the loan for different purposes. Chhit S., 53, has been selected to be the leader by the other members. She is a widowed woman who has given birth to five children: three are single and the others are married and live independently. She stays at home to take care of her children and maintain a daily routine. The entire family’s daily expenses are covered by her four employed children: two daughters are garment workers, while her two sons work as blacksmiths in the village. Chhit S.’s children have been facing difficulty with transportation for a long time. They always hire taxis to get to work. To cut down on the cost of transportation, Chhit S. is applying for a loan to purchase a motor for her children to ride to work.

The other members who have joined this loan are: Mr. C. is a staff member for a gasoline station, seeking a loan to buy a motor for driving to work. Mrs. S., 48, sells some vegetables in the market. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Mr. P. is a community consultant adviser, requesting a loan to purchase grocery items for his wife to sell. He was not available for the photo so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motor

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
A. Otabek and his determined family have been through difficult financial times. Thanks to his restless nature and self-initiative, he was able to learn a great deal and now – thanks to great effort and sacrifice, he is doing well with his business of manufacturing. His objective, with the assistance of his children who help and support him in his daily endeavors, is to provide an excellent level of service and to make his small workshop the busiest in his native town. To achieve his goals, Otabek asks for a loan of 2500 Somoni. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this family, giving them the opportunity to prosper with their new project. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing of a woodworker for the manufacturing.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina T. is from the town of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. Merlina and is married with five school-aged children. Merlina owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling gasoline and cell-phone loading in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell and also to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando C. M. vive en el municipio de Zacatecoluca en el departamento de La Paz. A sus 39 años de edad, Orlando trabaja como motorista  para mantener a su esposa, quien se queda en casa cuidando y criando a sus cuatro hijos. Orlando y su familia solicitan un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales de construicccion, para construir y mejorar su vivienda, que ha sido descuidad, debido a los distintos y frecuentes gastos que su extensa familia requiere.
texts.en:
Orlando Chavez M. lives in the town of Zacatecoluca in the "departamento" of La Paz. He is 39 years old and works as a "motorista" [possibly a mechanic, but not clear] to support his wife who runs the household and takes care of their four children. Orlando and his family are applying for a loan to buy construction materials and improve their house which has become dilapidated due to the various and frequent expenses required by this large family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Nuriddin has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe city for the past three years. Nuriddin began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He began selling in “Ganj” market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Nuriddin is the father of three children who are in school. As any father, he is doing his best in order to ensure his children have the best future and to make them well-educated. Now, Nuriddin needs a loan of 5,000 Somoni in order to increase the range of his stock. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of his vegetables

loans.name: Yapuchiri 7 Group

texts.es:
Yapuchiri 7 es un grupo de 7 señoras que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo, una de las integrantes es María T. de 52 años, ella desde su juventud ha incursionado en el negocio del macramé en mantas, una actividad familiar ya que aprendió de sus hermanos, actualmente se ha visto en la necesidad de contar con un poco de capital para comprar lana y seguir en su negocio, María entrega sus productos a diferentes  tiendas de la feria 16 de Julio.
Al igual que María las demás integrantes del grupo tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de salteñas, repuestos de celulares, viéveres y ropa y todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.
texts.en:
Yapuchiri 7 is a group of 7 ladies that got together to receive a loan. One of the members, María T., is 52 years old, and since her childhood she has been involved in the business of blankets and macramé items, a family activity that she learned from her brothers. Recently, she needs money to buy wool to keep her business; María delivers her products to different stores in Feria 16 de Julio (a street fair).

The rest of the members of the group also have their own businesses like the sale of “salteñas” (pastries filled with meat, vegetables and spicy sauce), spare parts for cell phones, groceries, and clothes. All need a loan to acquire the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials or merchandise.

loans.name: Celia Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Celia; pertenece al banco comunal, TAMBOPATA DE TIPON; ubicado en el distrito de Oropeza, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo y alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella cría animales menores (específicamente el cuy), la socia tiene cuyes al por mayor y los vende al por mayor y menor, ella se encarga de la compra, alimentación, cuidado de su salud y la venta final de estos. Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y así mejorarlo y un aparte para probar en comprar aves de corral.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha D. is 50 years old and is married to Perlito D.. They were given 2 children: Evelyn, 19 years old and in 2nd year college and Cristy, 17 years old and only graduated from high school because she cannot afford to go to college. Editha works hard because she wants her two children to finish their studies through college. If Editha cannot afford to send both of the girls to college, the older daughter has promised that, if ever she would finish her studies and get a job, she will send her younger sibling to college.

The main source of the family's income is their wood lamination business. In this business they develop a customer's photographs and then make wooden picture frames for them. An example is the graduation picture shown here. Since Editha became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she has always used the loans that she received from the institution to improve this business. The wood lamination business provides the family with their daily expenses and the expenses in school of the older child. The whole family works together to make this business run.

Editha dreams that their business continues to grow because it will bring a better life to their whole family.

loans.use: To finance a wood lamination and photography business

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia M. is from Poblacion Aurora, a village in the province of Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Laurencia is married and has three adult children.

To make a living, Laurencia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling Alimango (mud crabs). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crab products in the local community. Laurencia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laurencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laurencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Laurencia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laurencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
A la edad de 45 años, Isidora es una mujer muy alegre y conversadora, madre soltera de 4 hijos y juntos viven en una casa alquilada. 

Isidora es padre y madre para sus hijos, por lo que se ha dedicado al trabajo arduo, cultivando hortalizas en chacras arrendadas y algunas veces parte del costo de arrendamiento lo hace con la producción de sus cultivos. 
Ahora sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad, sin embargo la necesidad apremia, ya que ellos desean estudiar y para cubrir esa necesidad Isidora también se dedica a la venta de carne de carnero y cerdo en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. 
Es así que los días jueves y domingos, está en la feria vendiendo carne, y esta actividad le produce los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de movilidad diaria de sus hijos. 
Pero a Isidora lo que más le satisface es el trabajo en el campo, una vez obtenida la producción de sus hortalizas las vende de manera rápida por lo que le resulta rentable. Lo más difícil de esta labor es lavar las espinacas para luego ser puestas en canastas y enviadas a uno de los mercados de la ciudad Lima, donde recibe un bien precio por sus productos, y eso la motiva a seguir cultivando espinacas.

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y durante los créditos anteriores ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, es muy responsable, cumpliendo con su cargo de tesorera dentro de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para invertirlo en la compra fertilizantes químicos para aplicar a sus cultivos de espinacas, pues se acerca la temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
At age 45, Isidora is a talkative and very happy woman. She is a single mother of 4 children and they live together in a rented house. Isidora is both father and mother for her children, which is why she is dedicated to her arduous work cultivating vegetables in small leased farms. Sometimes she pays part of the cost of leasing with the crops she produces. Now her children help her in this activity. Nevertheless she feels pressured because they want to go to school. To cover that need Isidora is also involved in selling mutton and pork in the wholesale market of the city. On Thursday and Sundays, she is in the market selling meat, and this activity produces for her the necessary income to settle the expenses of daily transportation for her children. But to Isidora what she finds most satisfying is the work in the country. Once she has harvested her vegetables she sells them quickly which turns out to be profitable for her. The most difficult part of this work is to wash the spinach in order to put it in baskets and take it to one of the markets of Lima, where she receives a good price for her products, and that motivates her to continue cultivating spinach. This is her seventh loan with MFP. During the previous loans she has been punctual in her payments. Likewise, she is very responsible, fulfilling her role of treasurer of her communal bank. The money that she now requests is to be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizer to apply to her spinach crop, as the season to sow a new crop approaches.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her spinach crop

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre trabajador de 60 años, vive solo en la casa que con tanto trabajo logró edificar.

Él se dedica, justamente a eso, a la construcción de casas, desde que era pequeño su padre le enseñó esta labor y todos los secretos para lograr una buena edificación y con el pasar del tiempo, la experiencia le hizo ser experto y ahora puede leer planos y trabajar por contrato.
A Abraham le gusta mucho su trabajo y todos estos años lo ha realizado con mucha alegría y orgullo, pero sabe que no podrá estar en esta actividad para siempre, es por ello que para el futuro ha pensado implementar una ferretería, pues es un negocio más estable y tranquilo que podrá administrar desde su casa. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunas herramientas que le hacen falta para mejorar su trabajo en la construcción y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Abraham is a hard-working, 60-year-old man. He lives alone in his home that he worked very hard to build. He makes a living by doing just that, building homes. His father taught him to do this starting when he was very young, and he taught him all the secrets to building good and long-lasting homes. Experience has made him an expert and now he can read plans and work by contract. Abraham likes his job a lot, and in all of these years, he has done it with a lot of happiness and pride. But he knows he won't be able to do this work forever, and that is why he has thought about implementing a hardware store in the future. It is a stable and calm business that he will be able to manage from his home. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has always been characterized by being a very responsable and punctual person with his payments. With the money that he is requesting, he will buy some tools that he needs to improve his construction work so he can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 27 years old. He is married,but has no children yet. He owns a retail business and sells baby carriages, toys and accessories. Alexander started this business seven years ago. At that time there was no competition in this business. Even today there still is none! The business goes well and many young couples come to his store to buy a baby carriage.

Alexander would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the sales area as well as to purchase more carriages to sell. Alexander wants to develop his business further and make it a stable source of income for his young family.

loans.use: To increase his sales area and purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura comprend 4 femmes mariées, dans des ménages monogames, qui ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent dans le quartier Pelengana Sud de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et professionnel. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers (produits de beauté, pagnes, encens, tissus brodés, chaussures en plastique etc.)
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire leur clientèle qu’elles ont décidé d’intégrer le  programme  crédit  de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire après avoir  remboursé les deux précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 tenues de tissus brodés, une soixantaine de boites de crèmes et pommades pour la peau et les cheveux, 25 kg de « gueni » 3 flacons d’eau de Cologne, 10 flacons de parfums et 24 flacons vides où mettre de l’encens pour la vente. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en tenues de tissus brodés au Burkina Faso, en pagnes wax,  ingrédients pour la préparation de l’encens au grand marché de Ségou, les crèmes et pommades sont achetées à Bamako.         
Pour faire son encens elle pile légèrement le « gueni » puis le trie et le submerge dans l’eau de Cologne dans un vase qu’elle ferme hermétiquement durant un mois, après elle y ajoute une quantité suffisante de parfums , bien mélanger avant de le mettre dans les boites pour la vente.  
Les habits sont revendus à Dioro, Markala et à Ségou ville, les crèmes, les pommades et l’encens sont revendus à domicile et en ambulant  dans le quartier. 
Les ventes se font généralement au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 21.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes, circoncisions et funérailles), l’épargne et  la contribution dans la prise en charges de certaines dépenses familiales.
Leur ambition d’aller à l’individuel et devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group comprises 4 married women who live in monogamous households and are, on average, 38 years old with 4 children. They live in the South Pelengana area of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through marriage, community, and professional relations. This group of women runs businesses selling various items (cosmetics, pagnes - a type of brightly-printed West African cloth, incense, embroidered fabric, plastic footwear, etc.) It is with the hope of satisfying their clientele that they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom they are on their 3rd solidarity (group) loan, after having repaid their two previous loans. This new loan will be used to buy 3 sets of pagnes wax, 5 sets of embroidered clothing, 60 boxes of creams and ointments for skin and hair, 25 kg of "gueni" (a fragrant root), 3 bottles of eau de Cologne, 10 bottles of perfume, and 24 empty bottles in which to put incense for sale. They get their supplies of embroidered clothing in Burkina Faso,their pagnes wax and ingredients to prepare incense at the grand market in Ségou, and buy their creams and ointments in Bamako. To make their incense, they lightly grind the "gueni", then hand-pick and submerge it in eau de Cologne in a vase that they seal hermetically for a month, after which time they add a sufficient quantity of perfume and mix it well before putting it in boxes for sale. The clothes are re-sold in Dioro, Markala, and the city of Ségou, while the creams, ointments, and incense are re-sold at home or door-to-door in the area. The sales are generally made in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan from Soro Yiriwaso, provide for social and family occasions (marriages, baptisms, circumcisions, and funerals), increase savings, and take care of certain family expenses. Their ambition is to own individual businesses and become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics, and ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedora.
Isabel es soltera, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones en su casa, Isabel confecciona ropa típica con la ayuda de sus hijas, sus ventas los realiza en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Isabel sueña con producir mas y que sus hijos tengan un trabajo seguro.
texts.en:
Isabel is a partner of "Banco Comunal Emprendedora". Isabel is single, 65 years old, and has 4 children. Isabel has a small dressmaking workshop at home. She makes typical garments with the help of her daughters and sells her products at different markets of the town.

Isabel needs a loan of 600 soles to be invested in buying material. Isabel dreams of increasing her production and of her children having a stable job.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is a 45-year-old mother of two. One child is a 26-year-old undergraduate college student and the other one is a 16-year-old college student. She is married to a driver and bamboo set maker who works very hard to give the best for his wife and their children. They make and sell bamboo set (furniture).

Rosalinda applied for a new loan of PHP 10,000 to continue finance the bamboo set making business. Specifically, the money will be used to pay for bamboo, bamboo strips, nails and other supplies for her business. She hopes that through her loan, she and her husband can save money and get a stall in the nearby town market to display and sell their bamboo set (furniture).

She wants to help support her children's education and build a better house for the family. She believes that through the help and support of ASHI and KIVA, she has a big chance to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for bamboo, bamboo strips, nails and other supplies.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Mila is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells different goods like vegetables, eggs and more in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Saturnina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Saturnina vende discos y DVD de músicas productos que reparte al por mayor a diferentes tiendas.
Saturnina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos.
Saturnina sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Saturn is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. Kuskanchik means “All Together” in Quechua. Saturn is 31 and has 2 children with her partner. She sells music CD’s and DVD’s which are distributed in bulk to different stores. Saturn needs a loan of 1230 soles to invest in the purchase or more music discs. Saturn dreams of her business improving and having her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more music discs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya es un año que forma parte del banco comunal. Ella dice quien la invito en participar fue una de sus colegas. 
  
Gloria tiene 24 años y es soltera. Gloria estudió en la Universidad San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Educación y se especializo para enseñar al nivel primario. Ella trabajó en el colegio particular “Rosa de América” durante tres año y ahora esta esperando la contrata nacional de docentes para trabajar para el estado. Gloria necesita especializarse porque el estado peruano solo esta contratando personas que tengan especialidad en educación, grado de maestría o doctorado y por eso Gloria esta estudiando una maestría en la universidad particular “Cesar vallejo” y paga una mensualidad de 500 soles. Gloria usará el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de su maestría y para gastos personales. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the communal bank “Sacsayhuaman," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. It has been a year since she became a member. She says that one of her colleagues invited her to participate. Gloria is 24 years old and single. She studied in the San Antonio Abad University in Cusco, in the education department, and she specialized in teaching at the primary level. She worked in the private school “Rosa de América” for 3 years and now is hoping to be hired as a national teacher so that she can work for the state. Gloria needs to specialize, because the Peruvian state only hires people who have an educational specialty at the level of a Master's or Doctorate, and for this reason Gloria is studying toward the Master's degree in the private university "Cesar Vallejo," for which she pays 500 Peruvian soles per month. Gloria will use the loan to pay her monthly fees and for her personal expenses. She is very pleased with the opportunity provided through these means, and is committed to making the payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay monthly educational fees for Master's program in education

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia C. is from the village of Cantaan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old and is married. Lucia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lucia maintains her loan amount at 8,000 PHP. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown son. She lives Zaporozhye where sells women’s clothing such as robes, nightgowns, tank tops and shorts in of the local markets called “Krytyi” (which means "covered"). Galina owns a vending kiosk which helps her minimize rental cost. She has been in this business for about 10 years. Currently, Galina has about 30,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise. Her gross income amounts to 5,000 to 7,000 Grivnya a month.  

Galina is seeking a loan of 7,200 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal summer merchandise. She always sorts out good quality items for re-sale in her kiosk. Her merchandise is not the cheapest but she has a loyal clientele. Galina is hoping the current loan will allow her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand. Her business has benefited much from loans she has received in the past. We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Galina and her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Edgar's Group

texts.en: Edgar D. is from the village of Dummon. He is 35 years old and is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edgar D.'s Group. Edgar is married and has four infant children. He owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Edgar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his ninth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa, junto a sus 3 menores hijas a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas comienza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le gusta cuidar sus cultivos de papa y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes, sin embargo lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus productos y aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, asimismo comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Rufina, of 44 years, is a hard-working and very happy mother. She lives in her own house, along with her 3 small daughters to whom she desires to offer a better quality of life. The products that she has managed to cultivate with so much effort and dedication have helped her a lot in the progress of their life. Every morning she begins to work on her lands, since she knows that the quality of the products will depend on the care that she gives to her fields . She has been performing this activity for 20 years and considers that she likes to take care of her potato crop and feels very happy when she sees them large and abundant. Without a doubt the most difficult thing is to carry her harvest to the market of Tarma, which is the place where she sells it, since the bags that she carries are very heavy. Her hope is to improve her products and to enlarge her profits. This it is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all her payments promptly and is willing to do so. In her communal group she is a responsible and very supportive associate. With the thousand new soles that she requests, she will buy alverja seeds (a type of peas) to sow, as well as fertilizer and pesticides.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alverja seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. is from the village of Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has 2 adult and 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a farming business. Lina has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used also to purchase fertilizers. Lina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for plants.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Juditha is married and has four school-aged children. Juditha operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products (including fish and shrimp) in the local community. Juditha has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Juditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Juditha from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 50 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rubén de 52 años y el menor de sus hijos, ya que los 4 mayores viven de forma independiente y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los cultivos de Wilma, son de los mejores cuidados del poblado de Cumutay (Provincia del distrito de Tarma), los productos que cultiva son la papa y alverja, considerados de buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de fertilizar muy bien sus chacras. En el mercado de Tarma, los clientes solicitan mucho sus productos, por tal motivo recibe buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, de esa manera han transcurrido 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará abono, fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus campos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Wilma, 50, is an unassuming, hard working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, Rubén, 52, and their youngest child. Their four oldest children live independently. Her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. Wilma’s crops are among the best cared for in Cumutay settlement (a province in Tarma district). She farms potatoes and peas that are considered of high quality because she fertilizes her fields very well. Her customers in Tarma’s market request her products often so her profits are good. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because she feels that the long months of hard work are rewarded. She has been in this line of work for 30 years and considers the most difficult part of it keeping her crops free of pests. In time, she’d like to buy new fields in order to expand production. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She has always repaid on time. She is very committed to her group’s success. She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy manure and fertilizers in order to improve the quality of her farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

loans.name: Romania

texts.es:
Romania nació y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a al turismo. La ciudad de Ollantaytambo se encuentra ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco por la carretera asfaltada. Romania abrió hace cuatro años atrás un restaurante “Doña Romania” en su domicilio y está ubicado en la calle principal o entrada a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta bastante tarde en la noche, o hasta que se agote la comida. 

Romania desprende una imagen de responsabilidad y amabilidad. Un flujo de clientes visita su restaurante y el negocio se anima durante la hora del desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ella también vende pollos a la brasa y sirve porciones abundantes de papas fritas, una porción de pollo a la brasa, ensalada y cremas. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Romania espera recibir $1000 USD.  Por el momento, su restaurante está bien equipado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para uso personal, ella desea terminar de construir su casa y va comprar tejas, etc. 

Romania es una persona responsable, puntual y pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo”  y hace 6 años que participa en banco comunal pues es una de las socia fundadoras. Las reuniones del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa sede Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Romania was born in and currently lives in the city of Ollantaytambo where the majority of its inhabitants work in tourism. The city of Ollantaytambo is located an hour and a half from the city of Cusco by asphalt road. Four years ago, Romania opened a restaurant called “Doña Romania” in her home, which is located on the main street or entrance to the city of Ollantaytambo. She can be found in her restaurant 7 days a week from 7 in the morning until pretty late in the evening, or until the food runs out. Romania is the very image of responsibility and kindness. A constant flow of customers visits her restaurant and business picks up at breakfasttime, lunchtime and dinnertime. She also sells grilled chicken and serves heaping portions of french fries, slices of chicken, salad and custard. With her next loan, Romania hopes to receive $1,000 USD. At the moment, her restaurant is well equipped with the basic necessities. She would like to use the money from this loan for personal use. She wants to finish building her house and purchase tiles et cetera. Romania is a responsible and punctual person and belongs to the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (Friendship of Ollantaytambo). She has belonged to it for six years and is one of its founding members. Communal bank meetings occur every thirty days in the central office of the Arariwa Association headquarters in Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her house and to buy tiles et cetera

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 49 años,  vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años cría vacas y toros, en el que diariamente extrae la leche necesaria para venderlos a sus vecino o a empresas que se dediquen a la producción de queso; por otro lado procura alimentar bien a sus toros y por el lapso de 3 meses los vende a un precio más alto que la inicial o son utilizados para el arado en el campo. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, encargándose de cortar el pasto y alimentar a sus reses o en la venda de leche. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo para atender a su familia, además de ser un trabajo independiente y rentable, razón por el cual  tiene deseos de incrementar la cantidad de reses que tiene para aumentar la producción de leche. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y un pequeño becerro.
texts.en:
Juana, 49, lives in her own home with her three children. She has raised cows and bulls for over 10 years. Every day she extracts milk to sell to her neighbors or to firms that make cheese. Additionally, she strives to feed her bulls well and after a period of three months sells them at a price higher than the original price she paid for them or she uses them for plowing the fields. Sometimes her children help her with the chores; they cut the grass and feed the cattle or sell the milk. What she enjoys most about her work is that she can manage her time to tend to her family and that it is independent, profitable work. Because of this, she wishes to increase her herd size in order to increase milk production. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very mutually supportive people. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is requesting for it will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to buy a young calf.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio is 41 years old. He is single and lives with his sister. He makes sportswear clothing and supplies his products to local schools and athletic clubs. Don Lucio started working in this field 10 years ago, first as an employee learning the skills and saving money. Two years ago, Lucio decided to start his own business.

He is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other materials. He has a successful business and would like to grow his shop to reach more clients in the future.

loans.use: Buy fabric, zippers and thread

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua S. is into the sale of foodstuffs at Elmina. She is married with three children and uses her income to support her husband in the general welfare of the home. She has received senior high education.

Efua will use the loan to purchase more of her foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to add the sale of other foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more of her foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ashran

texts.en: Ashran lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is 29 years old and married to S. H.. She lives in the area of Kullay Walla in a three-room brick house with her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is in second standard and her older son is in kindergarten. The younger son is only 2 years old. Ashran is a very talented lady who owns and operates an embroidery business at her home. She makes embroidered dresses to sell to cloth markets to supplement the income of her family. She is very good at her art and knows different embroidery techniques to craft unique and beautiful designs on clothes. Her husband is involved in two different businesses. He operates a fruit-selling business and an animal-selling business. He purchases young animals and sells them after raising them. Ashran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his animal-selling business. With the loan, he will buy a good quantity of goats and sell them for a good profit. Ashran hopes that taking a loan and making an investment in her husband’s business will be a good decision for her family’s financial future. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family and her husband’s income will double.

loans.use: To increase stock for animal-selling business

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
El señor Edson vive en casa de su padre en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero, no tiene hijos y trabaja como empleado en diseño grafico en una imprenta.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de impresión ya que como es diseñador grafico quiere independizarse y poder generar mayores ingresos. 

Es  cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 con un historial de pago bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Edson lives in his father’s house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.  He is single with no children and works in graphic designer at a printer’s.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a printer so he can become an independent graphic designer, which will allow him to make more money.

He has been a client since 2009 and has a good payment history, which is why he can request a new loan.

loans.use: Buying a printer to begin his graphic design business.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma D. J. is a married woman who lives in Purok Crotons, Brgy. Doldol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  tricycle transport, fuel sales, and a general store. Her husband Joseph, who is 43 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 14 and 23 years old.

Nelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,500, which she intends to use for the maintenance of the motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of her business. Nelma D. J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of tricycle transport and fuel sales.

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi W., 50 years old, runs a tailoring shop in Kwa Njenga, which is a slum area. He is married to Doris and they have three children aged 19, 16, and 13 years. He was introduced to Kadet by existing customers.

Maingi has been running this business for three years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 18000. With the loan, he plans to buy fabrics for making clothes. If the loan boosts the business he will open another tailoring shop in another town and employ more tailors.

Since all of Maingi's children are in shool and require school fees, he dreams of opening a tailoring training school in his shop so as to earn more profit. This will help him to better meet his family's needs. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy additional fabrics for making clothes.

loans.name: G.s. Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es: Anielca Maria y Doris Mercedes conforman el grupo solidario Luz Del Mundo. Anielca se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, desde hace 25 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio, inicio por que ella no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia por lo que es una mujer muy emprendedora no tiene mucho capital para comprar una gran variedad medicamentos. Su amiga Doris se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, juntas han decidido salir adelante por medio de su financiamiento que será destinado para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Anielca Maria y Doris Mercedes make up the solidarity group “Luz Del Mundo” (Light of the World). Anielca sells medicines and has been in this business for 25 years; she started her business because she did not have any sources of income to support her family; she is an enterprising woman but she does not have much capital to buy a great assortment of medicines.
Her friend Doris sells clothes and has been in this business for more than 3 years. Together, they have decided to get ahead in life with the help of the loan which will be used as working capital.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana L. is a 58-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: pig raising and a general store. She lives in Proper, Brgy. Dungga, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,400. Emerenciana is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Emerenciana hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Angelino's Group

texts.en:
Angelino S. is from the village of Linglingay in Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 50 years old. Angelino is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Angelino is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Angelino buys and sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Angelino has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Angelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angelino is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Angelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAQ MAQUI”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alicia; La socia tiene 24 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende animales menores, la socia vende chanchos, cuyes, gallinas, pollos; La socia también trabaja en chakra, ella junto a su conyugue siembran y cosechan los productos de maíz que el terreno de agricultura les ofrece, la socia también se dedica  a la venta de maiz. La socia ofrece sus productos en la sferias semanales de su pueblo. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para la reproducción y venta final.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alicia, 24, is a member of the “LLANKAQ MAQUI” communal bank which is located in Iscuchaka district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She is 24 years old, married and has two children.  She is a retailer.  She buys small farm animals for subsequent resale.  She sells pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and chicks.   She also works her fields with her husband; they grow corn on their farmland that she also sells at her town’s weekly market.

She is asking for the loan to buy small farm animals to breed for subsequent resale.

She is happy with the loan granted and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals to breed for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed N. was born in 1970 in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and supports his wife and four children.

A livestock breeder for five years, Jamshed is very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial. He is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and the surrounding neighborhood. Some buyers come from more than twenty kilometers from his village.
