With this goal in mind, Jamshed is requesting a loan that will serve as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To acquire capital for purchasing cattle

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María Nelis, reside en San Miguel, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos dependen de ella, María se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que nace por iniciativa propia viéndose en la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos lo necesario ya que aun son pequeños y ella debe dedicarles tiempo y cubrir sus gastos.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería (prendas de vestir), ya que debe periódicamente comprar nuevos estilos y colores en ropa, pues cada día surge una nueva moda por lo cual ella debe estar pendiente y realizar inversiones cada vez que sea necesario.
Su mayor sueño es comprar su propia casa, que espera algún día contar con los fondos necesarios para adquirirla y que sus hijos crezcan en lo propio.
texts.en:
María Nelis is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her parents and three dependent children. She sells clothing for a living, a business that she started on her own initiative after seeing the need to provide for her children--they are still young and she needs to spend time with them and cover their costs. She currently needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise (apparel) because she needs to periodically obtain new styles and colors since every day, new fads are born and she needs to invest as much as necessary.

Her greatest wish is to be able to purchase her own house. She hopes to one day have the funds necessary to purchase one so that her children can grow up adequately.

loans.use: Purchase apparel

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has 2 children, aged 21 and 14. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia also grows pigs for fattening and sale.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Tomasa; La socia tiene 64 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos de (todos ellos independientes); la socia se dedica a trabajar en agricultura y artesanía, la socia es principalmente artesana y ella dedica la gran parte del tiempo a la artesanía, ella realiza bellos y finos trabajos y hace textiles, para lo cual ella desea comprar materiales, y que le proporcionen los óxidos naturales, que son traídos de las alturas, ella realiza los textiles a mano con una tradicional y ancestral técnica, ella toma varias lanas de oveja de un extremo ayudada por un clavo y las estira todas va tejiendo con sus manos poco a a poco y formando figuras y para ajustar la lana y no quede suelta se ayuda de un pedazo de madera larga, de este modo ella trabaja, la socia pertenece al mercado artesanal en su pueblo y hay la pueden ver trabajando sus textiles y exponiendo los otros que hizo días atrás, la socia requiere el préstamo para la compra de materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder incrementar su capital y comprar materiales.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero", meaning "New Victory - Chinchero". It is located in the district of Chinchero, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Tomasa. She is 64 years old and she is married. She has 5 children (all are independent). Her occupation is agriculture and crafts, although she is primarily and artisan.  She dedicates a great portion of her time to making crafts. She makes beautiful and refined works and she creates textiles, for which she wants to purchase materials and to acquire the natural pigments that are brought from the mountains. She makes her textiles by hand, using a traditional and ancestral technique. She places sheep’s wool in one extreme, held by a nail, and she stretches them and weaving them with her hands to form figures. In order to tighten the wool, to prevent it from being loose, she uses a large piece of wood. This is how she works. She is a member of a crafts market in her village and there she can be observed as she works her textiles and she displays works that were completed in the days past. She requires this loan to purchase materials. She requests a loan in order to increase her working capital and to purchase materials. 

She is happy with the loan she has been granted and she is committed to the established payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase wool and pigments to create textiles

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot is 33 years old and married with five children between 1 month and 9 years old. He has been practicing farming in his home area in Litein Town, South Rift Kenya where he lives with his family. He sells milk and tea in the local market.

Cheruiyot is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to purchase a dairy cow.  He believes the loan will change his farming tremendously in terms of income generation.  He previously took out a loan for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he repaid on time.

Cheruiyot wishes he had a bigger parcel of land to grow animal feeds and reduce his costs.  He believes this would increase his farming income.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: The Warriors Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "LAS GUERRERAS " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 10 personas en la cual 8 son mujeres Y 2 varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de sombreros  ropa usada, panadería y refrescos, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Josefina se dedica a la fabricación y venta de sombreros, viviendo así en casa propia, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, los ingresos que generan sustentan los gastos de su hogar y asimismo con la educación de sus hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprar material para la fabricación de sombreros como adornos telas cuero, etc.  La Sra. Elvira se dedica a la venta de refresco, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo trabaja de albañil, los ingresos que generan son para el sustento de su hogar, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de azúcar por cantidad. La Sra. Carmen se dedica a la fabricación y venta de sombreros de sao(sombreros muy tradicionales de la ciudad de Santa Cruz), distribuyendo a los diferentes mercados del plan 3000 , tiene 3 hijos vive en la casa de su madre los ingresos que generan sustentan en su hogar, con el dinero del crédito comprara material para la elaboración de sombreros. Todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "The Warriors" is currently on its first loan cycle with the organization. It is made up of 10 individuals, of whom 8 are women and 2 are men. Their businesses include hat sales, used clothing sales, soft drinks sales, and a bakery. They are from the Plan 3000 zone. The group was started under the initiative of three members:

Josefina crafts and sells sombrero hats. She lives in a house that is her own and she has 4 children, all of whom are in school. The income that she earns is used to cover the household expenses and to send her children to school. With the funds from this loan she will purchase materials to make sombrero hats, including decorations, fabrics, leather, etc. 

Elvira sells soft drinks. She has 4 children and her husband is a construction worker. The income that they earn is used for the support of their children. The funds from her loan will be used to purchase large quantities of sugar. 

Carmen makes and sells Sao sombrero hats (they are sombreros that are very traditional to the city of Santa Cruz). She distributes to the various markets of Plan 3000. She has 3 children and she lives in her mother's house. The income that she earns is used to support the home. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase materials to make sombrero hats.

All of the members are thankful to the organization for the support they have provided them in the form of a loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make sombrero hats

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Chiku I. is in her mid-thirties and married with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling fabrics, beetsheets, ladies clothes and sarongs, door to door since 2003.  She works from 8.00am to 2.00pm (six hours) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Chiku's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her fabrics stock, buy a sewing machine, pay rent and school fees. She has paid back her loans sucessfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy fabrics from the Republic of Congo because they sell faster. Her dream is to one day own a clothing shop.

Chiku will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano" which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other in paying back their loans.

In the picture Chiku is in front 3rd from right in pink with a covered white and black scaf.

loans.use: To buy fabrics from the Republic of Congo.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from the village of Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a business venture in the food sector specializing in snack vending in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately $112 a month for these activities. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: K Boli

texts.en: Boli, 57 years old man is a retired teacher. His wife, Tri, 52 years old, is still working as a teacher. Boli has one son named Octovianus, 21 years old, who is currently studying in university. As a retired teacher, he definitely does not receive as much money as when he was still teaching, whereas the cost of his son’s education is quite high; he has to pay IDR 1,200,000 per semester. To overcome this problem, he established a chicken-breeding business which has been running for three years. He had 300 chicks to raise in his chicken pen but  many died due to the poor, small cage. Some died because they were trampled by other chickens. He desires to improve his business in order to generate better income. To accommodate up to 500 chickens, he has to renovate the cage so he submitted a loan application to TLM for IDR 4,000,000. He plans to buy building materials to renovate the cage and to buy 8 boxes of chicks.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate his chicken cage and buy eight boxes of chicks

loans.name: Nyura

texts.en:
Nyura is trading in men’s clothing from a rented booth at the city market. She wishes to sell more clothes and enlarge her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase clothing and increase the trade.

With the loan’s help, she will get more income and will be able to meet her big family’s needs. Nyura lives together with her pensioner husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a single woman with 2 girls both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Nyamvula has operated a vegetable stall business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of purchasing her own plot in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, fruits to sell at a wholesale price. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is 52 years old woman who is married. Since her husband works in Russia, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. Currently she has two cows and four sheep. She has a land, which she cultivates for fattening her cattle. Now Karomat wants to expand her business and since her children are grown up she thinks that she will be able for looking after more cattle with their help. Therefore, she is for asking 4000 TJS in order to purchase sheep. Karomat expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and she promises to repay the loan in time. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 34 years old, single and has two children aged 12 and 15. Juan has his own business working as a mechanic, mostly fixing the exterior of vehicles. He has been doing this sort of work for over ten years. With his loan, Juan plans on purchasing metal parts and paint to paint the vehicles. He also plans on buying various other parts that he will need. Juan is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint and metal parts for his mechanic business.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina is 36 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children who are still living with her while they attend high school. She has a business selling typical Peruvian dishes on the street. Specifically, she sells coto relleno and french fries with chile.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more ingredients for her food such as potatoes, rice, and chiles. She works everyday selling her food on the street. Etelvina is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, rice, and chiles to make food to sell

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es:
Rosa de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa desde hace 6 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  mejorar económicamente para brindarle los estudios necesarios.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old, lives with her husband and children in their own house, which only has electric service, in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, ranching, and craft-making activity.

Rosa has raised and sold sheep for six years. Her pen, which is sufficiently large, is located behind her house. She feeds them healthy feed and natural grasses, and once they reach optimum size, she offers them for sale at the various markets in the region. In this way, Rosa earns decent profits to pay for her household’s daily expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1500 PEN ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase healthy feed. With the profits she earns she will be able to repay the loan and improve the quality of her family’s life. Rosa is a hard-working and responsible woman. The only thing she wants is for her children to do better and to improve economically so as to be able to provide them with a chance to study.

loans.use: To purchase healthy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Ella Flore Charby

texts.fr:
Cliente  âgé de  39 ans, divorcé et mère de trois (3) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 21 ans et  06 ans. N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses universitaires, elle se lance dans le commerce en détail des produits alimentaires depuis 6 ans.
Ses ventes sont considérables ; elle encaisse en moyenne 30 000 à 80 000 F par jour. A l’octroie de se prêt ; elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 40 sacs à main.
Avec un bon accueil des clients, la cliente à une bonne réputation dans le marché ; elle s’approvisionne auprès des autres fournisseurs de la place
 Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue pour  ouvrir une boutique d’habillement. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle pense acheté un terrain et y construire.
texts.en:
Ella Flore Charby, age 39, is divorced and the mother of three children, aged 6 to 21. Lacking support to pursue her university studies, she started retailing food products six years ago. Her sales are very high : on average, she collects XOF 30'000 to 80'000 (ca US$ 60 to 160) every day.

She will use her loan to bolster her stock by buying 40 handbags. She takes good care of her customers and has a good reputation at the market. She gets her supplies from other providers in the city. With her profits, she wants to put money away to in the end open a clothing store. She's a good mother and she's thinking about purchasing a lot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of handbags

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LUCERO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachona en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Soledad; tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos; la socia tiene su propio negocio, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella trabaja administrando y atendiendo la tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en cajas,  entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes.
Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de productos secos, a la atención de la panadería, a trabajar en una empresa de luz,  a la distribución de bebidas frías.
 La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Soledad belongs to the LUCERO communal bank, located in Cachona District in Cusco Province and Department. 

Soledad is 45, married, and has 4 children. She has her own grocery store, tending the store and doing the administrative work herself. She wants to invest in purchasing rice, sugar, noodles, cartons of milk, and other items. Soledad requests the loan to purchase these grocery products. 

The other members do a variety of work, including buying and selling dry goods, running a bakery, working for a light company, and distributing cold drinks. Soledad is grateful for the support you give her and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Amori

texts.en:
Amori is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 9 years, Amori has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Amori has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and will help him generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Amori hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Amori is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Antonio; el tiene 66 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de autos, el socio vende en forma independiente desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de autos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimientos de los carros para comprar repuestos.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Sagrado de Calca” (Sacred Valley of Calca) which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

He is 66 years old, married, and has four children. Antonio divides his time between his daily activities and his business of buying and selling cars. He works independently from 9am to 5pm. This business enables him to help his children get ahead. Antonio wants to improve his business of selling cars, so he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts in order to maintain the cars that he sells.

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintaining the cars that he sells.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has benefited from her previous loan from Faulu Kenya because she was able to grow her business. She has also improved her living standards. Her desire is to fully establish her business. She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy stones for quarrying.

loans.use: to buy stones for quarrying

loans.name: Ochirhand

texts.en:
Ochirhand is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband also sells meat, and her daughter lives separately. 

Orchirhand started her business in 1995 by selling meat at the local market. She has 16 years of business and work experience in her field. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "In the future with my profits i am planning to purchase a car for business purposes." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single parent with one child who is now studying in college. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wehoya Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Wehoya Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Henry as the group's facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Henry takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Henry had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Henry was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Henry and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Henry will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Wehoya group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Henry is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 12 membres qui font toutes le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Seynbou (debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans et mère d'un enfant. 

Seynabou s'active dans le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'ustensiles de cuisine.

Elle achète sa marchandise dans la capitale et revend dans son quartier. et ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement. 

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 March 2008. It has twelve members who all run small businesses as their main activity. Seynabou (standing up at the far right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 53 years old and the mother of one child.
 
Seynabou runs a small business selling cosmetic products and kitchen utensils. She buys her products in the capital and resells them in her neighbourhood, and this loan will allow her to increase her stock. The profits from her business will help her provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y cinco hijos ya mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y comida, este inicio por que tuvo una enfermedad que le imposibilito la venta de ropa que inicialmente tenía, por eso inicio este negocio en el centro de la ciudad, su horario de venta es de 5:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, condimentos, carnes, verduras, gaseosas, para la preparación de comida de las pupusas, esta inversión le ayudara para su negocio.
Su aspiración es que el negocio sea prospero después de la inversión con el préstamo.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and five adult children.  She sells pupusas and other food.  She began this business in the city center because she had an illness that made it impossible for to continue selling clothing, which she used to do.  She works from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm.

She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn, cooking oil, condiments, meats, vegetables, and soft drinks to prepare her food and pupusas.  This investment will help her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en: Shomali is in his late 20s, married and has one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling cosmetics. He works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. He is applying for his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy more cosmetics to sell to his customers, and successfully repaid all of them. He is applying for a new loan, also to buy more cosmetics, and hopes to someday have enough money to build his own house. Shomali will share this loan with his group, Masasi, which has 17 members, each of whom holds the others accountable for making repayments.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nimia Graciana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nimia, tiene 59 años, está separada hace varios años pero de esa relación procreo 5 hijos, los cuales ya son  mayores de edad pero uno vive con ella,  vive en la casa de sus padres que ya son fallecidos.
 
Ella tiene una mini tienda de víveres de comestibles en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco, desde granos hasta legumbres, pollo, pescado y carne por libras, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio  cuando puede. Lleva en su negocio por más de 15 años y con este negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos después que se separo de su marido, lo cual es muy difícil pero ella con trabajo saco adelante a sus hijos.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres, entre otras cosas que vende en su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para seguir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
The members of the "María Auxiliadora" communal bank meet in Sequita parish, in prosperous Montecristi canton, in Manabí province. This is a place full of dedicated, hard-working people, proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are decent people, who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.

This where me met Nimia. She is 59, and has been separated for several years. She has five children who are now adults, but one lives with her. She lives in the house of her parents, who are now deceased. 

She has a small grocery store in her house, and there sells a bit of everything; from grains to vegetables, chicken, fish, and meat by the pound. She works every day from 6:00am to 8:00pm. Her son helps her in her business when he can. 

She has been in her business for more than 15 years, and with it, she was able to raise her children after she separated from her husband. It is very difficult, but through her work, she helped her children get ahead in life. 

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables, and other foodstuffs that she sells in her store. 

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because of the help they give her to keep moving forward. Her dream is to continue working and expand her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Diana Sofia

texts.es:
Diana es una joven emprendedora que desde muy corta edad se encuentra trabajando con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Proveniente de una familia dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería, y de muy bajos recursos, Diana quiso trabajar desde muy temprana edad para poder ofrecerles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Diana trabaja como empleada en un supermercado de su municipio, en el cual tiene un salario que no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos personales y al mimo tiempo ofrecer mejor calidad de vida para sus padres. Es por esto que Diana decidió aprender de sus padres el oficio de la ganadería y con mucho esfuerzo consiguió una vaca lechera la cual ordeña todas las mañanas antes de irse a trabajar en su empleo y la ordeña nuevamente cuando regresa del trabajo. Gracias a este esfuerzo, Diana ha podido sacar adelante a sus padres ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y accediendo a comodidades que antes no podían acceder. Con el ánimo de seguir adelante con sus vacas, Diana aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una vaca lechera la cual le genere mayores ingresos para su hogar.
Diana espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados por la compra de la vaca y pueda tener mejores ingresos para ofrecer a sus padres mejor calidad de vida y para poder progresar económicamente.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera la cual le genere mayores ingresos para su hogar.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is taking another loan because his 1st Kiva loan played an instrumental role in his business. He will use the current loan to buy power inventor and buck up printer to supplement the existing ones. The loan had a good impact on his business thus increasing his profit margin. John is able to provide food for his wife who is the only dependant he has since all his children are grown ups .He thanks Kiva for their generosity and support.

loans.use: To buy a back-up printer and power inverter supply for his digital photo studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of used up clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy a water pump

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a single young woman who recently finished school.  She joined the SPBD program to launch her own business and achieve financial independence.  She wishes to run a business cultivating plant seeds and bulbs to sell to local vegetable farmers.  A loan will help her purchase some basic gardening tools and seeds to get her business underway.

loans.use: Purchase of gardening tools and seeds

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto C. G., age 42, is a mechanic. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker, she takes care of her children and husband. Alberto has worked since the age of 15 as an automotive mechanic; he worked in various mechanic workshops, and quickly acquired a great deal of experience, finally becoming an official mechanic in a well-known workshop in the city.

His goal was always to open his own workshop, and after several years of saving he was able to get it. For the past two years, Alberto has worked in his own workshop, located in his home, along with his oldest son. He has his own tools and a truck, which is the most important element of his work because it helps him get around to contact customers and buy repair parts.

Alberto is requesting this loan in order to make improvements in the infrastructure of his workshop. He wants to make it larger and easier to work in, since the demand for his services has grown quite a bit thanks to his good performance.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alberto C. G. de 42 años de edad es mecánico, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa, cuida de sus hijos y su marido. Alberto trabaja desde la edad de 15 años como mecánico automotriz; trabajó en varios talleres mecánicos y de a poco fue adquiriendo mayor experiencia hasta llegar a ser mecánico oficial en un renombrado taller de la ciudad.

Su meta siempre fue la de abrir su propio taller, y tras varios años de ahorro pudo conseguirlo. Desde hace dos años Alberto trabaja en su propio taller situado en su casa junto con su hijo mayor, posee herramienta propias y una camioneta que es su elemento de trabajo mas importante ya que le ayuda a movilizarse para contactar con clientes y comprar repuestos.

Alberto solicita el crédito para poder realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su taller, desea ampliarlo y así poder agilizar sus trabajos, ya que la demanda de sus servicios han aumentado razonablemente gracias a su buen desempeño.

loans.use: To expand the infrastructure of the workshop

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia Graciela A. Carballo, 31, is a mother of two children aged 12 and 9. She owns a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry') in her house where she sells products such as wine, tomato sauce and pasta. In addition to her despensa, she just began to sell meat a week ago in order to increase her earnings. She purchases the meat from the market and then prepares the meat for its various purposes. She prepares and sells the meat that is used for milanesa, a popular sandwich, and also for other dishes. Thus far, her meat sales have been very successful because she has many clients who purchase the meat from her despensa.

In a way, Venancia is continuing a family business as her mother used to own a despensa and after she closed hers, Venancia decided to open a despensa of her own. It has been just two years since Venancia started her despensa. Before this, she was a housewife and took care of the children.

Venancia is seeking a $300 loan to purchase merchandise from the market in Itá for her new business.

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru:
Mairam is the lucky mother of three children. The elder child is helping Mairam at the market. Her husband is a police officer. Mairam is 35 years old. She has been working on developing her business for the past 5 years. She children's clothing and shoes. She started with a relatively small startup capital and gradually over the time was able to come to a point where he business is bringing a good profit. The loans from MicroInvest have played a significant role in the development of Mairam's business. She has been a client of MicroInvest for the past 5 years.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Майрам счастливая мать троих сыновей. Старший из них уже выходит на базар и помогает матери. Ее муж работает в милиции. Майрам 35 лет. Последние 5 лет она постоянно занимается бизнесом. Ассортимент товаров включает в себя детские одежда и обувь. Начинала свою деятельность с маленького оборотного капитала, постепенно расширяясь достигла уровня когда она стала получать хорошую прибыль. Немаловажную роль при этом играют, получаемые ею займы Микроинвест, ведь она является его клиентом уже в течении последних пяти лет.

loans.use: To increase product selection

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Ceviche, Peru’s national dish, consists of fresh fish, lime, and spices, and anyone who is planning to prepare this delicious and healthy meal can stop by Sonia’s stand in the fish market to buy all the necessary ingredients in one trip. Located just inside the door of the local fish market in Ayacucho, Perú, Sonia provides the lime, onions, tomatoes, spices, lettuce, chilies, and everything else used to prepare both ceviche and fried fish, another Peruvian favorite. Her clients consist of everyone from mothers shopping for the day’s meal to large seafood restaurants. Every single day of the week, one can find Sonia at her stand, with her busiest days being Saturday and Sunday when the largest shipments of fish arrive from the coastal capital of Lima.

Although she loves ceviche and loves her job, Sonia’s aspirations lie in a different field. One day, she says she would love to open a store specializing in spices. There is much more demand and the prices are higher in this market, she explains. The larger profit potential would be especially welcome in Sonia’s household these days as she has two little daughters ages 3 and 4. Everything she does is for her daughters and she works and saves diligently to be able to provide a better life for the two of them.

Sonia’s participation in her village bank is what has helped her grow her business and earn capital for the past 4 years, as she works towards the many goals she has set for herself and her business. She says she loves to be involved because her village bank has taught her how to save her money in the bank where it safely accumulates interest. There she has also learned the value of punctuality and responsibility. Sonia is currently requesting a loan of US$ 425. This money she will invest in a car which will greatly help her in the purchase and shipment of the products she sells daily.

loans.use: To invest in a car

loans.name: Umarboi

texts.en: Umarboi U. lives in B.Gafurov Rayon; he is divorced and has 2 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. U. has a business in rice selling. He has a straight supplier that allows him to sell rice at a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite, which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Umarboi U. is very experienced in the business, but he has tough competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing assortment of goods. Now Mr. Umarboi U. requests a loan of 1,600 TJS (US$475) for business development and to widen the assortment of goods.

loans.use: business development and to wide the assortment of goods

loans.name: Terma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 38-year-old Telma K., who is married with one child, age 18. In 2006 Telma established a soft drink and snack food café business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase modern cooking equipment and utensils, which will enable her to produce and sell more food.

It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of beverage stand selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--heat is a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase modern cooking equipment and utensils, which will enable her to produce and sell more food.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy M. and her husband have been married for fifteen years. They have four daughters; three of them are studying in the local school and the youngest one stay at home. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. and her husband have been in the business of selling vegetables since 2005. They purchase them from their village and resell the produce at a market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 for the second time. She will use this money to purchase a motor carriage for transporting vegetables to the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motor carriage.

loans.name: Santos Doris

texts.es:
Santos Doris A. G. is 30 years old. She studied up to her first year in secondary school. In present day she is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, in the providence of Trujillo, and in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She sells gelatin and flan every morning in the market of La Hermelinda. She’s been selling gelatin and flan for 18 years. In a large container she carries the cups of gelatin and goes around the market selling it. She was shy at first, but quickly adapted. Now not only does she sell things in cups, but in also in bags which sell at a more affordable price.

She is a member of the communal bank, “ Dios Guia Nuestros Pasos” where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles. With that loan she bought ingredients necessarily for making flan and gelatin. With an upcoming loan of 800 Soles, which she pay back in 4 months, she hopes to buy a case of a thousand spoons, cups and two large sacks of gelatin, flan and sugar.

Ultimately she hopes to increase her business and sell flan and gelatin all over the city.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos Doris A. G. tiene 30 años de edad, estudio hasta el primer año de secundaria. Actualmente es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Ella vende gelatina y flan todas las mañanas por el mercado La Hermelinda. En una fuente lleva los vasos de gelatina, recorre por todo este mercado en busca de clientes. Desde la edad de 18 años se dedica a este negocio empezó con 50 vasos de gelatina, al principio tenia un poco de vergüenza. Poco a poco se fue adaptando al negocio, posteriormente elaboraba en mayor cantidad. Ahora no solo reparte en vasos sino también en bolsas y a un precio más cómodo.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el que compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de gelatina y flan.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara un millar de cucharas, un millar de vasos, dos sacos de gelatina y flan, y azúcar.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, contratar personas con el fin de repartir la gelatina por otros mercados, y si es posible por toda la ciudad.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy ingredients for preparing her desserts.

loans.name: Barrio De Candelaria 5 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca has worked together in carpentry with her husband for the past 15 years. They make chairs, desks and various odds and ends that their customers commission. They have invested a lot in their little business, the main pillar of support for their three children. The income from the business is used for family expenditures and to buy raw materials. With the loan Mrs. Blanca would like to buy wood and materials to make furniture. The other members of her group are Celia J. Yanez (sells shoes) and Martha Yanez (sells chickens).

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

DOÑA BLANCA COMO TODOS LA CONOCEN EN ALTAMIRANO DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN ALA CARPINTERIA, ELABORAN SILLAS, MESAS Y ALGUNAS COSAS QUE LES ENCARGAN LE HAN INVERTIDO MUCHO A SU NEGOSITO DICE, PERO ES LO QUE HA MANTENIDO SUS 3 HIJOS, LAS GANANCIASSON DESTINADAS A LA COMPRA DE MATERIAS PRIMAS Y A LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MADERA Y MATERIAL NECESARIO PARA LA REALIZACION DE MUEBLES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. CELIA J. Y. VENDE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO Y MARTHA Y. T. VENDE POLLO TROZADO.

loans.use: To purchase wood and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Luz Maximiliana

texts.es:
Luz is 53 years old, presently she has three income sources: a general store, a phone booth, and rent from rooms at her home. Luz has one daughter who is economically independent. Luz has a 15-year experience and in spite of competition, the general store she runs is one of the oldest and best-known by the neighbors which allows her to count on a stable group of costumers. The present request will be used to purchase supplies for the store. This is the fourth time Luz is working with our institution and she keeps a very good record of accomplishment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Luz tiene 53 años de edad, actualmente tiene tres fuentes de ingresos que son su tienda de barrio, su cabina de teléfonos y los alquileres de habitaciones en su domicilio. Luz tiene una hija pero la misma es independiente económicamente. Luz tiene una experiencia de más de 15 años en los diferentes rubros que realiza. Si bien existe competencia en sus rubros, la tienda de barrio es una de las más antiguas y conocidas por las personas que habitan el lugar, lo que le permite contar con clientela frecuentemente. La presente solicitud es para surtir su tienda de mercadería. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de Luz con nuestra institución y tiene un muy buen record de cumplimiento.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at a general store.

loans.name: Mohammad Zahar

texts.en: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a shoe shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. During this time he attracted more clients and he wants to enlarge his shop so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make his business more successful and more popular in the town. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Boubou

texts.fr:
Mr. Boubou D. is 43 years old and lives with his 3 children and his wife in Torakabougou, a district in the city of Bougouni in the Bougouni Prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). After his military retirement, Boubou D. is returning to one of his money-making businesses, poultry-farming, which he learned from a friend for over two years. With the intention of growing his business, he decided to join microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso who has just granted him his first loan. He plans to buy 200 chicks, 8 feeding troughs, 8 drinking troughs, 2 boxes of vaccines, 20 bags of vitamins, and 1400 kilograms of feed. He gets his supplies from Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. He sells his products (eggs, hens) to a clientele consisting of professional sellers in poultry markets, restaurateurs, food shops, etc. Holiday periods (traditional and religious), social events (weddings, baptisms), and weekends are conducive to sales. With this loan, he plans to be able to earn 80,000 CFA francs per month, which he will use to invest in his business, pay interest on the loan, and provide for his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Boubou D. est agé de 43 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme à Torakabougou un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni Préfecture de Bougouni ( Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Après sa rétraite militaire, Boubou D. revient à une de ses activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’aviculture qu’il appris auprès d’un ami 2 ans durant. Dans le soucis d’aggrandir son entreprise,il décida de rejoindre l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso qui vient de lui octroyer son premier pret. Il compte acheter 200 poussins, 8 mangeoires, 8 abrévoires, 2 cartons de vaccins 20 sachets de vitamines, 1400 kilogrammes pour la nourriture. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la République du Mali. Il vend ses produits (oeufs,pondeuses recylées) à une clientèle composée de vendeurs professionnelles du marché à volaille de restaurateurs les boutiques les alimentations etc. Les périodes de fêtes (traditionnelles et réligieuses) les évenements sociaux (mariages baptèmes) et les week end sont favorables aux ventes. Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA.qu’il utilisera pour investir dans son entreprise , payer les interêts du prêt et assurer les dépense de la famille.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, troughs, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es:
La señora Esmelda L. se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de pulperia vendiendo todo tipo de ptroductos y granos basicos atendiendo en su casa de habitaicion. Es de necesidad destacar que con este trabajo se beneficia tatno ella como su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en dia la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el capital economico para la compra de la mercadería y los granos basicos para comercializarlos. Por este motivo es que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el credito oportuno y asi salir adelante en su negocio. Es importante destacar que ella actualmente es una fiel cleinte habiendo cancelado el credito anterior en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

For three years Ms. Esmelda Lopez has had a business where she sells all kinds of basic grains and products in her home. It is important to emphasize that this work benefits all of her family including her two school aged children. Today she has an urgent need to acquire capital in order to purchase various products and basic grains and thus she has asked Ceprodel for a loan in order to help her succeed in her business. It is important to note that she is a faithful client and paid off her previous loan in a timely manner in accordance with the rules provided.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Puerta Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Puerta del Sol, se fundó el año pasado en la ciudad D. La Paz, está compuesto por cuatro miembros, que están unidos por un furte lazo familiar entre algunos y D. amistad entre otros, tienen en común además la cercanía D. sus puestos D. venta.

El señor Basilio es considerado por el grupo como un "ejemplo D. vida", debido a que trabaja muy duro para mantener a sus 2 hijos pequeños, a quienes cuida desD. el fallecimiento D. su esposa, y a quienes atienD. con mucho cariño para brindarles un ambiente familiar. Se dedica a la manufactura D. calzados, labor que realiza muy habilmente, solamente trabaja con nuestra institcucion, es por ello que es considerado por nosotros como un cliente "fiel"
			
La señora Olga, en el ámbito familiar, es separada D. su marido hace ya algunos años, no tiene hijos que mantener porque ellos ya son adultos y trabajan por su cuenta, sin embargo tiene nietos a quienes cuida mientras sus padres estan trabajando, asi que además cumple una labor D. crianza para con sus nietos. En el ámbito laboral, es artesana en tejidos, los cuales venD. para sobrevivir.

La señora Elvira es madre soltera, tiene 2 niños peuqños a los cuales mantiene, con su trabajo. Vive en una casa familiar, muy humilD. pero muy bien cuidada. Para sobrevivir, hace manualidades, es muy buena para pintar en tela, con ello que hace manteles pintados a mano los cuales venD. exitosamente.

La señora María Lourdes, cuenta con casa propia, vive con sus hijos a quienes mantiene mediante la venta D. calzados, paralelamente hace reposteria que también venD. con la ayuda D. sus hijos, es considerada una "mujer valiosa" en su zona.
texts.en:
The group Puerta del Sol was founded last year in the city of La Paz. It has four members who are joined by a strong family bond among some and friendship among others. They also share the proximity of their stalls in common.

Basilio is considered by the group as an example of life because he works hard to support his two young children who he has taken care of since the death of his wife. He attends to them with a lot of love and provides a family environment for them. He dedicates himself to making shoes; work which he performs very skillfully. He only works with this institution which is why he is considered a loyal client.

Olga has been separated from her husband for a few years. She does not have children to support because they are adults and work on their own. She does however have grandchildren who she takes care of while their parents are working. Besides raising her grandchildren, her business is selling her knitted crafts.

Elvira is a single mother and has two small children who she supports with her work. She lives in a humble family home that is well taken care of. She makes handicrafts to survive. She is very good at painting on fabric and makes hand painted tablecloths which she sells with great success.

Maria Lourdes has her own home. She lives with her children who she supports by selling shoes. She also makes pastries which she also sells with the help of her children. She is considered a valuable woman in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of prime material.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana tiene 33 años, es madre de dos hijos de 12 años y 10 años, el padre de ellos, lo abandonó hace muchos años atrás, ahora vive con su nueva pareja, Omar, con quien tuvo un hijo, pero que lamentablemente murió hace poco.  Era un jueves por la mañana como siempre salía a vender rodajas de piñas y tamales en su canasta, no presagiaba que su hijo caería al río, después de muchos días de búsqueda hallaron el cuerpo, ella quiso morir y no trabajar más; pero aun le quedaban dos hijos y por ellos, trata de reponerse en sus actividades, por la mañana prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo para sus hijos, después sale a vender tamales y las rodajas de piñas a los pasajeros de los autos. Le gusta mucho esa actividad, aunque hay mucha competencia dice, a veces lo que le dificulta es que no termina de vender sus tamales, entonces los deja para consumo propio, y sus ganancias bajan.  Tras la desgracia que le tocó vivir, trata de sacar fuerzas y trabajar por sus dos menores hijos.  El dinero que está solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de piñas y otras frutas para abrir una  juguería en un pequeño local alquilado.
texts.en:
Giovana is 33 years old and is a mother of two children, ages 12 and 10. The children's father abandoned the family many years ago, and now she lives with her new partner, Omar, with whom she also had a child, but sadly the baby died shortly after. It was a Thursday morning and like always she left to sell pineapple slices and tamales from her basket, not knowing that her son would fall into the river. After many days of looking, the body was found, and Giovana wanted to day and not work anymore. But she still had her other two children, and for them she tried to resume her activities. In the morning, she prepares their breakfast and lunch before leaving to sell her foods to drivers passing by. She really enjoys the activity, even though she says there's a lot of competition and sometimes she has trouble selling all of her tamales, which she then keeps for herself, and her earnings drop. After the hardship she endured, she tries to stay strong and work for her children. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of pineapples and other fruits to open a juice stand at a small rented storefront.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a juice stand business

loans.name: Mrs. Oun Chhoen Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consisting of sixteen people is located in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Oun C.  has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Ly C., are farmers who have a 1-hectar plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. They have three children. One of their children sews shoes in the local village while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Oun C.'s family income is not enough to allow them to fix their house so Mrs. Oun C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to repair her house. Mrs. P. Leang who is a group guarantor is also presented in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to repair her house.

loans.name: Group 03- Đông Hải

texts.en:
Loan Group 3 consists of five poor women, all of whom live in Xuân Lộc Village, in Đông Hải Commune, Thanh Hoá City. Thanh Hoá City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoá province, one of the poorest provinces in Viêt Nam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hà Nội, the capital of Viêt Nam.

Mrs Liên is the lead borrower of the group. She is 47 years old, widowed, and has four children. Her husband was killed in the Viêt Nam War (known in Vietnam as the American War). Her eldest two daughters are married, her 18 year old daughter is in the 11th grade, and her 19 year old son has left school but is taking extra lessons prior to sitting his university entrance exams.

As with her previous four loans, all of which have been repaid on time and in full, Mrs Liên will use her share of the loan to buy pork that she will BBQ and sell in her village.  A true entrepreneur, she will also buy and raise pigs, chickens and ducks. Mrs Liên will use her profits from the loan to pay her childrens' tuition fees.

The loan will be split equally between all five borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan for similar purposes:

Mrs. Tâm is borrowing 2,442,600 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$143) to buy pork that she will sell in her village and in Thanh Hoá City (a six mile bicycle ride from her home).

Both Mrs. Xuân and Mrs. Ngô Thị Vân will use their shares of the loan to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Mrs. Lan is borrowing to buy apples, oranges and bananas that she will resell in Thanh Hoá City and her Village.

loans.use: To buy pork, chickens, ducks, fruit and fishing equipment

loans.name: Maikeronisia

texts.en: Maikeronisia S., 52, is married with 8 children.  She has many years experience in the farming business. She sells to the general public four days a week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Maikeronisia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase equipment needed to run and improve her farming business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, plantsprayer, fetilizer, knives and seedlings

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng C. is 29 years old and lives in Sa Ang district, Phnom Penh. She grows rice and weaves scarves to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 per day. Her husband also grows rice and raises pigs. He makes around US$ 2 each day. This couple has two school-aged children. Mrs. Teng C. is asking for a loan to purchase silk and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase silk and fertilizer

loans.name: Lermie

texts.en: Lermie T. is 31 years old and a mother of 6 children. She is married to Rosalito T., who is a farmer and they live in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is very determined to earn money for the family. With her first loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 5, 000, she started a little variety store. Sadly, the business failed due to the unexpected pregnancy of her 6th child. She was able to make a 2nd loan and part of it was used for her  medication . Now, Lermie would like once again to strengthen her variety store and support his husband with improving  the living conditions of their family. With an amount of PHP 11, 000, she will purchase grocery items to sale in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sale in her store.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Susi Alejandrina,

texts.es:
Susi, junto con su esposo, maneja una carpintería donde fabrican todo tipo de muebles. El negocio ya lleva más de diez años en funcionamiento. 

La idea de tener una carpintería provino de su esposo, quien antes se dedicaba a la cocina, trabajando en una pollería. Luego de ello, trabajó como chofer. En ese entonces, ambos iban ahorrando parte de sus ganancias en sus respectivos trabajos, pues la idea de abrir una carpintería ya la tenían y necesitaban empezar comprando las principales máquinas para el taller.

Anteriormente, Susi también estuvo trabajando en la pollería, pero poco a poco ha ido aprendiendo todo lo necesario para hacer que su desempeño en su carpintería sea cada vez mejor.  Su esposo le ha ido enseñando a lo largo de los años y hoy en día, ella es especialista en los acabados de os muebles y lijado de la madera.
texts.en:
Susi, together with her husband, has a carpentry business in which they make all types of furniture. They have been in business for more than ten years.

The idea to have a carpentry business came from her husband, who worked before as a chef in a chicken restaurant. After that, he worked as a driver. Back then, both of them were saving part of their earnings from the respective jobs, but they already had the idea of running a carpentry and they needed to start buying the basic tools for their shop.

Before, Susi also worked in the chicken restaurant, but little by little she has been learning the necessary skills to make her carpentry better and better. Her husband has taught her over the years, and today she specializes in sanding and finishing the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Fe Y Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Group 1 from the Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress) Bank of Hope is taking their seventh loan through Esperanza International. These entrepreneurs do their activities in the San Pedro de Macoris area, in southeast Dominican Republic. Due to the sugar cane industry debacle a few years ago, this province suffers the devastation of unemployment. This is why many people have decided to become self-employed in order to guarantee income to provide for their families.

Celina F. is this group's coordinator, and she is currently maintaining a very successful clothing sales business. Her sales volume allows her to purchase in bundles, so she has more merchandise to sell for a more extended period of time. With this particular loan, she will buy more women's and children's clothing, which is more in demand. Celina finds "improving her life condition", her biggest challenge. She has six children who are all grown up (the youngest is 16 years old). She would like to see her business grow to one day be a clothing bundle distributor/supplier.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing bundles for resale

loans.name: Ylcia

texts.es: Ylcia es una mujer empeñosa y preocupada por el porvenir de sus hijos, a quienes trata de ofrecerles las condiciones necesarias para su completo desarrollo, y gracias a la casa que logró adquirir hace 10 años puede dar a su familia comodidad y seguridad. Con el empeño que le caracteriza ha llegado a ser muy conocida dentro del entorno donde vive, ya que todas las tardes es común verla salir con su carrito de comida que traslada hasta la esquina de su casa, lugar donde atiende desde las seis de a tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, tiempo que le toma vender sus deliciosas hamburguesas que ofrece a precios cómodos con el fin de obtener clientela que garantice el crecimiento de su negocio. A pesar que las ventas han estado incrementándose, Ylcia tiene proyectado abrir una librería en su casa, pues cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, quien está invirtiendo en el negocio de su esposa. Sin embargo, aun no han recaudado lo suficiente para la compra de algunos muebles y mercadería, por tanto tiene que seguir trabajando vendiendo comida hasta tener el capital necesario para su futuro negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería para su próxima librería, en la cual tiene puestas todas sus esperanzas y anhelos para tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Ylcia is a hard-working woman worried about the future of her children, and she tries to provide everything they need so that they can fully develop. Thanks to the house she was able to acquire 10 years ago she can provide her family with comfort and security. She is very well known for her ambition within the area where she lives, as she can be seen every afternoon leaving with her food cart that she moves from her house to the corner where she attends to customers from 6:00 pm until very late at night. She works selling her delicious hamburgers at a reasonable price in order to attract the clientele to guarantee that her business grows. Even though sales have been increasing, Ylicia is planning to open a bookstore in her home, and counts on her husband's support, as he is investing in her business. However, they still have not collected enough money to buy the furniture and merchandise, making it necessary that she keep working selling food until they have the needed capital for their future business. This is her first loan with MFP, and the money will be used to buy merchandise for her upcoming bookstore, in which she has placed all her hopes and desires of having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to start a bookstore

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Her husband works as security guard.

She has been a member of Paglaum Co-op, a Kiva partner, since August 2006. She has already taken loans several times. Today she seeks a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothing items for sale. She wishes to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy addtional RTWs (clothing) for sale

loans.name: Rose Plus Group

texts.fr: Godefroid K. vend des produits divers tels que du savon, des boites à conserves, du sucre, de l’huile végétale, des fournitures scolaires etc… à Kingasani qui se situe au nord de la ville et la partie la plus peuplée de Kinshasa. Il a commencé le commerce par vendre la boisson sucrée en 2001 avec un capital initial de $20. De 2001 – 2005, l’activité a prospéré et lui a permis d’ouvrir une petite boutique générale. Par un travail déterminant et des bénéfices accumulés, Godefroid est parvenu à réunir cette année un capital propre de $250. Il compte acheter avec le crédit du mois de mai courant des articles pour renforcer le stock de sa marchandise afin de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients en sucrés et sucettes. Il rencontre quelques difficultés dues aux coupures intempestives de l’électricité. Mais il utilise les blocs de glace pour refroidir la boisson tel que souhaité par sa clientèle. Actuellement, son affaire produit $144 de bénéfice par mois. Il espère faire plus que cela dans un proche avenir car son ambition est d’ouvrir une chambre froide pour stocker des vivres frais pour des clients dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Godefroid est membre fidèle de l’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « La Rose » depuis 2008. Il est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 12 ans. Deux d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Godefroid K. sells various goods, such as soap, canned foods, sugar, vegetable oil, school supplies, etc... in Kingasani, which is located on the north side of the city of Kinshasa and its most populated part. He started the business by selling sweet beverages in 2001 with $20 in initial capital. From 2001-2005, it was prosperous, enabling him to open a small general store. Through decisive effort and accumulated profits, he was able to amass $250 of working capital this year. Godefroid intends to use the loan of this May to buy merchandise to bolster his inventory in order to satisfy the needs of his customers for sugar and lollipops. He's running into difficulties due to electric power outages occurring at awkward moments. But he uses blocks of ice to cool his drinks just the way his customers like it. Currently, his business produces $144 in profits a month. He hopes to make more than that in the near future because his ambition is to open a cold room to store fresh foodstuff for customers with the goal of growing his revenues. Godefroid has been a member of a HOPE RDC group named "La Rose" since 2008. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of four children, ranging in age from 2 to 12. Two of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding lollipops, which are sold a lot, to increase his profits

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda M. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Wilfreda is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns & operates a business where she sells bananas and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bananas and vegetables in the local community. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wilfreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Wilfreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely D. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 44 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Fely owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children.
