Perla owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Kit S., age 28, is married and has three school-age children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She owns a business producing Cambodian traditional cakes, typically earning $1 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a construction worker, typically earning $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her husband’s business. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase with which she sees an opportunity to raise her standard of living. By doing so, her husband will be able to commute to work easier and faster to his long distance construction site.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Echalico

texts.en:
Echalico V. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Echalico is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Echalico owns and operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells charcoal made of coco shells in the local community. Echalico is just starting this business.

In 2009, Echalico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Echalico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. Echalico is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Echalico from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto came to the United States from Jalisco, Mexico 13 years ago.  After working at an auto repair business for 7 years, he decided to branch out on his own.  Roberto needs a $10,000 loan to purchase a lift and equipment for his new auto repair shop, Aztek Enterprises. 

Although he has been in business for just four months, he has already secured a contract with a large company to service and maintain trucks for their regional office. Roberto is thankful that his family and friends are spreading the word about his business to help bring him success.  Roberto’s wife helps out in the shop when she can and when she is not busy studying English and caring for their two children.

Roberto hopes to expand his shop in the future so that he can serve more clients and help the community by hiring more employees.  Roberto recently heard about Kiva and signed on to the site as a lender so that he could find and help his acquaintances in Mexico with their businesses. While searching through the site, he found Opportunity Fund and was very excited to learn about loans and business advising available to him in the U.S.  Roberto feels strongly that more services should be available to small business owners like himself who may not be considered bankable, and he is grateful to Kiva and Opportunity Fund for giving him this opportunity.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Roberto from  United States

loans.use: To purchase shop equipment, office remodeling, and an office computer

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en:
United Brothers Inc. is a group of five borrowers led by Ayoubah S., a 24-year-old high-school graduate preparing for university. Ayoubah cares for his two younger brothers. He lives and works on Randall Street, a district in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Randall Street is a very popular street when it comes to business.

Ayoubah's business is in selling building materials. He buys these materials in wholesale and sells in retail to people who work in small construction. He started this business six years ago and is doing well, but shortage of goods on the market makes business difficult for Ayoubah.

Ayoubah is proud of the quality goods he supplies to his customers. He hopes eventually to own a big construction store and to become a successful businessman. He is requesting this loan to purchase more building materials in order to acquire more of a profit. His dream is to achieve a better level of education and to provide a good future for the children he will someday have.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Egharevba

texts.en: Q. sells fire woods. She is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in the business for some years now. She hopes for the loan amount of N90000 purchase more fire wood to sells. She thanks all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire woods  to sell

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, madre de tres menores de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes al por menor, que funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a construcción civil. Eva forma parte del Banco Comunal  “Las Innovadoras ll” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles  que le permitió invertir en lencería, ahora necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos para su tienda, como arroz, azùcar, fideos, leche, etc. 
El sueño de Eva es surtir su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Eva is an active and enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 37 years old and the mother of 3 children. Eva manages a retail grocery store out of her home. She has the support of her husband, who works in civil construction.

Eva joined the Communal Bank “Las Innovadoras II” (The Innovators II) two years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy lingerie. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase products for her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

Eva dreams of expanding and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hector Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Héctor Ernesto M. vive solo ya que esta separado de su esposa y familia desde hace muchos años atrás, mas esto no ha sido impedimento para que luche por salir adelante, por lo mismo el tiene su negocio propio de venta de hot dog (perros calientes) desde hace 9 años. Negocio que lleva por nombre “Hot dog El Chino”, esta muy establecido ya que se encuentra ubicado en las afueras de una colonia popular y calle muy transitada por los conductores, por tal motivo el cuenta con su gran cantidad de clientela, pero en estos momentos tuvo que realizar un fuerte pago ya que compro otro carrito de hot dog y por tal motivo esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración de su producto.
texts.en:
Hector Ernesto M. lives alone since he has been separated from his wife and family for many years. This has not been an impediment for him to fight to get ahead. He has had his own business of selling hot dogs for the past 9 years. The business is named “Hot dog El Chino” and does well since it’s located in the outskirts of a busy neighborhood and on a street with a lot of motor vehicle traffic. Thus he has many customers, but recently he has had a big expense since he bought another hot dog stand. He is applying for the loan to buy more supplies to make his products.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco M. is 21 years old, lives with his parents and sells handmade products in his neighborhood, such as bedspreads and hammocks. Francisco started his business three years ago, with the help and guidance of his parents, as they also sell handmade bedsheets and hammocks. Francisco will use the loan to buy more yarn and dye.

loans.use: Yarn and dye

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from Biray, Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling coconut vinegar to local businesses and community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with a 13-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk and runs a retail sale business. Ivan owns two vending kiosks and sells footwear, handbags and purses in the central market of his home town. He offers his inventory at reasonable prices which attracts a lot of potential customers to his business. Ivan has been in this trade for nineteen years. Currently, his income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month.

Ivan is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase one hundred pairs of footwear to increase the assorted merchandise he offers for sale in his kiosks. Ivan is very focused and always works hard to see his business flourish and grow. He is hoping to invest the generated profit in the purchase of a private house which has always been his dream.

loans.use: To purchase 100 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El  Señor. Ramón Gutiérrez U., tiene la edad de 54 años, Labora como VIGILANTE  en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
  El  tiene tres hijos a su cargo, estos se encuentran  en edad escolar, es Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 10 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darles mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

Ramón dijo que los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que gracias a estos ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón Gutiérrez U. is 54 years old and works as a security guard at the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has three dependent children who are in school. Ramón has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and has received ten home improvement loans. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials. He plans to do some remodeling and replace the roof of his house. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his wife and children. Ramón thanks CEPRODEL for approving his loans so that he could make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is 59 years old and a good mother to her three children, all of whom are at legal age. She is married to her compassionate spouse, Feliciano A. Sr., a fisherman and a bamboo set maker. They currently live at a coastal place, Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal. She has been engaged in her fishing business for more than ten years and also gets involved in bamboo set making as another source of household income.

She plans to utilize this loan of 10,000 PHP to expand her fishing business and to continue to be involved in other businesses for supplementary profits. This loan will be used to buy secondhand fish cages, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish). She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty.

During her one year as a member of ASHI, Pacita has shown very good performance with her group mates and at the center. Having this loan will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a successful business, a better life and a happy family as well. She is very thankful to ASHI and KIVA services for the continued support of her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for secondhand fish cages, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish).

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya T. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 25 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés. Elle est également membre du comité de gestion dudit Banc Villageois. Elle fait du commerce de produits halieutiques (huitres, poissons séchés, poissons fumés etc.) et d'huile de palme. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Rokhaya T. is 52 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group in Wango for 12 ½ years and has been granted 25 loans, all of which were handled well. She is also part of the management committee of the Banc Villageois. She retails seafood products (oysters, dried and smoked fish, etc.) and palm-nut oil. Her earnings allow her to assist her husband in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of portable telephones and accessories

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey first began welding as a boy growing up in Nevada City, CA. 

“I got into it because it was fun. It just came easy to me.”  

Combining a natural talent with metal, an eye for design, and his enthusiasm for off-road vehicles, Joey opened his own custom welding and metals fabrication shop, Infamous Metal Works. 
 
Over the past several years, Joey has built a dedicated client base, first by taking on side-work for customers while working at a metal fabrication shop, and now through his own business. These loyal customers, now friends, strongly encouraged Joey to start his business when the opportunity presented itself in 2007. Their support, as well as the customer referrals they send, has been critical over the past two years, and Joey has built up a brand name for himself without putting much effort into marketing. 
 
In the next year, he would like to increase sales through his website and to hire another employee to help him and his two part-time workers to manage the increasing work load. 

“I wish I could say that I make my own schedule, but I’m here 10-14 hours a day, 7 days a week. There’s always something to do, whether it’s helping customers, ordering parts, or setting up the machines.” 
 
A $10,000 loan will allow Joey to purchase a steel-cutting machine that will expand his design capabilities and attract new customers. 

“I can design a part on my computer, and then use the machine to cut it into the steel. It will open a lot of doors to grow my business.”

loans.use: New eqiupment to increase efficiency and design new parts

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna est âgée de 38ans, elle mariée et mère de 2enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi. Elle est vendeuse de fruits, essentiellement des oranges et des bananes. Et les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Anna is 38 years old, married and mother of two children, both under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for 3 ½ years. She sells fruit, for the most part oranges and bananas. The profits generated by her activity enable her to improve her family’s living conditions, participate in covering her children’s tuition costs and in daily family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her financial autonomy

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Rita O. is from the village of Sibutad. She is 55 years old. Rita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rita owns & operates a business selling fish in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Rita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Aditional capital for the business.

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites D. is from Rizal, Santiago City. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marites D.'s group.

Marites is 41 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a catering business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing catering services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials she needed in order to provide her services. Marites is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be Marites’ fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Bella Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas en progreso que se reúne cada quince días  en la ciudad de Portoviejo provincia de Manabí.


Nuestra socia es comerciante de productos de belleza Yanbal y a la vez tiene un negocio de comida, el crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en incrementar sus negocios, ya son 3 años que esta dedicada a la venta de Yanbal y le va muy bien, se dedica la mañana a  visitar a sus clientas. Desde hace 3 meses ha invertido junto a su hijo en un negocio de comida, en una de la avenidas con mayor movimiento comercial de la ciudad,  la idea fue de su hijo quien le dijo que trabajen juntos y que ella se encargue de preparar los alimentos junto a la esposa de el, y desde entonces les ha ido muy bien , abren su local desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche.


A nuestra socia Bella le va excelente con los créditos que recibe por parte de la Fundación
Ahora con este nuevo crédito  compartirá en sus dos negocios,  por una parte en los productos de Yanbal, tiene que comprar algunos pedidos como perfumes y maquillaje, y en el restaurante necesitara comprar los alimentos  como; carnes, arroz, legumbres y bebidas, para prepara los diferentes platos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bella belongs to the Women’s Community Bank. They meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo in the province of Manabî. Our member sells Yanbal beauty products. She also has a prepared food business. The loan that she requesting will be used to expand her businesses. She has been selling Yanbal beauty products for the past three years. Business has been good. Each morning she visits her customers. Three months ago she invested, with her son, in a prepared food business. It is located on one of the major commercial streets in the city. The idea was that she and her son would work together. Bella would be in charge of preparing the food along with her son’s wife. It has been going very well. The restaurant is open from five in the afternoon until ten at the night. Bella has been very responsible with the loans that she has received from the foundation. She will split the proceeds of this new loan between her two businesses. With the part of the loan that is dedicated to Yanbal she will buy some requested items such as perfume and makeup. For the restaurant she will buy food supplies such as meat, rice, beans, and drinks. These items will be used in her prepared meals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yambal imitation jewelry

loans.name: Salasalan's Group

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Dawo. She is 40 years old. Edna is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is S.'s Group.

Edna is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture providing transport services to local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials for the renovation of her house. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her rolling store. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rolling store.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
N. Salima is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera, in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Salima has a business managing a small retail shop in Kyotera.  Despite her very young age, Salima has had her business for about three years.    

To expand her business, Salima is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more inventory, which Salima will be able to sell at her retail shop. She hopes to create a strong business and to save profits in order to support herself in the future.    

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva, which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access financing at a young age and to improve their prospects for the future. It is targeting a segment of the population that is not typically served by traditional microfinance organizations. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans. It gives Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and to support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for retail shop.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
María Otilia tiene 45 años de edad reside en San Miguel, está acompañada, no tiene hijos, ella tiene un taller de costura, y venta de pupusas.
Ella desarrollo dicha actividad,( costura) hace 15 años y la venta de pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso y carne)  hace 3 años,  trabaja los días sábado y domingos en la venta de pupusas, y de lunes a viernes se dedica a la fabricación de ropa; actualmente solicita un préstamo para que le servirá para invertirlo en compra de materia prima: hilos, tela de algodón de diferentes colores, botones), para las dos actividades con esto ella espera generar ingresos que le permitan continuar con su negocios.
Los objetivos de ella son continuar con los negocios para solventar las necesidades económicas, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Otilia, 45, lives in San Miguel. She is in a couple but has no children. She is a seamstress and also sells pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with meat and cheese). She started her sewing business 15 years ago and the pupusa sales 3 years ago. She sells pupusas on Saturdays and Sundays and from Monday through Friday she manufactures clothing. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: thread, cotton fabric in a variety of colors, buttons. She hopes to generate income from both activities that will allow her to continue with her businesses. Her objectives are to continue with her businesses in order to meet household expenses and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, various colors of cotton fabric and buttons.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. lives in the town of Surallah. She is 29 years old, married and has three very young children. Mary Ann makes a living as a farmer, growing mainly rice. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five  previous loan  from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her crop. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided at regular group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Claudia Arlen

texts.es: La  Sra. Claudia Arlen H. G. ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Cajera tiene  cuatros años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia Arlen H. G. works as a cashier at the Hotel Barceló Monte. She has worked for this establishment for four years. She has one school-aged son. Claudia has had two loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, which she used to make improvements to her home. Claudia and her family have greatly benefited from these improvements, which have improved their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials: sand, cement, stone, and gravel.

loans.name: Marthis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Marthis, porque  es Martha en ingles nombre D. L. boutique D. Rosario L. Tesorera del grupo. Está ubicado en el Estado D.  México.  El grupo está conformado por  9  integrantes. María Eugenia S. P. es L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene  39 años, estudió hasta el 6 año D. primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos.  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. zapatos y colchas que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. colchas y zapatos. Rosario T. G. es otra integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta L. secundaria,  es soltera y tiene no tiene hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropa que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y regalos. Sus clientes son personas D. L. misma comunidad. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente comprometida apagar Quiere este crédito para el crecimiento y rentabilidad D. su negocio.  

Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Martha G. S.             Vta.: traste y zapatos  
Rosa G. M.               Vta.: dulces 
Alicia G. G.             Vta.: refresco  
Anastasia M.D. L. L.     Vta.: Comida 
María Elena N. D. J.     Vta.: a von 
Griselda T. G.           Vta.: Jafra y zapatos  
María Angélica M. F.     Vta.: elotes y chicharrones
texts.en:
This group is called “Marthis” because it means “Martha” in English and is also the name of the boutique owned by Rosario, the group treasurer. This group is from the State of Mexico and consists of nine members. María Eugenia S.P. is the group president. She is 39 years old and completed school through the sixth graD.. María Eugenia works as a merchant and has three children. She has been selling shoes and blankets for ten years. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of blankets and shoes.

Rosario T.G. is another member of this group. She is 25 years old and completed high school. Rosario is single and does not have children. She has been selling clothes for eight years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing and gifts. Her customers are residents from the same community. Upon applying for her loan, she felt committed to pay her obligations. She wants this loan so that she can increase her business and make it profitable.

The other group members are as follows: Martha G. S. – sells cooking utensils and shoes Rosa G. M. – sells candy Alicia G. G. – sells soft drinks Anastasia M.D. L. L. – sells food María Elena N. D. J. – sells Avon products Griselda T. G. – sells Jafra cosmetics and shoes María Angélica M. F. – sells corn on the cob and pork rinds

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets & shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
el grupo Mujeres Unidas esta integrado por 3 mujeres trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias. Ellas viven en la colonia Andres Zuniga, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Lourdes del Pilar D. se dedica a los servicios de costura, tiene un taller de costura desde hace 4 años, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, en estos momentos está elaborando ropa para cama, las cuales manda a vender con su hermano al departamento de  Santa Barbará.
tambien vende CD's y porta CD's.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de Telas, revuelos, cd's y porta cd's.

la sra. Rosmery D. D. se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como ser desodorantes, lociones, perfumes, articulos para el hogar, cremas entre otros, tambien tiene un trabajo a medio tiempo en una pizzeria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
tiene clientes fijos que son sus compañeros de trabajo.

la sra. Nancy Lizeth G. se dedica a la venta de joyas (fantasia fina) y joyas de Plata desde hace seis meses, ya cuenta con clientes fijos que trabajan en varias empresas privadas y gubernamentales.
Nancy da crédito de quince días y tambien vende de contado.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar accesorios como ser juegos de cadenas, dijes, aritos , pulseras y anillos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] group is made up of 3 hard-working women with a great desire for their businesses and families to get ahead. They all live in the Andres Zuniga settlement. The following is a description of the different activities these women engage in: Ms. Lourdes del Pilar D. provides sewing services. She has had a sewing workshop for four years. She creates all types of clothing. At the moment, she is making bed clothes, which she sends to her cousin in the department of Santa Barbará to sell. She also sells CDs and CD cases. She will use this loan to buy fabric, flounce, CDs and CD cases. Ms. Rosmery D. D. works in catalog sales, selling products like deodorants, lotions, perfumes, home goods, creams, and other items. She also has a part-time job in a pizzeria. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to improve her sales and increase her earnings. She has regular customers amongst her coworkers. Ms. Nancy Lizeth G. has been selling costume jewelery and silver jewelery for six months. She already has regular customers, who work in various private businesses and government offices. Nancy offers credit for 15 days or makes cash sales. She will use this loan to buy accessories like sets of chains, pendants, earrings, bracelets, and rings.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, cosmetics, deodorants, lotions, perfumes, home goods, and costume jewelery

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen belongs to a small city of Punjab called Kasur. Kasur is famous for its leather industry in Pakistan. She lives in the area of Kot Haleem Khan with her family in a two-room brick house. 

She is a 50-year-old homemaker. It is difficult for her to work at her old age; that’s why she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a widow and a mother of four sons and a daughter. All of her sons are young and do different work. Her eldest son has a grocery shop in the market, while the remaining three sons have a business of selling leather to their customers. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy groceries such as rice, cooking oil, lentils and spices to sell through his shop. Perveen is hopeful that her son’s business will become better after making the investment into it and that his household income will become increased.
 
He has been doing this business for the past six years and Perveen has trust in her son that he will put the loan amount into his business in the right way.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible person who never missed a single meeting and paid her installments on time.

Note: In the picture, the lady who is standing first on the left is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et habitant le village de Zambougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fourrage de niébé, du savon local (kabakourouni), des condiments (Sounbala)  et de la galette de mil. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire.
 Madame Magninè Traoré est reconnue à Zambougou pour la qualité de sa galette et sa ponctualité de vouloir ravitailler le matin de bonheur toute la population du village en petit déjeuner. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de mil qu’elle transforme petit à petit en galettes. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit devant sa porte à une clientèle mixte. Elle s’approvisionne en mil à la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la galette, elle décortique le mil, le moudre au moulin pour avoir sa farine, malaxe cette dernière avec la bouillie de mil et un peu de levure pour obtenir de la pâte. C’est cette pâte qui est coupée et frite à l’huile d’arachide ou au beurre de karité. 
Madame Magninè Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is composed of five married women, living mainly in polygamous families. On the average, they are 47 years old with four children. They live in the Zambougou village in the rural community of Sanando in Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors and relatives by blood or marriage. Their business is selling niébé [a type of black-eyed peas], local soap called “kabakouroni,” a popular food condiment called “sounbala” and millet cakes. In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Magninè Traoré is well known in Zambougou for the high quality of her cakes and for being on time: she is always has  breakfast ready to be enjoyed by locals early in the morning. She plans to use her loan to purchase three bags of millet, to be used little by little for her cakes. She sells for cash and on credit in front of her home to a diverse customer base. She buys millet at the Konodimini market. In order to bake cakes, she hulls millet, grinds it in a grinder to make flour, which is then mixed in with millet broth and a bit of yeast so as to make dough. The resulting dough is then cut into pieces and fried in peanut  or palm oil. Mrs.  Magninè Traoré hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 21,500 West African Francs, which will be used for savings and for some everyday household needs. Her goal is to start raising sheep and goats.

loans.use: Purchasing millet

loans.name: Silbio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silbio Antonio C. C. tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el barrio Los Rios, vive con su pareja de vida, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian  y ayudan a sus papas en los trabajos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 21 años, y los problemas de las plagas les han disminuido las cosechas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para un mantenimiento Fitosanitario optimo que ataque el problema y se produzca un mejor cosecha que aporte una mejor economía a la familia, mas a los pequeños que pronto entraran a la Universidad y esperan tener los recursos para solventar este gasto para su mejor desarrollo y el de sus futuras familias.
texts.en: Silbio Antonio C. C. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Rios with his life partner. They have 3 young children who are studying and help their parents with the work around their home. They have been farmers for more than 21 years, and the problems of pests have decreased their harvests, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to maintain optimum plant health. This will attack the problem and produce a better harvest which will better support the family financially, especially the young ones who will soon go to University. They hope to have the resources to pay this cost for their self development and their future families.

loans.use: Plant Health Maintenance

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 31 years old and single. He is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for three years and employs one farm hand. His farm produces maize, beans, and chickens, which he sells locally. He solely depends on the income from his farm to cater for his needs. His biggest challenge has been the lack of a stable market for his products.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to expand his rabbit and poultry farming. He says that these projects will increase his income and enable him to start a family. In the future, he would like to do intensive dairy farming by acquiring at least five dairy cows and expanding his poultry business to enable him to sell at least 500 chickens every month. He encourages Juhudi to continue with its good work.

loans.use: To expand his rabbit and poultry farming.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio como una alternativa de vida para ella y su familia con el paso del tiempo Maria logro observar que era un negocio muy rentable y este era el único medio de ingreso que obtenía para su familia. Ella tiene la meta de seguir trabajando con este negocio y agrandar su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado.
texts.en: Maria Ines is 55 years old. Her business is selling clothes and household goods, which she has been doing for more than 7 years. It started as an alternative way of meeting living costs for herself and her family, but with the passage of time Maria has made it a success. She says that the business became very profitable until it became the sole means of income for her family. Her aim is to keep working and expand her business. The loan will be used to buy sheets, towels, clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and married to Simon M., who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children aged eight, 12 and 15. She has been in the clothes hawking business for eight years, which earns her 10,000 KES monthly.

Regina has no history with any other MFI, and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES to buy two bails of clothes to sell during the festive season. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, who has also benefitted from loans.

She is more successful because her husband assists in meeting their daily expenses. She anticipates using the expected profits to educate her children to the highest level possible. Her hopes and dreams are to own a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase two bails of clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is from Tarqoumia Village in Hebron district. He is married and a father of one daughter and five sons. Ahmed built a house and now he is putting on the final touches, such as painting and installing tiles.

Ahmed is an employee with a decent salary so he only needed a loan from FATEN to cover the rest of the expenses to get the house ready for him and the family to move in by the end of this year.

Ahmed's picture was taken in FATEN's office while receiving the loan.

loans.use: To paint his house and install tiles

loans.name: Jeniffer Pamela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jeniffer, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 4 años la misma que estudian en jardín de infantes. El marido es comerciante. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otros bancos.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual es vendedor de carcasas y accesorios de teléfono, su forma de venta es ambulante en las calles de Manta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios de teléfono. Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal, Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We found Jeniffer, 25, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has a 4 year old daughter who goes to kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are low compared to other banks.

She is a housewife who manages the loans for her husband’s business which consists in the sale of telephone cases and accessories.  He sells along Manta’s streets every day from 8:30am until 5pm.  He buys his products in Portoviejo from a distributorship that sells at good prices.

This loan is to buy cases and phone accessories.  Her dream is to have a well built house since the one she has now is made from sugar cane stalks.

loans.use: To buy cases and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Allakabo est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Keleya, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois, bois de chauffe et d’habits et pagnes avec Binta Saganaba.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et une importante quantité d’habits pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Keleya et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Allakabo is a group of 4 women who are 45 years old on average. They each have 4 children and they live in traditional families in Keleya, an important locale in the rural community belonging to the Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are on the sixth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) with the goal of satisfying their clients' demands. This group of women sells charcoal, fire wood and clothing and cloth wraps with Binta Saganaba. 

With this loan she will purchase 10 pieces of wax cloth and a large quantity of children’s clothing. She makes her purchases at the large market in Bamako (capital city of Mali) from the wholesalers. She carries out her sales in the market in Keleya and from her house to a clientele mostly made up of women. She sells in retail, taking cash or credit. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20.000 FCFA which will be used in part to support her husband in providing for the daily expenses, and a part will be invested in the business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and fabric.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 44 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel departamento D. San Miguel, donD. vive con su familia y dos hijos D. 21 y 18 años D. edad, estos estudian en la Universidad, doña María administra una tienda, este negocio lo atienD. D. 7 D. la mañana a 6 D. la tarD., por las tardes también venD. ropa y uno D. sus hijos le ayuda a vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando mercadería y ropa, la intención D. ella es fortalecer el negocio, brindar a los clientes todo lo necesario para el hogar y prendas D. vestir que se ajusten a las necesidades D. la clientela.
El objetivo D. doña María es tener una fuente D. ingreso estable para poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que se gradúen pronto.
texts.en: María is 44 years old and lives in the town of San Miguel, department of San Miguel, with her family and her two children, ages 21 and 18, who are studying at the university. María runs a store and tends to this business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. In the afternoons she also sells clothing, and one of her children helps her with the sales. María is requesting the loan to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise and clothing. This will strengthen her business by providing her customers with products and clothing to fit their every need. María's goal is to have a stable source of income to be able to help with her children's education and for them to graduate soon.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and supplies

loans.name: Yerimiya

texts.en: Yerimiya is a sixty-year-old married man with six children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He rears animals and also distills alcohol for a living. In a good season he can distill five jerrycans of alcohol despite problems in transportation, and his dream is to distill at least ten jerrycans of alcohol and also diversify into onion growing. Yerimiya intends to use the loan to prepare land for growing onions.

loans.use: Preparation of land for growing onions

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José  Luis,28 años de edad, es originario del departamento de Nueva Segovia pero actualmente vive en Estelí , es casado tiene dos hijos de de 9 y1 año de edad respectivamente, de oficio comerciante dueño de pulpería, lleva 3 años en este negocio. 
El negocio lo inicio con capital propio, fue abasteciéndolo poco a poco, tenia 25 años cuando comenzó con su pulpería. Antes  trabajaba como obrero en una empresa. Su esposa le ayuda atender el negocio, debido a que ellos brindad sus servicios a las personas que trabajan en la fabrica de puros, se apoyan mutuamente para poder atender a los clientes. Tienen expectativas que su negocio prospere, tener un inventario mas surtido  de productos para consumo popular. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar suplementos alimenticios de consumo masivo como carnes, granos básicos, pan, verduras. Con esto espera poder aumentar el numero de clientes, así mimo se incrementen sus ventas. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poder convertir su negocio en un mini-super que tenga de todo tipo de  producto. Su meta próxima es poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder pagar el tratamiento medico de su hija  mayor de 9años de edad y seguir invirtiéndole mas a su negocio.
texts.en:
José Luis is 28 years old.  He is originally from Nueva Segovia department but currently lives in Estelí.  He is married and has two children aged 9 and 1.  He owns a grocery store and has been in the business for 3 years.

José Luis set up his business with his own capital and gradually stocked his store.  He was 25 when he started the business, having previously been employed as a worker in a company.  José Luis' wife helps him to serve in the business.  They provide their services to people who work in the local cigar factory and support each other in serving the customers.  They have hopes that their business will prosper and gain a better inventory of products that people regularly buy.

José Luis is requesting this loan so that he can buy essential food products such as meat, basic grains, bread and vegetables.  He thereby hopes to increase his number of customers and also his sales.  One of his future plans is to convert his business into a mini-supermarket that sells all kinds of products.  His next goal is to save enough money so that he can pay for his [9-year-old] eldest daughter's medical treatment and continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy essential food products such as meat, basic grains, bread and vegetables

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok K. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. is a trainer of traditional dancers, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. K. appears in the photograph in front of her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Janixi Del Fatima

texts.es:
Janixi, es una joven de 21 años de edad, es originaria del Departamento de Estelí, esta casada, es dueña de un salón de belleza que atiende ella misma, se dedica a cortar cabello y arreglar  a novias para bodas. Inicio esta actividad en su casa de habitación donde recibe con una enorme y alegre sonrisa a sus clientes   haciéndoles sentir cómodos mientras esperan ser atendidos por ella, comenzó a los 17 años de edad ya que desde entonces le gustaba embellecer a las personas, ha contado desde el inicio con el apoyo de su mama quien ha sido su mayor fuerza y la ha criado a ella solita. Anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio  venta de cosméticos y ropas que vendía junto con su mama. Aunque hoy en día vende productos de belleza y cosméticos en su salón, su esposo coopera en el hogar el trabaja despachando gasolina en la estación gasolinera.  
El crédito lo solicito para realizarle mejoras a su salón de belleza para comprar productos como  tintes, vitaminas de cabello, pintura de labios, peines, cepillos , secadoras ,planchas de cabello etc. Esto le ayudara en su negocio ya que podrá atraer mas clientes, surtir su inventario de cosméticos, tener mas herramientas de trabajo. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta tener su propia academia de belleza donde pueda dar clases y brindar empleo a otras jóvenes como ella. Su próxima meta es finalizar su carrera universitaria ya que lleva segundo año de Banca y Finanzas.
texts.en:
Janixi, is 21 years of age, she is originally from the department of Estelí. Janixi is married and is the owner of the beauty salon where she works. She cuts hair and also does hair styles for weddings. She began working in her house where she would meet her clients with an enormous and happy smile making them feel comfortable while they wait to be attended to. Janixi began when she was seventeen years old and since then she has liked embellishing people. From the outset she has counted on the support of her mother who has been her greatest strength and raised her alone. Previously Janixi sold cosmetics and clothing with her mother and even today she sells beauty products and cosmetics in her salon. Her husband contributes to the household by working as an attendant at the gas station.

The loan she has applied for is to make improvements in her beauty salon and buy products like dyes, hair vitamines, lip stick, combs, brushes, dryers hair irons, etc. This will help her with her business and may help her to attract more customers, to increase her cosmetics inventory and have more tools of the trade. Among her future plans is to have her own beauty school where she can give classes and provide employment to other young people like herself. Her next goal is to complete her university career because it includes classes on banking and finance.

loans.use: to make improvements in her beauty salon and buy products like dyes, hair vitamines, lip stick, combs, brushes, dryers hair irons, etc.

loans.name: José Amílcar

texts.es: José Amílcar P. reside en casa alquilada en el municipio de San Vicente del Departamento del mismo nombre. Durante mucho tiempo ha vivido solo y ha trabajado duramente para salir adelante. Don José posee un pequeño comedor en donde ofrece diversos platillos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y es asistido por una empleada;  a pesar que José es hombre de avanzada edad, está plenamente lleno de sueños y metas que dice él aún no culmina. Desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello  trabaja día con día con la esperanza y fe puesta en Dios que algún día lo logrará. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su pequeño negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de platillos para que cada día lo prefieran más. El crédito lo invertirá en insumos como: arroz, frijoles, verduras, carnes, café, frutas, etc. De esta manera espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Amílcar P. lives in a rented house in the municipality of San Vincente in the department of the same name.  He has lived alone for a long time, and he has worked hard to get ahead.  Jose has a small eatery where he offers a variety of dishes.  He has this business in his house, and he is assisted by an employee.  In spite of the fact that Jose is an older man, he is full of dreams and goals that he says he has yet to accomplish.  He wants to improve his quality of life, and to do this he works each day with the hope and faith in God that some day he will achieve this.  This has motivated him to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can invest in his small business and be able to offer his customers a greater variety of dishes, so that each day they will prefer his business more.  He will use this loan to buy supplies such as: rice, beans, vegetables, meats, coffee, fruit, etc.  In this way he hopes to have better earnings that will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, meats, coffee, and fruit

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Madame Djelika Koné est une femme mariée de 29 et mère de 4 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle exerça plusieurs activités mais sans réussite. Finalement c’est auprès de  son époux, qu’elle appris les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales. Depuis maintenant deux ans elle mène à son propre compte, son activité au marché Bougouni. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'agrandir   son entreprise, elle décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter quelques tonnes de céréales (haricot, maïs, petit mil, arachide). Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants. Elle est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. La vente se fait au marché de Bougouni.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Djelika Koné is a 29-year-old married woman who has four children. She resides with her husband and children in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. Not having attended school, she soon started working in revenue-generating businesses. She operated several business although unsuccessfully. In the end, she learned the business of buying and selling grains with the help of her husband. For two years now, she has been operating on her own at the Bougouni market.

Concerned about satisfying her customers and expanding her enterprise, Djelika decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to a few tonnes of grain (beans, corn, pearl millet, peanuts). She gets her supplies in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages. She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Sales are made at the Bougouni market.

With this loan, Djelika plans on making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan and to help her husband to cover family expenses. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata, aged 44, is married to Justus and they are blessed with four children ages 20, 18, 13 and 10 years old.

Consolata sells second-hand clothes which she has been doing for the last 4 years. The business earns her a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy two bales of skirts and two bales of blouses for sale.

She hopes to grow her business and become a great dealer in clothes.

loans.use: to buy two bales of skirts and two bales of blouses for sale

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush is engaged in farming. She lives together with her husband, a veteran of two wars – Afghanistan and Nagorno Karabakh. Although the husband lost his leg during the last war, he actively helps his wife. 

Sirush plans to build a greenhouse with drip irrigation and increase the livestock. She also would like to purchase special milk storage containers to store milk until milk collection from their village.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and buy more livestock and milk containers.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвел родился в 1962 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Шикаох (Shikahogh). Он женат  и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 20 лет, он учится в Горисском педагогическом университете на третем курсе, младшему 17 лет и он  учится в сельской школе. Жена Самвела работает учительницей в сельской школе.
Самвел работает в Шикаохском заповеднике сторожем и параллельно занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота и выращиванием овощей и фруктов. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (молоко, говядина, овощи и фрукты) он продает на Капанском городском рынке. Благодаря выручке, полученный от селькохозяйственной деятельности, Самвел содержит свою семью и платит за обучение старшего сына.
Сумма кредита в 250.000 армянских драм необходима Самвелу для организации сбора урожая (дизельное топливо и другие сельхоз.средства) и для заготовку сена на зиму.
texts.en:
Samvel was born in 1962 in the city of Kapan.  He now lives in the village of Shikahogh. He is married and has two sons.  His elder son is twenty years old.  He is in his third year  at the Gorissky Pedagogical University.  The younger son is seventeen,  and he studies at the village school.  Samvel’s wife is a teacher at the village school.  

Samvel works as a watchman at the Shikahogh Nature Reserve.  He also raises cattle and grows fruits and vegetables.    He sells his produce (milk, beef, vegetables, and fruit) at the city market in Kapan.  Thanks to the income he gets from his home farm, Samvel supports his family and pays for his older son’s education.   

Samvel needs a loan for 250,000 Armenian drams for the harvest (for diesel fuel and farming instruments) and to prepare hay for the winter.

loans.use: to pay for the harvest and to prepare hay for the winter.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion, aged 51, is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Consolacion has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, candies, curls, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell in her variety store. Consolacion has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, candies, curls, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Luz Beatriz

texts.es:
Luz Beatriz tiene 57 años, es soltera vive con la  hija, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud y trabajar muy duro para tener dinero para la educacion de la hija.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la hija.
texts.en:
Luz Beatriz is 57 years old, single, and she lives with her daughter in the enclosed community of El Progresso in the city of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Luz is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy and yucca. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

The loan will help her purchase more products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations. The loan will help her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plagues and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education.

She enjoys traveling with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations.

loans.name: Frans Jackelyn

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Frans;  tiene 23 años de edad  y es soltera la socia es secretaria de ventas, la socia también se dedica  a la venta de ropa, ella trabaja con su mamá y juntas requiere e l préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor y vender a las diferentes amistades que ambas tiene e instituciones, la manera de ellas vender es de forma independiente y no tiene stand, la socia desea poder estudiar una carrera más compleja pero por el momento ella trabaja en una institución en el área de ventas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Illary III" communal bank. This communal bank belongs to the Huanchac District, in the province and department of Cusco.

Frans is 23, single, and a secretary of sales. She also sells clothing. She works with her mother. Together they need this loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of clothing to sell to the various friends that they both have in businesses. They sell independently and do not have a stand. Frans wants to be able to study for a more complex career but at the moment she works for a company in the area of sales. She wants to invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of clothing.

She is grateful for and values this loan that has been authorized. It will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the wholesale purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora  Sara tiene  treinta y cuatro años de edad , se dedica al elaboración de servilletas , es originaria de la comunidad de  Santiago Tututepec.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos y los dos son varones , Felipe de doce años y Ricardo de dieciocho de edad.
Esta  muy contenta por  que vende muy bien sus servilletas obtiene  muy buenas ganancias y sus clientes  vuelven otra vez por mas mercancía.
Aparte de  hacer servilletas tanbien se dedica ala  venta de antojitos mexicanos, sus hijos le ayudan a barrer la calle donde vende  su comida  y  a atender a  sus clientes ya que  les va muy bien con las ventas de las servilletas y con la venta de la comida.
Pidió el préstamo para compara mas material para elaboración de   sus servilletas ya  que en ocasiones se atrasa por falta de material .
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan tener un buen trabajo y  pongan su negocio ya que todo negocio si se trabaja bien obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sra. Sara is 34 years old and makes decorative serving cloths. She is originally from the community of Santiago Tututepec. Sara has two sons, Felipe (age 12) and Ricardo (age 18). She is very pleased that her decorative cloths have sold well because it allows her to generate good earnings. Her customers come back for more merchandise.

In addition to making decorative cloths, Sara also sells Mexican street food. Her children help her by going up and down the street where she sells her food and attending to her customers. She has done very well in her sales of both decorative cloths and food.

Sara is requesting a loan to buy more materials for making decorative cloths since she occasionally experiences delays when she runs out of material. One of her dreams is to see her children finish their studies so that they can get good jobs and start businesses that generate good profits. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided so that she can get ahead and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making decorative serving cloths.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a father of two children.  He is a Rwandan farmer and he has been growing rice for the past five years.  He was taught by his parents about how to grow rice.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

loans.name: Sayavush

texts.en: Sayavush is married and a loving father of 3 children. He is a hardworking 44-year-old man. His wife is a homemaker and Sayavush is the sole breadwinner for the family. He has been working in his grocery store since 1996. This business provides income to meet the family's needs. Sayavush has a good loan history and that is why this is his third loan. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to add more items. He hopes that a loan will help him improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to add more items to his grocery store.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a 30 year-old man living in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is married to Naisan, who is in the same age. This humble couple has three children who are attending school. 

Chhun and his wife have a small fishing business. After fishing, Chhun and his wife bring their fishes to sell at the local market, which is far away from their community. From this business, they can earn about 3 USD each day. 

To upgrade their living standard, this couple wants to repair their broken house, but they are lacking money, so they wish to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva. This is their first loan so they hope that lenders will sponsor them. This lovely couple is very thankful to all sponsors who are kind.

Chhun is in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to repair their broken house.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, una joven de 23 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León,  es comerciante, tiene una pulpería localizada en su casa de habitación,  debido a problemas económicos no ha podido empezar a estudiar su secundaria se ha dedicado a trabajar, ella lleva tres años con su propio negocio, la venta de granos básicos, verduras gaseosas, snacks que son parte de los productos que ofrece en su pulpería que ella misma atiende.  
Ella solicito el crédito para comprar producto tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, huevo, leche, verduras, gaseosas que son parte de la demanda de sus clientes. Pues al tener más producto que ofrecer podrá vender un poco más y le permitirá invertir en otro tipo de mercadería tales como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Sus planes futuros son quiere  finalizar su secundaria e iniciar la universidad y hacer crecer su negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Gloria, a young woman 24 years old, lives in the city of León. She is a merchant, and has a grocery store in her home. She could not begin her studies at high school because of economic reasons.

She has had her own business for 3 years selling basic grains, vegetables, sodas, and snacks. These are the items she offers for sale in her store.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, milk, vegetables and sodas, which are some of the things her customers ask for. The more varieties of items she can offer, the greater her chances to sell a bit more, and in this way invest in other types of merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. 

Her goal is to finish high school, attend college, and see her grocery store grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, milk, vegetables and sodas

loans.name: Maria Auxiladora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 67 de años. Ella con el crédito va comprar los materiales para realizar las prendas de vestir que le ha  solicitado como zipper, botones, telas, agujas, tijeras, dedales entre otros productos. Ella cuenta con algunas comodidades necesarias en su hogar. Ella quiere brindarles a sus clientes la mejor calidad tanto en la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir pues cada día obtiene más clientes. Empieza su labor desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de que algunas veces tiene dificultades como es la salud pero esto no la detiene a seguir adelante con este medio de vida.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora is 67 years old.  She will use her loan to buy the materials she needs to make clothes that people have ordered from her.  She will buy zips, buttons, fabric, needles, scissors, thimbles and other products.  She has some necessary conveniences in her home.
